analyzed: stobs dang gzi brjid dang ldan pa khams gsum la dbang byed pa'o // de yi drung na 'khod ba yi //
translated: He is powerful and majestic, and rules over the three realms.

original: gnod sbyin bye ba drug cu rnams //🔽zhes bya @36a * //
analyzed: gnod sbyin bye ba drug cu rnams // zhes bya @36a * //
translated: The sixty million yakṣas🔽who stand before him🔽are the retinue of Maheśvara.

original: ba ni dbang phyug chen po'i 'khor rnams zhes bya ba ni ded dpon du gnas shing sde che ba'o //
analyzed: ba ni dbang phyug chen po'i 'khor rnams zhes bya ba ni ded dpon du gnas shing sde che ba'o //
translated: They are captains, and have a great army.

original: bcid  ba rnam pa lngas bsdams nas //
analyzed: bcid  ba rnam pa lngas bsdams nas //
translated: They are bound by the five bonds,

original: mdo sde'i zhags pas kun du drangs //
analyzed: mdo sde'i zhags pas kun du drangs //
translated: and are completely drawn in by the noose of the sūtras.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dod ba'i yon tan sngas bsdams shing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dod ba'i yon tan sngas bsdams shing /
translated: They are bound by the five bonds of the sense objects,🔽and are completely drawn in by the noose of the sūtras.

original: rig sngags kyi dmod mo'i zhags pas bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi dmod mo'i zhags pas bsdams pa'o //
translated: Bound by the noose of the curse of the vidyā.

original: 'byung po 'joms pa'i ri la ni //
analyzed: 'byung po 'joms pa'i ri la ni //
translated: On the mountain that destroys bhūtas,

original: 'byung po thams cad lhags nas su //
analyzed: 'byung po thams cad lhags nas su //
translated: all bhūtas have gathered.

original: zhes bya ba ni rigs mi gcig ba'i gdon thams cad gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rigs mi gcig ba'i gdon thams cad gnas pa'o //
translated: This means that all the grahas of different types reside there.

original: 'joms pa ni rig sngags kyis 'joms pa'o //🔽rigs sngags thams cad 'byung ba'i gnas //
analyzed: 'joms pa ni rig sngags kyis 'joms pa'o // rigs sngags thams cad 'byung ba'i gnas //
translated: Destroyed means destroyed by the vidyā.🔽The abode of all vidyā mantras,

original: rig sngags 'di ni kun du bsam //
analyzed: rig sngags 'di ni kun du bsam //
translated: this vidyā is contemplated everywhere.

original: zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin thams cad la khyab pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin thams cad la khyab pa /
translated: This means pervading everywhere like space,

original: sems can dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa skyed pa'i yum lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems can dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa skyed pa'i yum lta bu'o //
translated: like the mother who gives birth to sentient beings, bodhisattvas, and so forth.

original: chad pa mi bzad drag po ste //
analyzed: chad pa mi bzad drag po ste //
translated: The unbearable, fierce punishment,

original: gang phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs //
analyzed: gang phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs //
translated: because it is taught by the buddhas.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs pa /
translated: This means taught by the buddhas of the past, future, and present.

original: gzhan rnams kyis mi thub pa dmod mo'i chad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyis mi thub pa dmod mo'i chad pa'o //
translated: The punishment of the curse that cannot be overcome by others.

original: sangs rgyas la ni gus par ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la ni gus par ni //
translated: With devotion to the Buddha,

original: thams cad 'di la skyabs su song //
analyzed: thams cad 'di la skyabs su song //
translated: all take refuge in this.

original: zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa la skyabs su 'dong zhing zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa la skyabs su 'dong zhing zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is I go for refuge to the Perfectly Awakened One, Shakyamuni.

original: dam ba'i chos rig sngags la gus pa'o //
analyzed: dam ba'i chos rig sngags la gus pa'o //
translated: This is I revere the Dharma and the Knowledge-Mantra.

original: g-yo med par ni rjes zhugs shing //
analyzed: g-yo med par ni rjes zhugs shing //
translated: Without deceit, I will follow

original: thams cad med par gyur ta re //
analyzed: thams cad med par gyur ta re //
translated: and all will be destroyed.

original: zhes bya ba ni brdzun mi smra bar sems can mi slu bas te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brdzun mi smra bar sems can mi slu bas te /
translated: This is I will not deceive sentient beings by lying.

original: stong pa'i rang bzhin du snang ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa'i rang bzhin du snang ba'o //
translated: This is I will appear as the nature of emptiness.

original: de nas thang cig tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: de nas thang cig tsam gyis ni //
translated: Then, in an instant,

original: 'byung po mang po thams cad lhags //
analyzed: 'byung po mang po thams cad lhags //
translated: all the many spirits will gather.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs sna tshogs su snang ba'i 'byung po rnams kyang //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs sna tshogs su snang ba'i 'byung po rnams kyang //
translated: This is The spirits who appear in various forms

original: rig sngags kyi ye shes zhags pas drangs nas /
analyzed: rig sngags kyi ye shes zhags pas drangs nas /
translated: are drawn by the lasso of the knowledge-mantra.

original: phyogs bzhir snang ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs bzhir snang ba'o //
translated: This is They appear in the four directions.🔽 Mountains, cliffs, oceans, lakes,🔽This is The abodes of the spirits are endowed with those.

original: ri rnams dang ni g-yang sa dang // rgya mtsho dang ni mtsho rnams dang // zhes bya ba ni 'byung po'i gnas ni de rnams dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ri rnams dang ni g-yang sa dang // rgya mtsho dang ni mtsho rnams dang // zhes bya ba ni 'byung po'i gnas ni de rnams dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Mountains, precipices, oceans, and lakes.🔽This is the abode of beings, endowed with these.

original: klung dang 'bab chu lu ma dang // dba' klong dag na gang 'khod dang // zhes bya ba ni de dang ldan pa'i gnas su bsdad cing /
analyzed: klung dang 'bab chu lu ma dang // dba' klong dag na gang 'khod dang // zhes bya ba ni de dang ldan pa'i gnas su bsdad cing /
translated: they dwell in places that are associated with them.

original: sems can rnams la gnod pa byed pa'o //🔽skyed mos tshal dang gzhal med khang //🔽kun dga' dang ni nags rnams dang // zhes bya ba ni 'byung po rnams gnas gcig tu mi /
analyzed: sems can rnams la gnod pa byed pa'o // skyed mos tshal dang gzhal med khang // kun dga' dang ni nags rnams dang // zhes bya ba ni 'byung po rnams gnas gcig tu mi /
translated: They harm sentient beings.🔽In gardens and palaces,🔽in groves and forests,

original: @36b gnas te /
analyzed: @36b gnas te /
translated: they do not dwell in one place.

original: gzugs sna tshogs su snang ba'o //🔽mchod rten gnas dang grong gi gnas //
analyzed: gzugs sna tshogs su snang ba'o // mchod rten gnas dang grong gi gnas //
translated: They appear in various forms.🔽In temples, inhabited places,🔽and at the foot of trees,

original: shing ljon drung na gang gnas dang // zhes bya ba ni gnas de dang de la gnas shing /
analyzed: shing ljon drung na gang gnas dang // zhes bya ba ni gnas de dang de la gnas shing /
translated: they dwell in such places.

original: 'jig rten khams su rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams su rgyu ba'o //
translated: They move around in the world.🔽In cities, towns,🔽and villages,

original: grod  khyer sgo dang grong rnams dang // grod  rdal dang ni ljongs rnams dang// zhes bya ba ni 'byung po tshan gcig ni grong dang grong khyer rnams su rgyu zhing /
analyzed: grod  khyer sgo dang grong rnams dang // grod  rdal dang ni ljongs rnams dang// zhes bya ba ni 'byung po tshan gcig ni grong dang grong khyer rnams su rgyu zhing /
translated: one type of spirit moves around in towns and cities,

original: sems can rnams la glags tshol ba'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la glags tshol ba'o //
translated: and they seek opportunities to harm sentient beings.

original: rgyal po'i pho brang sgo rnams dang // gzhal med khang na gnas pa dang // zhes bya ba ni tshan gcig kyang rgyal po la gnod pa byed pa rnams /
analyzed: rgyal po'i pho brang sgo rnams dang // gzhal med khang na gnas pa dang // zhes bya ba ni tshan gcig kyang rgyal po la gnod pa byed pa rnams /
translated: This is one group that harms the king.

original: gnas der bsdad cing glags tshol ba'o //
analyzed: gnas der bsdad cing glags tshol ba'o //
translated: They dwell in those places, seeking an opportunity.🔽In the maṇḍalas, charnel grounds,

original: dkyil 'khor dag dang dur khrod dang // de bzhin lha khang rnams dang ni //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dag dang dur khrod dang // de bzhin lha khang rnams dang ni //
translated: and likewise in the temples,

original: zhes bya ba ni tshan gcig ni lha khang rnyid pa la chags shing dge ba la bar chod byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshan gcig ni lha khang rnyid pa la chags shing dge ba la bar chod byed pa'o //
translated: This is one group that is attached to old temples and creates obstacles for the virtuous.🔽In the border and tollgate places,🔽in empty houses and on river banks,

original: mtshams dang sho gam gnas rnams dang // khang stong dang ni gram sa dang // zhes bya ba ni de dang der ldan pa'i gnas su bsdad cing /
analyzed: mtshams dang sho gam gnas rnams dang // khang stong dang ni gram sa dang // zhes bya ba ni de dang der ldan pa'i gnas su bsdad cing /
translated: They dwell in places endowed with those,

original: gzugs mi gcig par snang ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs mi gcig par snang ba'o //
translated: appearing with different forms.🔽The yakṣas who are above and below,

original: gnod sbyin gang rnams bla 'og dang // phyogs bzhi dang ni mtshams rnams nas //
analyzed: gnod sbyin gang rnams bla 'og dang // phyogs bzhi dang ni mtshams rnams nas //
translated: in the four directions and the intermediate directions,

original: zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin de dang ldan pa ni //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin de dang ldan pa ni //
translated: Those endowed with those yakṣas

original: phyogs mtshams brgyad du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs mtshams brgyad du gnas pa'o //
translated: dwell in the eight directions and intermediate directions.

original: gnod sbyin byi ba stong rnams ni //
analyzed: gnod sbyin byi ba stong rnams ni //
translated: and a thousand yakṣa-rats

original: rig sngags zhags pas bkug pa rnams //
analyzed: rig sngags zhags pas bkug pa rnams //
translated: are summoned by the noose of the vidyā-mantra.

original: zhes bya ba ni /🔽stong phrag de dang de yod pa //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni / stong phrag de dang de yod pa //
translated: This means:🔽Those who exist in the thousands

original: ma rungs pa yi 'byung po rnams //
analyzed: ma rungs pa yi 'byung po rnams //
translated: are the wicked bhūtas

original: rig sngags kyi dmod mo'i zhags pas 'dren pa'o //🔽rdza rnga dag ni brdungs nas su //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi dmod mo'i zhags pas 'dren pa'o // rdza rnga dag ni brdungs nas su //
translated: who are led by the noose of the curse of the vidyā-mantra.🔽Beating clay drums

original: la las rdza zlum ngag ni brdungs //
analyzed: la las rdza zlum ngag ni brdungs //
translated: some beat clay drums.

original: zhes bya ba ni sgra la dga' ba'i gnod sbyin rnams bsam gyis mi khyab par snang ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sgra la dga' ba'i gnod sbyin rnams bsam gyis mi khyab par snang ba'o //
translated: This means that the yakṣas who delight in sound appear inconceivably.

original: pi wang gling bu khar ba'i rnga //
analyzed: pi wang gling bu khar ba'i rnga //
translated: Lutes, flutes, and conch shells

original: stobs chen dag ni sgra 'byin te //
analyzed: stobs chen dag ni sgra 'byin te //
translated: make great sounds.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshan gcig kyang rol mo la dga' zhing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshan gcig kyang rol mo la dga' zhing /
translated: This means that even a single one delights in music

original: sems can rnams la gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: and harms sentient beings.🔽Having made various musical sounds,

original: rol mo'i sgra dbyangs sna tshogs dang // glu dang gar rnams byas nas su //
analyzed: rol mo'i sgra dbyangs sna tshogs dang // glu dang gar rnams byas nas su //
translated: songs and dances,

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams slu ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams slu ba'o //
translated: this means deceiving sentient beings.

original: dbang po zla ba chu lha dang // bar dhva dza skye dgu'i bdag / ces pa ni gnod sbyin gyi ded dpon sum cu rtsa gnyis su gnas shing //
analyzed: dbang po zla ba chu lha dang // bar dhva dza skye dgu'i bdag / ces pa ni gnod sbyin gyi ded dpon sum cu rtsa gnyis su gnas shing //
translated: Indra, Chandra, Varuna,🔽and Vayu, lord of beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa srung ba dag go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa srung ba dag go //
translated: These are the thirty-two Yaksha leaders who guard the Buddha's teachings.

original: mi ldan pa dang kun du lta //
analyzed: mi ldan pa dang kun du lta //
translated: The non-associated, the all-seeing,

original: mngon shes @37a * //
analyzed: mngon shes @37a * //
translated: the superknowledges,🔽the perfect ones of the snow mountains,

original: gangs can rdzogs pa dang // zhes bya ba ni de rnams la yang de'i sder bcas shing /
analyzed: gangs can rdzogs pa dang // zhes bya ba ni de rnams la yang de'i sder bcas shing /
translated: and so forth, are their retinues.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rgyu ba'o //
translated: They roam the worlds of the ten directions.🔽Candana, Varada,🔽Sugraiva, and Sugraiva,

original: tsandan dang ni 'dod mchog dang // mgul pa mdzes dang mgul nges dang // zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyis kyang sems can gyi don byas shing /
analyzed: tsandan dang ni 'dod mchog dang // mgul pa mdzes dang mgul nges dang // zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyis kyang sems can gyi don byas shing /
translated: and so forth, benefit sentient beings.

original: rig sngags la gus pa'o //
analyzed: rig sngags la gus pa'o //
translated: They are devoted to the knowledge mantras.🔽The lord of beings,🔽the non-associated one arisen from the gods,

original: skye dgu'i bla mar gyur pa dang // lha las byung ba'i ma ldan dang // zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin gyi tshan de dang der ldan zhing /
analyzed: skye dgu'i bla mar gyur pa dang // lha las byung ba'i ma ldan dang // zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin gyi tshan de dang der ldan zhing /
translated: and so forth, are the Yakshas who possess those ranks.

original: nam mkha' dang / sa steng sa 'og tu rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang / sa steng sa 'og tu rgyu ba'o //
translated: They roam the sky, the earth, and the underworld.

original: dri za sna tshogs sde dang ni //
analyzed: dri za sna tshogs sde dang ni //
translated: Gandharva, Viśākha,🔽and the human king, the bull of a conqueror.

original: mi rgyal rgyal ba khyu mchog dang // zhes bya ba ni sde po cher grags shing stobs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mi rgyal rgyal ba khyu mchog dang // zhes bya ba ni sde po cher grags shing stobs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is said that he has a great army and is powerful.

original: de bzhin phung bu lnga zhes bya //
analyzed: de bzhin phung bu lnga zhes bya //
translated: Similarly, he is called the one with five aggregates.🔽He is called the one with the sun's rays,

original: g-yer ma dang ni nyi zer dang // zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i 'od dang ldan pa /
analyzed: g-yer ma dang ni nyi zer dang // zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i 'od dang ldan pa /
translated: endowed with the light of the sun,

original: yud tsam gyis stong gsum khyab pa'o //🔽nya lcibs dang ni ral gyi bu //
analyzed: yud tsam gyis stong gsum khyab pa'o // nya lcibs dang ni ral gyi bu //
translated: pervading the trichiliocosm in an instant.🔽He is called the one with the fish's womb, the one with the sword,

original: gun gyi bshes dang grags 'dzin dang // zhes bya ba ni 'byung po sde tshan de dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gun gyi bshes dang grags 'dzin dang // zhes bya ba ni 'byung po sde tshan de dang ldan pa /
translated: the one with the friend of the forest, and the one who upholds fame.🔽Thus, he is endowed with that class of spirits,

original: ral gri bzhin du rno ba'o //
analyzed: ral gri bzhin du rno ba'o //
translated: sharp like a sword.🔽He is called the one who dwells in the forest, the one with a good mind,

original: 'brog gnas dang ni yid bzangs dang // khab rna dang ni ri sul kha //
analyzed: 'brog gnas dang ni yid bzangs dang // khab rna dang ni ri sul kha //
translated: the one with the needle ears, and the one with the mountain ravine.

original: zhes bya ba ni sde bo che nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sde bo che nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa /
translated: Thus, he is endowed with a great army of twenty-two,

original: de rnams yang gzugs sna tshogs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams yang gzugs sna tshogs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: all of them endowed with various forms.

original: lnga 'dzin dang ni khab bzangs dag /
analyzed: lnga 'dzin dang ni khab bzangs dag /
translated: He is called the one who holds the five, the one with the good needle,

original: sde dang dpung dang bzhon par bcas //
analyzed: sde dang dpung dang bzhon par bcas //
translated: together with the army, the forces, and the mounts.

original: zhes bya ba ni stobs dang ldan pa sde bo char grags pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni stobs dang ldan pa sde bo char grags pa'o //
translated: This is the powerful one known as the great army.🔽Gods, nagas, gandharvas,

original: lha dang klu dang dri za dang // gnod sbyin 'byung po lha ma yin //
analyzed: lha dang klu dang dri za dang // gnod sbyin 'byung po lha ma yin //
translated: yakshas, bhutas, and asuras,

original: zhes bya ba ni gdon rigs mi gcig pa lha'i gdon la sogs pa stong phrag brgyad cu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gdon rigs mi gcig pa lha'i gdon la sogs pa stong phrag brgyad cu'o //
translated: This is the eighty-four thousand different types of spirit-deities, such as the god-deities.🔽The third day is the insanity,🔽and likewise the fourth day is the fever.

original: nyin gsum ba yi smyo byed dang // de bzhin bzhi pa'i rims dag dang // zhes bya ba na nad sna tshogs gtong zhing smyo bar byed pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: nyin gsum ba yi smyo byed dang // de bzhin bzhi pa'i rims dag dang // zhes bya ba na nad sna tshogs gtong zhing smyo bar byed pa rnams yin te /
translated: This is the various types of diseases that are sent out and cause insanity.

original: de rnams yang gzhan gyis mi thub pa stobs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams yang gzhan gyis mi thub pa stobs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: These are also the powerful ones that cannot be overcome by others.

original: 'jig rten 'tshe ba gang yin pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'tshe ba gang yin pa //
translated: Whatever harm there is in the world,

original: gnod sbyin 'byung po ma rungs rnams //
analyzed: gnod sbyin 'byung po ma rungs rnams //
translated: the evil yakshas and bhutas,

original: zhes bya ba ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams skad cig yud tsam thang cig gis rgyu ba //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams skad cig yud tsam thang cig gis rgyu ba //
translated: This is the great trichiliocosm that moves in an instant, a moment, a second.

original: sems can rnams la 'tshe bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la 'tshe bar byed pa'o //
translated: It harms sentient beings.

original: phyogs bzhi nas ni bkug nas su //
analyzed: phyogs bzhi nas ni bkug nas su //
translated: Having summoned from the four directions,

original: bcing ba lnga yis bsdams pa rnams //
analyzed: bcing ba lnga yis bsdams pa rnams //
translated: those bound by the five fetters,

original: zhes bya ba ni ma rungs pa'i 'byung po rnams la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ma rungs pa'i 'byung po rnams la /
translated: This is to the unruly spirits.

original: ye shes lnga'i zhags pas bcings @37b pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i zhags pas bcings @37b pa'o //
translated: With the noose of the five wisdoms, they are bound.

original: 'jig rten mgon po'i spyan snga ru //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon po'i spyan snga ru //
translated: In the presence of the Lord of the World,

original: thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad smras //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad smras //
translated: with palms joined, they say this.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'byung po de rnams kyis kyang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'byung po de rnams kyis kyang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar /
translated: This is to the spirits, who also, in the presence of the Perfectly Awakened One,

original: gus bar byas nas zhus ba'o //🔽phyag 'tshal skyes bu dba' khyod la //
analyzed: gus bar byas nas zhus ba'o // phyag 'tshal skyes bu dba' khyod la //
translated: make respectful inquiries.🔽Homage to you, hero of men!

original: phyag 'tshal skyes bu mchog khyod la//
analyzed: phyag 'tshal skyes bu mchog khyod la//
translated: Homage to you, supreme being!

original: zhes bya ba ni bdud bzhi 'joms ba la dpa' ba /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdud bzhi 'joms ba la dpa' ba /
translated: This is to the one who is heroic in conquering the four maras,

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa /
translated: who possesses the thirty-two marks of a great being,

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu pos sku la brgyan pa /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu pos sku la brgyan pa /
translated: whose body is adorned with the eighty minor marks of excellence,

original: sems can rnams la mnyam pa nyid du lta ba /
analyzed: sems can rnams la mnyam pa nyid du lta ba /
translated: who views all sentient beings with impartiality,

original: snying rje dang byams bas khyab pa /
analyzed: snying rje dang byams bas khyab pa /
translated: who is pervaded by compassion and love,

original: thal mo sbyar nas phyag 'tshal la //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar nas phyag 'tshal la //
translated: with palms joined, I pay homage.

original: chos rgyal khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: chos rgyal khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to you, Dharma King!

original: zhes bya ba ni 'byung po de rnams kyis zhabs la gus par phyag 'tshal te /🔽stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'byung po de rnams kyis zhabs la gus par phyag 'tshal te / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams la /
translated: the spirits

original: chos kyi rgyal srid mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal srid mdzad pa'o //
translated: rule the Dharma kingdom over the world systems of the great trichiliocosm.

original: de dag gi ni mdun rgyug pa //
analyzed: de dag gi ni mdun rgyug pa //
translated: They run in front of him,

original: 'byung po gnod sbyin lus po che //🔽zhes bya ba ni che bar rib dang mnyam pa /
analyzed: 'byung po gnod sbyin lus po che // zhes bya ba ni che bar rib dang mnyam pa /
translated: the spirits, the yakshas, the mahoragas.🔽The spirits are great in size, equal to Meru,

original: chung ba ba spu'i rtsa mo cam /
analyzed: chung ba ba spu'i rtsa mo cam /
translated: and small, the size of a pore of the body.

original: de dang der ldan pa'i 'byung po rnams rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: de dang der ldan pa'i 'byung po rnams rgyu ba'o //
translated: They run in front of him, endowed with such and such forms.

original: lag pa bzhi pa ma rungs pa //
analyzed: lag pa bzhi pa ma rungs pa //
translated: The four-armed ones, the fierce ones,

original: rkang mngas dang ni rkang gcig pa //
analyzed: rkang mngas dang ni rkang gcig pa //
translated: the many-footed, the one-footed,

original: zhes bya ba ni mda' dang gzhu dang ral gri mdung rnams thogs pa /🔽stob tsho gcig gi rkang ba yod pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mda' dang gzhu dang ral gri mdung rnams thogs pa / stob tsho gcig gi rkang ba yod pa /
translated: the four-armed ones hold bows, arrows, swords, and spears.🔽The many-footed have many feet in one body.

original: rkang gcig ni gnyis sbrel nas rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: rkang gcig ni gnyis sbrel nas rgyu ba'o //
translated: The one-footed have two feet joined together.

original: rkang bzhi pa dang rkang gnyis dang // rkang pa bsgreng la spyi'u tshugs dang // zhes bya ba ni ma rungs pa'i 'byung po yang spyi bo'i gtsug gis 'gro zhing /
analyzed: rkang bzhi pa dang rkang gnyis dang // rkang pa bsgreng la spyi'u tshugs dang // zhes bya ba ni ma rungs pa'i 'byung po yang spyi bo'i gtsug gis 'gro zhing /
translated: These are the evil spirits who walk on the crown of the head,

original: sems can rnams 'jigs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams 'jigs par byed pa'o //
translated: terrifying sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du rkang bzhi rkang gnyis kyang 'jigs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rkang bzhi rkang gnyis kyang 'jigs par byed pa'o //
translated: Similarly, four-footed and two-footed [beings] also terrify.🔽Many bodies with one head,🔽one body with four heads,

original: lus mang mgo po gcig pa dang // lus gcig ba la mgo bzhi dang // zhes bya ba ni gzugs che zhing 'jigs su rung ba bzhin mi sdug ba rnams so //
analyzed: lus mang mgo po gcig pa dang // lus gcig ba la mgo bzhi dang // zhes bya ba ni gzugs che zhing 'jigs su rung ba bzhin mi sdug ba rnams so //
translated: These are the many forms, large and terrifying, with ugly appearances.🔽Many eyes, half a body,🔽one eye, twelve bellies,

original: mig mang po la lus phyed dang // mig gcig lto ni bcu gnyis dang // zhes bya ba ni rkang gcig lag gcig lus su snang zhing //
analyzed: mig mang po la lus phyed dang // mig gcig lto ni bcu gnyis dang // zhes bya ba ni rkang gcig lag gcig lus su snang zhing //
translated: This is one leg, one hand, appearing as a body,

original: lus de la mig mang po yod pa sta /
analyzed: lus de la mig mang po yod pa sta /
translated: and on that body there are many eyes.

original: 'byung bo gzhan yang lta ba ri be lta bur gnas pa /
analyzed: 'byung bo gzhan yang lta ba ri be lta bur gnas pa /
translated: Other spirits dwell like a row of eyes,

original: mang po bsdebs pa mig gcig tu snang ba'o //
analyzed: mang po bsdebs pa mig gcig tu snang ba'o //
translated: many combined appearing as one eye.

original: bong bu rnga mo glang chen mgo //
analyzed: bong bu rnga mo glang chen mgo //
translated: Donkey, camel, elephant head,

original: lag pa bsgreng la mgo btud dang // zhes bya ba ni gzugs mi'i gzugs la mgo bo sna tshogs su snang ba /
analyzed: lag pa bsgreng la mgo btud dang // zhes bya ba ni gzugs mi'i gzugs la mgo bo sna tshogs su snang ba /
translated: The line with arms raised and heads bowed refers to the human-like forms with various heads appearing.

original: rkang pa dang lag pa sgreng bar byed pa'o //🔽mtshon cha'i so dang @38a * //🔽mtshon cha'i lag / mtshon cha'i rkang pa srin po rnams //
analyzed: rkang pa dang lag pa sgreng bar byed pa'o // mtshon cha'i so dang @38a * // mtshon cha'i lag / mtshon cha'i rkang pa srin po rnams //
translated: They have arms and legs raised.🔽The line with weapons in their teeth, refers to the rākṣasas.

original: zhes bya ba ni de kun gyi yan lag dang ral gri dang / mda' gzhu dang mdung la sogs par snang ba'o //🔽zangs kyi skra dang zangs kyi so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de kun gyi yan lag dang ral gri dang / mda' gzhu dang mdung la sogs par snang ba'o // zangs kyi skra dang zangs kyi so //
translated: They have weapons in all their limbs, such as swords, arrows, and spears.

original: zangs kyi mig dang zangs kyi lag / ces bya ba ni shin tu dmar ba 'jigs su rung ba ste /
analyzed: zangs kyi mig dang zangs kyi lag / ces bya ba ni shin tu dmar ba 'jigs su rung ba ste /
translated: The line with copper hair, copper teeth, refers to the terrifyingly red ones.

original: mtshon cha bzhin du snang ba'o //🔽zangs kyi tho ba rkang pa dang // zangs kyi sna dang zangs kyi kha //
analyzed: mtshon cha bzhin du snang ba'o // zangs kyi tho ba rkang pa dang // zangs kyi sna dang zangs kyi kha //
translated: They appear like weapons.

original: zhes bya ba ni mtshon cha mi 'jigs pa 'dzin pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mtshon cha mi 'jigs pa 'dzin pa /
translated: The line with copper hammers for feet, copper noses, and copper mouths, refers to the ones who hold weapons.

original: rkang pa yang tho ba'i tshul du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rkang pa yang tho ba'i tshul du gnas pa'o //
translated: They have feet that are like hammers.

original: de bzhin du kha la sogs pa yang zangs kyi skra bzhin du snang ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kha la sogs pa yang zangs kyi skra bzhin du snang ba'o //
translated: Likewise, the mouth and so on appear like copper hair.🔽The hands and feet are all ablaze,

original: rkang lag kun du 'bar ba dang ; ; mi yi lus su gnas pa rnams //
analyzed: rkang lag kun du 'bar ba dang ; ; mi yi lus su gnas pa rnams //
translated: and the bodies of men remain.

original: zhes bya ba ni me bzhin du 'bar te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni me bzhin du 'bar te /
translated: This is like a fire blazing,

original: des kyang mi la zhe sdang la sogs pa 'bar bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: des kyang mi la zhe sdang la sogs pa 'bar bar byed pa'o //
translated: and it causes hatred and so on to blaze in men.

original: sgur zhar sba ba gsum yod pa //
analyzed: sgur zhar sba ba gsum yod pa //
translated: There are three testicles on the hunchback,

original: mig mi sdug la kha glang ba //
analyzed: mig mi sdug la kha glang ba //
translated: with ugly eyes and a gaping mouth.

original: zhes bya ba ni bong thung zhing lus po sgur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bong thung zhing lus po sgur te /
translated: This is a short body with a hunchback,

original: de'i ske la sba ba gsum yod pa /
analyzed: de'i ske la sba ba gsum yod pa /
translated: with three testicles on the neck.

original: lus po zha zhing kha gdangs pa /
analyzed: lus po zha zhing kha gdangs pa /
translated: The body is lame, the mouth is open,

original: mchu sngon por sang ba 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: mchu sngon por sang ba 'jigs pa'o //
translated: and the blue lips are terrifying.

original: chu srin stag gi gzugs dang ni //
analyzed: chu srin stag gi gzugs dang ni //
translated: The form of a crocodile and a tiger,

original: gzugs mi sdug dang kha ral po //
analyzed: gzugs mi sdug dang kha ral po //
translated: with an ugly form and a gaping mouth.

original: zhes bya ba ni mi'i lus la mgo brnyan du yod pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi'i lus la mgo brnyan du yod pa /
translated: This is a human body with a head,

original: kha gdangs shing mi sdug pa'o //🔽mchu 'phyang po dang so yon po //
analyzed: kha gdangs shing mi sdug pa'o // mchu 'phyang po dang so yon po //
translated: with an open mouth and an ugly form.🔽The lips hang down and the teeth are crooked,

original: rab tu sdug pa'i khro gnyer can ;
analyzed: rab tu sdug pa'i khro gnyer can ;
translated: with a very ugly frown.

original: ; zhes bya ba ni gdong pa yo ba /
analyzed: ; zhes bya ba ni gdong pa yo ba /
translated: This is a crooked face,

original: de bzhin du mchu dang so yo ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mchu dang so yo ba'o //
translated: Likewise, there are those with crooked lips and teeth.

original: khro bar gnas shing sems can la 'jigs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: khro bar gnas shing sems can la 'jigs par byed pa'o //
translated: They are wrathful, and frighten sentient beings.

original: gsus po che dang bum sna po //
analyzed: gsus po che dang bum sna po //
translated: There are those with large bellies and pot bellies.

original: rna 'phyangs po dang rna ba med //
analyzed: rna 'phyangs po dang rna ba med //
translated: There are those with long ears and those without ears.

original: ces bya ba ni gsus pa ri rab tsam snang ba /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gsus pa ri rab tsam snang ba /
translated: Those with large bellies appear to be like Mount Meru.

original: rna ba gos su gon pa /
analyzed: rna ba gos su gon pa /
translated: Those with long ears wear them as clothes.

original: rna ba bcad pa'i 'byung po rnams so //
analyzed: rna ba bcad pa'i 'byung po rnams so //
translated: There are spirits whose ears have been cut off.

original: lag ring dang ni rna ba ring //
analyzed: lag ring dang ni rna ba ring //
translated: There are those with long arms and long ears.

original: sna yi rtse dang lag rtse ring //
analyzed: sna yi rtse dang lag rtse ring //
translated: The tips of their noses and fingers are long.

original: zhes bya ba ni lag pa brkyang pas dpag tshad brgyar slobs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lag pa brkyang pas dpag tshad brgyar slobs te /
translated: Those with long arms stretch out to a distance of one hundred leagues.

original: snas lus khebs te glang po che'i sna dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: snas lus khebs te glang po che'i sna dang 'dra ba /
translated: Those with long noses cover their bodies like the trunk of an elephant.

original: de bzhin sor mo yang ring ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin sor mo yang ring ba'o //
translated: Likewise, their fingers are also long.🔽Their bodies are dry, their bodies are long, their hair is long, and they are well adorned.

original: lus skams lus ni ring ba dang // skra ring rab tu brgyan pa dang // zhes bya ba ni shin tu nag pa /
analyzed: lus skams lus ni ring ba dang // skra ring rab tu brgyan pa dang // zhes bya ba ni shin tu nag pa /
translated: They are very dark,

original: shing lpags skams pa dang 'dra ba //
analyzed: shing lpags skams pa dang 'dra ba //
translated: like dry tree bark.

original: ring ba ni ring ba pas kyang ches ring ba lus rnams kyang skra ring bas brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: ring ba ni ring ba pas kyang ches ring ba lus rnams kyang skra ring bas brgyan pa'o //
translated: They are long, longer than long, and their bodies are adorned with long hair.

original: rkang pa mid pa phra ba dang // dri nga ba dang bum lto po //🔽zhes bya ba ni yan lag gi tshigs rdog por yod pa /
analyzed: rkang pa mid pa phra ba dang // dri nga ba dang bum lto po // zhes bya ba ni yan lag gi tshigs rdog por yod pa /
translated: 10. His feet and neck are thin, his belly is like a pot.🔽His limbs are knobby,

original: rkang @38b pa phra bas te /
analyzed: rkang @38b pa phra bas te /
translated: his feet are thin,

original: dri mi zhim pa mnam pa /
analyzed: dri mi zhim pa mnam pa /
translated: he smells bad,

original: gsus pa ri bo tsam yod pa'o //🔽yan lag chu srin 'dra ba dang // gtun shing tho ba 'dra ba'i lto //
analyzed: gsus pa ri bo tsam yod pa'o // yan lag chu srin 'dra ba dang // gtun shing tho ba 'dra ba'i lto //
translated: and his belly is like a mountain.🔽11. His limbs are like a crocodile, his belly is like a pestle or a hammer.

original: zhes bya ba ni lag pa dang rkang pa yang chu srin 'dra ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lag pa dang rkang pa yang chu srin 'dra ste /
translated: His hands and feet are like a crocodile,

original: gzugs ring ba /
analyzed: gzugs ring ba /
translated: his body is tall,

original: rked pa nyag pa /
analyzed: rked pa nyag pa /
translated: his waist is thin,

original: nag por snang ba'o //
analyzed: nag por snang ba'o //
translated: and he appears black.

original: gnam lto ba dang sna bo che ;
analyzed: gnam lto ba dang sna bo che ;
translated: 12. His belly is like the sky, his nose is large,

original: ; gyen du brdzes skra rab tu dmar //
analyzed: ; gyen du brdzes skra rab tu dmar //
translated: his hair is red and stands straight up.

original: zhes bya ba ni sna yar 'khyil pa glang po che'i sna 'dra ba /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sna yar 'khyil pa glang po che'i sna 'dra ba /
translated: His nose curls up like an elephant’s trunk,

original: khab kyi rtse mo dang 'dra ba'i skra dmar zhing 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: khab kyi rtse mo dang 'dra ba'i skra dmar zhing 'bar ba'o //
translated: his hair is red and blazing like the point of a needle.

original: mgo bo che la gzhu mgrin po //
analyzed: mgo bo che la gzhu mgrin po //
translated: 13. His head is large, his neck is like a bow,

original: rked pa sgur po bum lto bo //
analyzed: rked pa sgur po bum lto bo //
translated: his waist is bent, his belly is like a pot.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'byung po la la ni gzhu bzhin du ske sgur bas te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'byung po la la ni gzhu bzhin du ske sgur bas te /
translated: Some spirits have necks bent like a bow,

original: de bzhin du yan lag dang lus po rnams kyang sgur ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yan lag dang lus po rnams kyang sgur ba'o //
translated: In the same way, the limbs and the body are bent.

original: ri rab rtse mo bsgul nas su //
analyzed: ri rab rtse mo bsgul nas su //
translated: Shaking the peak of Mount Meru,

original: me mdag gi ni char pa 'bebs //
analyzed: me mdag gi ni char pa 'bebs //
translated: he causes a rain of burning coals to fall.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzi brjid dang / stobs dang ldan zhing //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzi brjid dang / stobs dang ldan zhing //
translated: This means that he is powerful and strong,

original: ri rab dang sa g-yo bar byed pa ma rungs pa'i char 'bebs pa'o //
analyzed: ri rab dang sa g-yo bar byed pa ma rungs pa'i char 'bebs pa'o //
translated: and causes a rain of evil to fall that shakes Mount Meru and the earth.🔽Some have the color of trees, smells, stones,

original: ljon shing dri dang rdo ba dang // sprin gyi tshogs kyi mdog 'dra pa //
analyzed: ljon shing dri dang rdo ba dang // sprin gyi tshogs kyi mdog 'dra pa //
translated: and masses of clouds.

original: zhes bya ba ni la la gzugs bzang bar gnas pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni la la gzugs bzang bar gnas pa /
translated: This means that some have good forms,

original: gzhan rnams yang bzhin mi sdug pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams yang bzhin mi sdug pa'o //
translated: while others have ugly faces.🔽The sounds of conches, great drums, clay drums,

original: dung dang rnga chen rdza rnga dang // grul bum rnga bran rnams kyi sgra //
analyzed: dung dang rnga chen rdza rnga dang // grul bum rnga bran rnams kyi sgra //
translated: and the laughter of kumbhaṇḍas and bherī drums.

original: zhes bya ba ni sgra dang rol mo la dga' ba gar sna tshogs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sgra dang rol mo la dga' ba gar sna tshogs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This means that they enjoy sounds and music, with various dances.

original: 'jigs pa'i sgra ni rab tu 'byin //
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i sgra ni rab tu 'byin //
translated: They emit terrifying sounds.

original: ming po che la bong bu'i sgra //
analyzed: ming po che la bong bu'i sgra //
translated: The sound of donkeys in the great hells,

original: zhes bya ba ni ri rab kyi rtse mo nas gling bzhir thos pa'i sgra /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ri rab kyi rtse mo nas gling bzhir thos pa'i sgra /
translated: This means that the sounds heard in the four continents from the peak of Mount Meru🔽are

original: sgra des sems can 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra des sems can 'jigs pa'o //
translated: That sound terrifies sentient beings.🔽Black, blue, yellow,🔽orange like fire,

original: nag po sngon po ser po dang // dmar ser me ltar dmar ser dang // zhes bya ba ni bzhin mi sdug pa gzugs sna tshogs su snang ba /
analyzed: nag po sngon po ser po dang // dmar ser me ltar dmar ser dang // zhes bya ba ni bzhin mi sdug pa gzugs sna tshogs su snang ba /
translated: This refers to the various appearances of ugly faces.

original: bskal ba'i me'i 'od dang 'dra ba'i 'od zer snang ba'o //
analyzed: bskal ba'i me'i 'od dang 'dra ba'i 'od zer snang ba'o //
translated: The light rays shine like the light of the fire at the end of the eon.

original: khab 'dra'i spu dang ral gri'i skra //
analyzed: khab 'dra'i spu dang ral gri'i skra //
translated: With hair like needles and swords,

original: dmar po'i khrag gis bskus pa rnams //
analyzed: dmar po'i khrag gis bskus pa rnams //
translated: smeared with red blood,

original: zhes bya ba ni shin tu rno ba lus dang mgo rnams la khyab pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shin tu rno ba lus dang mgo rnams la khyab pa /
translated: This refers to the extremely sharp ones that cover the bodies and heads.

original: kha yang khrag gis bskus pa'o //
analyzed: kha yang khrag gis bskus pa'o //
translated: Their mouths are also smeared with blood.

original: mi ro dag ni khyer nas su //
analyzed: mi ro dag ni khyer nas su //
translated: Carrying human corpses,🔽they run around as if eating.

original: za bzhin du ni rnam par rgyug / ces bya ba ni mi rnams la 'tshe bar byed cang srog 'phrog pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: za bzhin du ni rnam par rgyug / ces bya ba ni mi rnams la 'tshe bar byed cang srog 'phrog pa rnams yin te /
translated: This refers to those who harm humans and steal their lives.

original: glags tshol zhing 'phrang kha bsgugs pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: glags tshol zhing 'phrang kha bsgugs pa rnams yin no //
translated: They seek opportunities and lie in ambush.🔽Sharp teeth, red hands,🔽and lips smeared with blood,

original: so rnon lag pa dmar po dang // mchu ni khrag gis bskus pa dang // zhes bya ni mche ba ring ba mtshon 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: so rnon lag pa dmar po dang // mchu ni khrag gis bskus pa dang // zhes bya ni mche ba ring ba mtshon 'dra ba ste /
translated: This refers to the long fangs that resemble weapons.

original: sems can rnams kyi lag ba dmar por snang ba /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi lag ba dmar por snang ba /
translated: The red hands of sentient beings

original: khrag 'thung ba la dga' ba'o//
analyzed: khrag 'thung ba la dga' ba'o//
translated: are the delight of blood-drinkers.🔽Having eaten half of the body,

original: @39a * // lus phyed dag ni zos pa dang // mkhal snying dang nang grol gyis //
analyzed: @39a * // lus phyed dag ni zos pa dang // mkhal snying dang nang grol gyis //
translated: the entrails, heart, and internal organs,

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la 'tsho bar byed pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la 'tsho bar byed pas /
translated: the life-force of sentient beings is taken away.🔽The flesh and blood are the delight of flesh-eaters,

original: sha dang khrag la dga' ba dang // don snying lnga la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sha dang khrag la dga' ba dang // don snying lnga la dga' ba'o //
translated: and the five internal organs are the delight of those who enjoy them.🔽Having filled the heart completely,

original: snying pa shin tu bkang ba dang / byis pa dag ni za bzhin du //
analyzed: snying pa shin tu bkang ba dang / byis pa dag ni za bzhin du //
translated: the children are eaten.🔽Having taken away the life-force of humans,

original: zhes bya ba ni mi rnams kyi ni srog 'phrogs nas don snying rnam pa lnga phyung nas za bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi rnams kyi ni srog 'phrogs nas don snying rnam pa lnga phyung nas za bar byed pa'o //
translated: the five internal organs are extracted and eaten.

original: mer mer po dang srog chags kyi //
analyzed: mer mer po dang srog chags kyi //
translated: The strength of the embryo and the limbs of living beings🔽is also taken away.

original: rkang lag rnams kyi stobs kyang 'phrog / ces bya ba ni byang chub sems chags su mi ster bar za ba /
analyzed: rkang lag rnams kyi stobs kyang 'phrog / ces bya ba ni byang chub sems chags su mi ster bar za ba /
translated: Not allowing the bodhicitta to descend, it is eaten.

original: ma'i mngal nas gzi brjid 'phrog pa'o //
analyzed: ma'i mngal nas gzi brjid 'phrog pa'o //
translated: In the mother's womb, it takes away vitality.

original: keng rus kyi ni lus kyis su //
analyzed: keng rus kyi ni lus kyis su //
translated: With a body of bones,

original: skye bo mang po skrag par byad //
analyzed: skye bo mang po skrag par byad //
translated: many beings are frightened.

original: ces bya ba ni pags pa dang sha med pa dang rus par snang ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni pags pa dang sha med pa dang rus par snang ste /
translated: This means that they appear as bones, without skin and flesh.

original: de lta bu'i gzugs kyis kyang 'tshe bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gzugs kyis kyang 'tshe bar byed pa'o //
translated: And they harm with such a form.

original: khrag gis rab tu bkang ba yi //
analyzed: khrag gis rab tu bkang ba yi //
translated: They are covered with blood,

original: mi yi pags pa thogs nas su //
analyzed: mi yi pags pa thogs nas su //
translated: and they carry human skins.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi khrag 'jib cing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi khrag 'jib cing /
translated: This means that they suck the blood of sentient beings,

original: mi yi pags pa gon pa'o ;
analyzed: mi yi pags pa gon pa'o ;
translated: and they wear human skins.

original: ; mi bzad dug gis kun bskus te //
analyzed: ; mi bzad dug gis kun bskus te //
translated: They are smeared with unbearable poison,🔽and they run in all directions.

original: phyogs phyogs dag tu rnam par rgyug / ces bya ba ni bsam pa dang / mthong ba dang reg pa dang / mche ba'i dug rnams kyis bskus pa /
analyzed: phyogs phyogs dag tu rnam par rgyug / ces bya ba ni bsam pa dang / mthong ba dang reg pa dang / mche ba'i dug rnams kyis bskus pa /
translated: This means that they are smeared with the poisons of thought, sight, touch, and fangs.

original: stong gsum gyi stong ge 'jig rten gyi khams su rgyug pa'o //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong ge 'jig rten gyi khams su rgyug pa'o //
translated: They run in the trichiliocosm.🔽They scatter in the cities,

original: grong khyer rnams kyi sgo rnams dang // khyim nas khyim du rnam par 'thor //
analyzed: grong khyer rnams kyi sgo rnams dang // khyim nas khyim du rnam par 'thor //
translated: at the doors, and in the houses.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la glags tshol ba /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la glags tshol ba /
translated: This means that they seek an opportunity to harm sentient beings,

original: grong dang grong khyer grong rdal du rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: grong dang grong khyer grong rdal du rgyu ba'o //
translated: and they run in the villages, cities, and towns.

original: rlung dang bad kan mkhris pa rnams //
analyzed: rlung dang bad kan mkhris pa rnams //
translated: They are wind, bile, and phlegm,

original: phyogs bzhi dag tu 'khrug par byed //
analyzed: phyogs bzhi dag tu 'khrug par byed //
translated: They cause strife in the four directions.

original: ces bya ba ni 'byung po rnams kyi mdze dang pho la mig la sogs pa nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi gtong ba'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'byung po rnams kyi mdze dang pho la mig la sogs pa nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi gtong ba'i bdag po'o //
translated: This is the lord who sends out the four hundred and four diseases of spirits, such as leprosy, fever, and eye disease.

original: de ltar de na rgyal po yi //
analyzed: de ltar de na rgyal po yi //
translated: Thus, in that place, the king

original: gdon dang 'jigs pa chen po rnams //
analyzed: gdon dang 'jigs pa chen po rnams //
translated: Of the great fears and spirits,

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyal po chen po bzhis kyang 'byung po'i gdon de rnams 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyal po chen po bzhis kyang 'byung po'i gdon de rnams 'dul ba'o //
translated: The four great kings also subdue those spirit fears.

original: lhag pa de dag thams cad kyang //
analyzed: lhag pa de dag thams cad kyang //
translated: And all the rest of them

original: rig sngags zhags pas rab tu bsdams //
analyzed: rig sngags zhags pas rab tu bsdams //
translated: Are bound by the noose of the knowledge mantra.

original: zhes bya ba ni stong chen mo'i rig sngags kyis /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni stong chen mo'i rig sngags kyis /
translated: The knowledge mantra of the great trichiliocosm

original: 'byung po rnams rang dbang med par bkug pa'o //🔽phyag 'tshal skyes bu dpa' khyod la //
analyzed: 'byung po rnams rang dbang med par bkug pa'o // phyag 'tshal skyes bu dpa' khyod la //
translated: Compels the spirits without their consent.🔽Homage to you, O hero of men!

original: phyag 'tshal skyes bu mchog khyod la //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal skyes bu mchog khyod la //
translated: Homage to you, O supreme of men!

original: zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa 'dul ba la dpa' ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa 'dul ba la dpa' ba'o //
translated: This is the hero who subdues the afflictions such as ignorance.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mchan sum cu rtsa @39b gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang pas sku la brgyan pa /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mchan sum cu rtsa @39b gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang pas sku la brgyan pa /
translated: His body is adorned with the thirty-two major marks of a great being and the eighty minor marks.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid du byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid du byed pa'o //
translated: He acts with impartiality toward all sentient beings in the world systems.

original: thal mo sbyar nas phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar nas phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: He is the one who is worshipped with palms joined in homage.

original: chos rgyal khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: chos rgyal khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: He is the one who is worshipped by the Dharma King.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'byung po rnams kyis kyang gus par phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'byung po rnams kyis kyang gus par phyag 'tshal te /
translated: This is how the spirits also respectfully pay homage to him.

original: stong gsum gyi chos kyi rgyal srid mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi chos kyi rgyal srid mdzad pa'o //
translated: He rules the Dharma kingdom of the three-thousandfold world systems.🔽He moves through the cities, towns, countries, and palaces.

original: grong khyer grong dang yul 'khor dang // pho brang 'khor du rgyu ba dang // zhes bya ba ni 'byung po rgyu ba'i dus tshod ni snga dro shar gyi phyogs nas rgyu /🔽nyi ma phyed na lho nas rgyu /
analyzed: grong khyer grong dang yul 'khor dang // pho brang 'khor du rgyu ba dang // zhes bya ba ni 'byung po rgyu ba'i dus tshod ni snga dro shar gyi phyogs nas rgyu / nyi ma phyed na lho nas rgyu /
translated: The time when the spirits move is in the morning, they move from the east.🔽At noon, they move from the south.

original: nyi ma smyur nas nub kyi phyogs su rgyu /🔽nyi ma smyur nas ma nub bar du byang gi phyogs nas rgyu /
analyzed: nyi ma smyur nas nub kyi phyogs su rgyu / nyi ma smyur nas ma nub bar du byang gi phyogs nas rgyu /
translated: In the afternoon, they move from the west.🔽Until sunset, they move from the north.

original: nyi ma nub nas sa sros bar du shar lho mtshams su rgyu //
analyzed: nyi ma nub nas sa sros bar du shar lho mtshams su rgyu //
translated: From sunset until dusk, they move from the southeast.

original: srod 'khor nam phyed bar du srin po'i phyogs nas rgyu /🔽nam phyed skya rings tshun chad nub byang phyogs nas rgyu /
analyzed: srod 'khor nam phyed bar du srin po'i phyogs nas rgyu / nam phyed skya rings tshun chad nub byang phyogs nas rgyu /
translated: In the evening until midnight, they move from the direction of the rakshasas.🔽From midnight until dawn, they move from the northwest.

original: skya rings shar nas nam langs tshun chad byang shar mtshams nas rgyu /
analyzed: skya rings shar nas nam langs tshun chad byang shar mtshams nas rgyu /
translated: From dawn until sunrise, they move from the northeast.

original: de dag dus rgyu ba ni /
analyzed: de dag dus rgyu ba ni /
translated: As for the times of their movements,

original: mchod phyir lhag kyang 'tshe ba mod //
analyzed: mchod phyir lhag kyang 'tshe ba mod //
translated: they are harmful even if they are left as offerings.

original: tshes grangs dag la rgyu ba rnams //
analyzed: tshes grangs dag la rgyu ba rnams //
translated: Those that move on the lunar days

original: de dag mi la 'tshe bar byed //
analyzed: de dag mi la 'tshe bar byed //
translated: harm humans.

original: tshes gcig dang ni bcu gcig la shar gyi phyogs nas chu tshod bzhi'i bar du rgyu /
analyzed: tshes gcig dang ni bcu gcig la shar gyi phyogs nas chu tshod bzhi'i bar du rgyu /
translated: On the first and eleventh, they move from the east for four hours.

original: tshes gnyis dang bcu gsum la lho'i phyogs nas chu tshod brgyad rgyu //
analyzed: tshes gnyis dang bcu gsum la lho'i phyogs nas chu tshod brgyad rgyu //
translated: On the second and twelfth, they move from the south for eight hours.

original: tshes gsum dang bcu gnyis la chu tshod bcu'i bar du nub kyi phyogs nas rgyu /
analyzed: tshes gsum dang bcu gnyis la chu tshod bcu'i bar du nub kyi phyogs nas rgyu /
translated: On the third and twelfth, they move from the west for ten hours.

original: srod 'khor tsam ches bzhi dang bcu bzhi la nam phyed nas chu tshod drug byang gi phyogs nas rgyu /
analyzed: srod 'khor tsam ches bzhi dang bcu bzhi la nam phyed nas chu tshod drug byang gi phyogs nas rgyu /
translated: At the end of the evening, on the fourth and fourteenth, they move from the north for six hours from midnight.

original: tshes lnga dang bcu drug la ni nyi ma dros nas shar lho mtshams nas chu chod bdun rgyu'o //
analyzed: tshes lnga dang bcu drug la ni nyi ma dros nas shar lho mtshams nas chu chod bdun rgyu'o //
translated: On the fifth and the sixteenth, the sun heats up and the current flows from the southeast for seven hours.

original: tshes drug dang dgu la chu chod sum cu tham pa lho nub mtshams nas snga dro nas rgyu'o //
analyzed: tshes drug dang dgu la chu chod sum cu tham pa lho nub mtshams nas snga dro nas rgyu'o //
translated: On the sixth and the ninth, the current flows from the southwest for thirty hours in the morning.

original: tshes bdun dang bcu thams pa'i dus su nub byang mtshams nas snga dro nas chu tshod bco lnga la rgyu'o //
analyzed: tshes bdun dang bcu thams pa'i dus su nub byang mtshams nas snga dro nas chu tshod bco lnga la rgyu'o //
translated: On the seventh and the tenth, it flows from the northwest for fifteen hours in the morning.

original: tshes brgyad dang gnam stong la byang shar nas snga dro nas chu tshod bcu gnyis bar du rgyu'o //
analyzed: tshes brgyad dang gnam stong la byang shar nas snga dro nas chu tshod bcu gnyis bar du rgyu'o //
translated: On the eighth and the fifteenth, it flows from the northeast for twelve hours in the morning.

original: de dag ni 'byung po rgyu ba'i dus bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'byung po rgyu ba'i dus bstan pa'o //
translated: These are the times when the bhūtas move.

original: gnod sbyin ma rungs mdangs 'phrog pa //
analyzed: gnod sbyin ma rungs mdangs 'phrog pa //
translated: The yakṣas are fierce and steal radiance,

original: snying rje med cing khrag 'thung ba //
analyzed: snying rje med cing khrag 'thung ba //
translated: are merciless and drink blood.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la 'tshe bar byed cing srog 'phrog pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la 'tshe bar byed cing srog 'phrog pa ste /
translated: They harm sentient beings and steal their life force.

original: 'byung po de rnams sha dang khrag la dga' ba'o /

original: stobs po che la sgra yang che //
analyzed: stobs po che la sgra yang che //

original: zhes bya ba ni lus ni ra rab dang mnyam pa /

analyzed: 'khor ni mang po rnams btang ste //

analyzed: lag na mtshon thogs rab tu 'jigs //

analyzed: sbrul gyi pags pa thogs pa dang // lag bzhi lag na sgron me thogs //

analyzed: gsang ba po ni dad kun yang //

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la sdang ba /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la sdang ba /

analyzed: rgya cher gnod pa skyel ba'o //

original: mi yi 'jig rten 'di dag tu //
analyzed: mi yi 'jig rten 'di dag tu //

analyzed: skyes pa bud med gzhan yang 'dzin //

analyzed: sha khrag dron mor bcas pa la //

analyzed: rnam par 'khrul zhing 'dod pa'i gzugs //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi rnams kyi srog gcod cing sha dang khrag la dga' ba'o // seng ge dang ni stag dang rta //

analyzed: ma he ba glang bong bu rnga //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs mi gcig pa byol song rnams kyi gzugs su sbrul pa'o //

analyzed: sems can rnams la 'tshe bar byed pa'o //

analyzed: khyi dang wa dang ra dag dang // byi la byi ba sbre'u'i gzugs //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnod pa skyel ba'i dus su gcan gzan gyi gzugs @40b su sprul pa'o //

analyzed: bse dang phag dang sre mong dang // nya dang rus sbal dag gi gzugs //

analyzed: kha cig dag ni sram gyi gzugs //

analyzed: rma bya ngang pa thi ba dang // zhes bya ba ni de'i gzugs su ston cing /

analyzed: yan lag mi'i rgyu ma'i phreng bas brgyan pa'o //

translated: and

analyzed: sgra des sems can rnams skrag pa'o // srog chags rgyud rnams ji snyed par //

analyzed: gzugs mi gcig pa mang po snang ba'o // kha cig dag ni ri yang thogs//

translated: The great hosts of bhutas are the great demons who inflict great harm on sentient beings.🔽 The ugly faces are those with mouths and teeth that are crooked.

analyzed: sna dang rna ba bcad pa dang // lce bcad gdong ni gnyer ma can // zhes bya ba ni gzugs ngan par snang zhing /

original: dbang po rnams ma tshang ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ma tshang ba'o //

analyzed: rkang lag dag ni gtubs pa dang // mgo bo bcad pa'i srin po rnams //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mgo bo med par brang nas gdong pa snang bas te /

analyzed: tshigs rnams la yang gdong pa snang ba'o // skabs ni rab tu tshol bar byed //

analyzed: sdig pa can rnams gzi brjid 'phrog / ces bya ba ni sems can rnams la glags tshol zhing /

original: sdig pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sdig pa'i sems dang ldan pa /

original: sems can gyi dpal 'phrog pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi dpal 'phrog pa'o //

original: mi yi lus rnams dag la ni //
analyzed: mi yi lus rnams dag la ni //

original: rab tu phra ba'i gdon du snang //
analyzed: rab tu phra ba'i gdon du snang //
translated: As subtle spirits.

original: zhes bya ba ni mi'i lus la zhugs nas mi dga' ba'i sems dang / lceb pa'i sems dang ldan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi'i lus la zhugs nas mi dga' ba'i sems dang / lceb pa'i sems dang ldan par byed pa'o //
translated: They enter the bodies of humans and make them have an unhappy mind and a mind to commit suicide.🔽They enter between the hairs, the illnesses,

analyzed: spu yi bar dang nad rnams dang // de bzhin rma yi kha rnams su // zhes bya ba ni ba spu'i par du 'dzin cing /

original: rma med pa rma yod par byas te /
analyzed: rma med pa rma yod par byas te /

original: rma'i nang rul bar byas nas /
analyzed: rma'i nang rul bar byas nas /

original: phyi subs nas nang na tsha chen po dang ldan par byed do //
analyzed: phyi subs nas nang na tsha chen po dang ldan par byed do //
translated: They make the outside swell up and have a high fever inside.

original: lhags pa de dag thams cad kyang ;🔽; rig sngags zhags pas rab tu drangs //
analyzed: lhags pa de dag thams cad kyang ; ; rig sngags zhags pas rab tu drangs //
translated: All of those demons🔽Are well-tamed by the noose of knowledge mantras.

original: zhes bya ba ni rig sngags kyi dmod mo'i zhags pas ma rungs pa'i 'byung po rnams bcings pa'o //🔽phyag 'tshal skyes bu dpa' khyod la //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rig sngags kyi dmod mo'i zhags pas ma rungs pa'i 'byung po rnams bcings pa'o // phyag 'tshal skyes bu dpa' khyod la //
translated: The noose of the curse of knowledge mantras binds the evil spirits.🔽Homage to you, O hero!

original: phyag 'tshal skyes bu mchog khyod la //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal skyes bu mchog khyod la //
translated: Homage to you, O supreme being!

original: zhes bya ba ni de dang der ldan pa'i 'byung po rnams kyis kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de dang der ldan pa'i 'byung po rnams kyis kyang /
translated: The spirits who are endowed with this and that also

analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la gus par phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: pay homage with devotion to the Perfectly Awakened One.

original: thal mo sbyar nas phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar nas phyag 'tshal lo //

original: chos rgyal khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: chos rgyal khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni stong gsum gyi stong chen pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams chos srid du mdzad cing /

analyzed: stong gsum gyi chos @41b kyi rgyal por snang ba'o //
translated: appears as the Dharma King of the trichiliocosm.🔽The king of mountains, Mount Meru,

original: ri yi rgyal po ri rab dang // zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams ni 'dod yon lnga la spyod pa bzhin /
analyzed: ri yi rgyal po ri rab dang // zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams ni 'dod yon lnga la spyod pa bzhin /
translated: In the desire realm, beings enjoy the five sense objects.

original: 'byung po rnams kyang 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas spyod do //
analyzed: 'byung po rnams kyang 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas spyod do //

original: ji ltar spyod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar spyod ce na /
