translated: Where do they live?

original: ri rab khor yug la gnas nas 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ri rab khor yug la gnas nas 'dzin pa'o //
translated: They live on the outer rim of Meru.🔽In the same way, on the Black Mountains,

original: de bzhin kho ra khor yug dang // bya rgod phung po gshol mda' 'dzin //🔽zhes bya ba ni dbus kyi ri bo mchog rab nas /
analyzed: de bzhin kho ra khor yug dang // bya rgod phung po gshol mda' 'dzin // zhes bya ba ni dbus kyi ri bo mchog rab nas /
translated: on the mountains of Vultures' Heaps, on the mountains of Plow Tips,🔽The mountains mentioned here are the great mountains from the central supreme mountain down to the outer rim.

original: phyi'i khor khor yug la thug pa'i ri bo chen po la gnas pa'i 'byung po rnams so //
analyzed: phyi'i khor khor yug la thug pa'i ri bo chen po la gnas pa'i 'byung po rnams so //
translated: The elementals live on them.

original: de bzhin du bya rgod phung po dang / ri bdun la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bya rgod phung po dang / ri bdun la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the same way, on the mountains of Vultures' Heaps, on the seven mountains, and so on.

original: spos ngad ldan dang gangs kyi ri //
analyzed: spos ngad ldan dang gangs kyi ri //
translated: On Gandhamadana and on the snowy mountains,

original: sna tshogs sde dang pa nda p'a //
analyzed: sna tshogs sde dang pa nda p'a //
translated: on the mountains of Various Troops and on the mountains of Pain.

original: zhes bya ba ni de yang 'dzam bu'i gling na gnas pa'i ri rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de yang 'dzam bu'i gling na gnas pa'i ri rnams so //
translated: These mountains are in Jambudvipa.

original: na la ng'a yi ri gnyis dang // dpal gyi ri yi rtse mo ni //
analyzed: na la ng'a yi ri gnyis dang // dpal gyi ri yi rtse mo ni //
translated: The two mountains of Nala and Nā, and the peak of Śrīparvata,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi lho phyogs na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi lho phyogs na gnas pa'o //
translated: are located in the south of Jambudvīpa.

original: gang dag shin tu mthor 'phags dang // ri bo de dag kun la yang //
analyzed: gang dag shin tu mthor 'phags dang // ri bo de dag kun la yang //
translated: And on all those mountains that rise very high,

original: zhes bya ba ni lha dang lha ma yin rnams 'tshogs shing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lha dang lha ma yin rnams 'tshogs shing /
translated: the gods and asuras gather,

original: 'byung po'i tshogs rnams 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung po'i tshogs rnams 'dul ba'o //
translated: and the hosts of bhūtas are subdued.

original: lha dang drang srong gang gnas pa //
analyzed: lha dang drang srong gang gnas pa //
translated: The gods and sages who dwell there,

original: de dag thams cad mi dga' zhing //
analyzed: de dag thams cad mi dga' zhing //
translated: all of them are displeased,

original: zhes bya ba ni stong chen po rab tu 'joms ma'i gzi brjid kyis /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni stong chen po rab tu 'joms ma'i gzi brjid kyis /
translated: and by the splendor of Subduer of the Great Thousand,

original: ri rab de rnams na gnas pa'i 'byung po rnams yid mi dga' ba'o //
analyzed: ri rab de rnams na gnas pa'i 'byung po rnams yid mi dga' ba'o //
translated: the bhūtas dwelling on those mountains are unhappy.

original: 'jigs pa'i yid kyis mya ngan byed //
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i yid kyis mya ngan byed //
translated: With fearful minds, they lament,🔽the gods in the hundreds of millions,🔽the gods in the billions,

original: bye ba stong gi lha dag dang // bye ba phrag brgya'i lha rnams dang // zhes bya ba ni rig sngags kyi gzi brjid kyis /
analyzed: bye ba stong gi lha dag dang // bye ba phrag brgya'i lha rnams dang // zhes bya ba ni rig sngags kyi gzi brjid kyis /
translated: and by the splendor of the knowledge mantra,

original: 'dar zhing kyi hud ces sgra 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dar zhing kyi hud ces sgra 'byin pa'o //
translated: they tremble and cry out, Alas!

original: lha yi bu mo skal chen dag / thal mo rab tu sbyor bar byed //
analyzed: lha yi bu mo skal chen dag / thal mo rab tu sbyor bar byed //
translated: join their palms in respect.

original: ces bya ba ni rig sngags kyi dmod mos 'jigs pas gus par sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rig sngags kyi dmod mos 'jigs pas gus par sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: This means that out of fear of the curse of the knowledge mantra, they respectfully bow to the Buddha.

original: thags bzangs ris dang sgra gcan dang // tshim par byed pa'ang der phyin to //
analyzed: thags bzangs ris dang sgra gcan dang // tshim par byed pa'ang der phyin to //
translated: Vemacitrin, Rahu, and Satisara also came there.

original: zhes bya ba ni lha ma yin gyi dbang po la sogs pa yang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lha ma yin gyi dbang po la sogs pa yang /
translated: This means that the lords of the asuras and so forth

original: rig sngags kyi dmod mos bkug ste /
analyzed: rig sngags kyi dmod mos bkug ste /
translated: were summoned by the curse of the knowledge mantra

original: gus par sangs rgyas la 'dud pa'o //
analyzed: gus par sangs rgyas la 'dud pa'o //
translated: and respectfully bowed to the Buddha.🔽Ten thousand millions of asuras,🔽a billion asuras,

original: lha min bye ba phrag stong dang // lha min bye ba phrag brgya dang // zhes bya ba ni de yang lha ma @42a * //🔽yin gyi grangs /
analyzed: lha min bye ba phrag stong dang // lha min bye ba phrag brgya dang // zhes bya ba ni de yang lha ma @42a * // yin gyi grangs /
translated: This means that those are the numbers of asuras.

original: 'byung po la gtogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'byung po la gtogs pa rnams so //
translated: They belong to the bhutas.

original: de dag bu mo 'phrul ldan pa //
analyzed: de dag bu mo 'phrul ldan pa //
translated: Those many daughters of the asuras

original: mang po kun kyang thal mo sbyar //
analyzed: mang po kun kyang thal mo sbyar //
translated: all join their palms in respect.

original: zhes bya ba ni lha ma yin gyi dbang po'i bu mo la sogs pa yang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lha ma yin gyi dbang po'i bu mo la sogs pa yang /
translated: This means that the daughters of the lords of the asuras and so forth

original: rig sngags kyi gzi brjid kyis /
analyzed: rig sngags kyi gzi brjid kyis /
translated: were summoned by the splendor of the knowledge mantra.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar 'khod pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar 'khod pa'o //
translated: and they are seated in the presence of the Buddha.

original: rab tu gnas dang rgya mtsho dang // zhes bya ba ni phyi'i rgya mtsho la gnas pa dang / sa 'og dang nam mkha' la rgyu zhing /
analyzed: rab tu gnas dang rgya mtsho dang // zhes bya ba ni phyi'i rgya mtsho la gnas pa dang / sa 'og dang nam mkha' la rgyu zhing /
translated: The great nāgas are the nāgas who live in the outer ocean, in the underworld, and in the sky.

original: ma rungs pa'i klu dang sa bdag rnams dang / rigs bzhir gnas shing phyogs bcu dag tu 'khod pa'o //
analyzed: ma rungs pa'i klu dang sa bdag rnams dang / rigs bzhir gnas shing phyogs bcu dag tu 'khod pa'o //
translated: They are the fierce nāgas and bhūtas, and they are seated in the four directions.

original: klu yi rgyal po gzi can dang // zhes bya ba ni sa rim pa bdun gyi 'og na gnas pa ste /
analyzed: klu yi rgyal po gzi can dang // zhes bya ba ni sa rim pa bdun gyi 'og na gnas pa ste /
translated: The powerful nāga kings are the nāgas who live seven earth-levels below the surface of the earth.

original: de'i 'khor sha za dang 'byung po rnams yod de /
analyzed: de'i 'khor sha za dang 'byung po rnams yod de /
translated: Their retinues are the piśācas and bhūtas.

original: mi'i dri tshor ba tsam gyis mdangs 'phrog pa'o //
analyzed: mi'i dri tshor ba tsam gyis mdangs 'phrog pa'o //
translated: They steal the life-force of humans just by smelling their scent.

original: klu'i gnod pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: klu'i gnod pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the characteristics of the harm caused by the nāgas.

original: klu yi rgyal po ma dros dang // dga' bo nye dga' gnyis po dang // zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin du klu'i rgyal po rnams kyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi drung du 'khod pa'o //
analyzed: klu yi rgyal po ma dros dang // dga' bo nye dga' gnyis po dang // zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa bzhin du klu'i rgyal po rnams kyis kyang sangs rgyas kyi drung du 'khod pa'o //
translated: The two nāga kings, Anavatapta and Nanda, and so on, are the nāga kings who, as explained above, are seated in the presence of the Buddha.

original: rdo rje blo gros pakshu dang // gangg'a dga' bo sindhu mtsho //
analyzed: rdo rje blo gros pakshu dang // gangg'a dga' bo sindhu mtsho //
translated: Ganga, Nanda, Sindhu, and the Ocean.

original: zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyang mtsho ma dros pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyang mtsho ma dros pa la gnas shing /
translated: These are the ones who dwell in Lake Anavatapta,

original: gling bzhi ri rab dang bcas par rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: gling bzhi ri rab dang bcas par rgyu ba'o //
translated: and move about in the four continents with Mount Meru.🔽The king of birds, Suparna,🔽and the one who agitates the great ocean,

original: bya yi rgyal po 'dab bzangs dang // rgya mtsho chen po 'khrugs byed dang // zhes bya ba ni de yang rgya mtsho gting na gnas pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: bya yi rgyal po 'dab bzangs dang // rgya mtsho chen po 'khrugs byed dang // zhes bya ba ni de yang rgya mtsho gting na gnas pa rnams yin te /
translated: These are the ones who dwell in the depths of the ocean,

original: de rnams sangs rgyas kyi drung du 'khod pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams sangs rgyas kyi drung du 'khod pa'o //
translated: and they are seated in the presence of the Buddha.🔽The nagas with a thousand heads,🔽and the nagas with a hundred heads,

original: stong phrag bye ba'i klu rnams dang // bye ba brgya yi klu dag dang // zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyi 'khor du bcas pa sa bdag klu dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: stong phrag bye ba'i klu rnams dang // bye ba brgya yi klu dag dang // zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyi 'khor du bcas pa sa bdag klu dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: These are the ones with their retinues, along with the earth-dwelling nagas.

original: de dag bu mo skal chen rnams //
analyzed: de dag bu mo skal chen rnams //
translated: Those fortunate maidens

original: thal mo rab tu sbyor bar byed //
analyzed: thal mo rab tu sbyor bar byed //
translated: join their palms in respect.

original: ces bya ba ni klu'i bu mo de yang grangs de dang ldan par gnas shing /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni klu'i bu mo de yang grangs de dang ldan par gnas shing /
translated: These naga maidens are also present in those numbers,

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar 'khod pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar 'khod pa'o //
translated: and are seated in the presence of the Buddha.

original: nyi ma zla ba gnyi ga yang //
analyzed: nyi ma zla ba gnyi ga yang //
translated: The sun and moon are both

original: skar ma'i 'khor gyis yongs su bskor //
analyzed: skar ma'i 'khor gyis yongs su bskor //
translated: surrounded by the circle of stars.

original: zhes bya ba ni de yang bar snang du rgyu zhing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de yang bar snang du rgyu zhing /
translated: This means that they move through space

original: rig sngags kyi dmod mos 'khod pa'o //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi dmod mos 'khod pa'o //
translated: and are bound by the curse of the knowledge-mantra.

original: gser gyi me tog yan lag na //
analyzed: gser gyi me tog yan lag na //
translated: In the land of the golden flowers

original: ma ga dh'a na 'jigs byed pa //
analyzed: ma ga dh'a na 'jigs byed pa //
translated: is the one who terrifies Magadha.

original: zhes bya ba ni de yang gnod sbyin 'byung po rnams /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de yang gnod sbyin 'byung po rnams /
translated: This means that he is a yakṣa spirit

original: 'dzam bu'i gling na gnas shing /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling na gnas shing /
translated: who lives in Jambudvīpa

original: rig sngags kyi dmod mos 'khod pa'o //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi dmod mos 'khod pa'o //
translated: and is bound by the curse of the knowledge-mantra.

original: gso ba'i mtha' na mi thod can //
analyzed: gso ba'i mtha' na mi thod can //
translated: In the land of healing is the one with the skull,

original: ko sa la na rab tu dkar //
analyzed: ko sa la na rab tu dkar //
translated: in Kośala is the one who is very white.

original: zhes @42b bya ba ni yul ma ga dh'a na gnas shing /
analyzed: zhes @42b bya ba ni yul ma ga dh'a na gnas shing /
translated: This means that he lives in the land of Magadha

original: stong gsum rgyu ba'o //🔽bzang po'i yul na kha spu can //
analyzed: stong gsum rgyu ba'o // bzang po'i yul na kha spu can //
translated: and moves through the trichiliocosm.🔽In the land of the good is the one with the beard,

original: gyad kyi yul na grags pa 'dzin //
analyzed: gyad kyi yul na grags pa 'dzin //
translated: in the land of the strong is the one who holds fame.

original: zhes bya ba ni de yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi nub phyogs su gnas shing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi nub phyogs su gnas shing /
translated: This means that he lives in the west of Jambudvīpa

original: sems can rnams la 'tshe bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la 'tshe bar byed pa'o //
translated: and harms sentient beings.

original: lnga 'dzin pa na skrag byed pa //
analyzed: lnga 'dzin pa na skrag byed pa //
translated: In the land of the five rivers is the one who terrifies,

original: rta skye ba na mig dmar gnas //
analyzed: rta skye ba na mig dmar gnas //
translated: in the land of horses is the one who lives with red eyes.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'byung po'i gnas de dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'byung po'i gnas de dang ldan pa ni /
translated: The one who is endowed with that abode of spirits

original: sems can la gnod par byed par grags pa'o //
analyzed: sems can la gnod par byed par grags pa'o //
translated: is known to harm sentient beings.

original: srung byed pa na ser skya ste //
analyzed: srung byed pa na ser skya ste //
translated: When protecting, he is Kapila;

original: sems pa na ni mig ser po //
analyzed: sems pa na ni mig ser po //
translated: when thinking, he is Pīta-akṣa.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin gyi ded dpon gnas de na gnas shing /🔽skad cig mas thams cad rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin gyi ded dpon gnas de na gnas shing / skad cig mas thams cad rgyu ba'o //
translated: The one who is endowed with that abode of spirits

original: be'u la phan bum pa'i lto //
analyzed: be'u la phan bum pa'i lto //
translated: is the leader of the yakṣas, who moves everywhere in an instant.🔽In Vatsa, he is Kumbhodara;

original: dga' ba'i yul na ring por skyes //🔽zhes bya ba ni gnas de dang ldan zhing gling bzhi ri rab dang bcas pa la rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba'i yul na ring por skyes // zhes bya ba ni gnas de dang ldan zhing gling bzhi ri rab dang bcas pa la rgyu ba'o //
translated: in Rati, he is Dīrgha-jānu.🔽The one who is endowed with that abode of spirits

original: ba lang 'dzin na rab tu 'joms //
analyzed: ba lang 'dzin na rab tu 'joms //
translated: moves in the four continents with Mount Meru.🔽In Vṛṣa, he is Pramatha;

original: dung yul na ni nyi ma'i grogs //
analyzed: dung yul na ni nyi ma'i grogs //
translated: in Śaṅkhakṣetra, he is Sūrya-mitra.🔽The one who is endowed with that abode of spirits

original: zhes bya ba ni gnas de dang ldan zhing sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar 'khod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnas de dang ldan zhing sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar 'khod pa'o //
translated: sits in front of the Buddha.

original: ljongs chen rnams kyi gnod sbyin ni //
analyzed: ljongs chen rnams kyi gnod sbyin ni //
translated: The yakṣas of the great countries🔽are those sixteen mentioned.

original: brjod pa bcu drug de dag dang // zhes bya ba ni 'byung po gnas can du gnas pa /
analyzed: brjod pa bcu drug de dag dang // zhes bya ba ni 'byung po gnas can du gnas pa /
translated: The one who abides in the abode of spirits

original: grags pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: grags pa dang ldan pa /
translated: is endowed with fame.

original: rig sngags kyi zhags pas 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi zhags pas 'dren pa'o //
translated: He is led by the noose of the knowledge-mantra.

original: lag na rdo rje gnod sbyin che //
analyzed: lag na rdo rje gnod sbyin che //
translated: Vajrapāṇi, the great yakṣa,🔽the Dharma protector, is very white.

original: chos skyong rab tu dkar ba dang // zhes bya ba ni ri rab rtse mo la gnas shing sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: chos skyong rab tu dkar ba dang // zhes bya ba ni ri rab rtse mo la gnas shing sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa bsrung ba'o //
translated: He resides on the peak of Mount Meru and protects the Buddha's teachings.🔽Kapila, beautiful Viṣṇu,🔽the pot-bellied one, the round-bellied one,

original: ser skya rab mdzes khyab 'jug dang // bum lto gsus pa zlum po dang // zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin de rnams yang ri rab kyi khong seng lho ngos na gnas shing /
analyzed: ser skya rab mdzes khyab 'jug dang // bum lto gsus pa zlum po dang // zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin de rnams yang ri rab kyi khong seng lho ngos na gnas shing /
translated: these yakṣas reside in the interior of Mount Meru on the southern side.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba la gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba la gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: They harm the roots of virtue.🔽The crocodile, the truth-holder,🔽the five-fold conqueror, the bull,

original: chu srin bden pa 'chang ba dang // lnga ldan rgyal pa khyu mchog dang // zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyang lho'i 'dzam bu'i gling na gnas shing /
analyzed: chu srin bden pa 'chang ba dang // lnga ldan rgyal pa khyu mchog dang // zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyang lho'i 'dzam bu'i gling na gnas shing /
translated: these also reside in the southern Jambudvīpa.

original: gling bzhi ri rab dang bcas par rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: gling bzhi ri rab dang bcas par rgyu ba'o //
translated: They roam the four continents along with Mount Meru.

original: gnod sbyin chen po dbang phyug che //
analyzed: gnod sbyin chen po dbang phyug che //
translated: The great yakṣa, the great Īśvara,

original: lag pa bzhi can stobs po che //
analyzed: lag pa bzhi can stobs po che //
translated: the four-armed one, the powerful one,

original: zhes bya ba ni ti se'i gangs la gnas shing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ti se'i gangs la gnas shing /
translated: resides on the Himalayas.

original: sems can rnams kyis mchod par 'os pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis mchod par 'os pa'o //
translated: He is worthy of worship by all beings.

original: sde pa rab tu 'dul ba ni //
analyzed: sde pa rab tu 'dul ba ni //
translated: The one who is the best of the clans

original: mthu bo che la stobs po che //
analyzed: mthu bo che la stobs po che //
translated: is the great power, the great strength.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'byung po de dang der ldan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'byung po de dang der ldan pa ni /
translated: The one who is endowed with that and that element

original: stong gsum rgyu ste rig sngags kyi zhags pas 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: stong gsum rgyu ste rig sngags kyi zhags pas 'dren pa'o //
translated: is the cause of the three thousand worlds, and is led by the noose of the knowledge mantra.🔽Yama, Yama's messengers,

original: gshin rje gshin rje'i pho nya dang // bdud rnams sde dang bcas pa dang // zhes @43a * //🔽bya ba ni ma rungs pa'i gshin rje'i pho nya mo dang / bdud kyi lha rnams yang 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: gshin rje gshin rje'i pho nya dang // bdud rnams sde dang bcas pa dang // zhes @43a * // bya ba ni ma rungs pa'i gshin rje'i pho nya mo dang / bdud kyi lha rnams yang 'dren pa'o //
translated: and the demons with their armies,🔽are also led by the noose of the knowledge mantra.

original: gnod sbyin bye ba'i g-yog 'chang ba //
analyzed: gnod sbyin bye ba'i g-yog 'chang ba //
translated: He has an army of millions of yakshas.

original: gnod sbyin de ming 'phrog po yin //
analyzed: gnod sbyin de ming 'phrog po yin //
translated: That yaksha is called Rahu.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi mi rnams la gnod pa skyel zhing gzi brjid dang 'od 'phrog pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi mi rnams la gnod pa skyel zhing gzi brjid dang 'od 'phrog pa'o //
translated: He causes harm to worldly people and robs their splendor and light.🔽Sharita with his retinue,

original: sha ri ta ni sder bcas dang // ri yi bu mo gnod sbyin ma //
analyzed: sha ri ta ni sder bcas dang // ri yi bu mo gnod sbyin ma //
translated: and the yakshini daughter of the mountain,

original: zhes bya ba ni de yang gzi brjid che zhing sa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de yang gzi brjid che zhing sa la gnas pa'o //
translated: are also of great splendor and dwell on the earth.

original: gzi brjid chen mo 'jigs pa'i gzugs //
analyzed: gzi brjid chen mo 'jigs pa'i gzugs //
translated: The Greatly Resplendent One, of terrifying form,🔽And also known as Hārītī,

original: 'phrog ma zhes kyang grags pa dang // zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin srin mor grags pa dang / ma'i mngal nas bu 'phrog pa'o //
analyzed: 'phrog ma zhes kyang grags pa dang // zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin srin mor grags pa dang / ma'i mngal nas bu 'phrog pa'o //
translated: These are the yakṣiṇīs and rākṣasīs known as Hārītī, who steal children from the womb.

original: gdol pa mo ni gtum mo yang //
analyzed: gdol pa mo ni gtum mo yang //
translated: The Caṇḍālī, the fierce one,🔽Surrounded by five hundred children,

original: bu rnams lnga brgyas bskor ba dang // zhes bya ba ni ma rungs pa'i 'byung po rnams bu lnga brgya dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bu rnams lnga brgyas bskor ba dang // zhes bya ba ni ma rungs pa'i 'byung po rnams bu lnga brgya dang ldan pa'o //
translated: These are the five hundred children of the malevolent bhūtas.

original: mi sdug nag mo karka ti //
analyzed: mi sdug nag mo karka ti //
translated: The ugly black one, the crab,

original: padma dang ni padma can //
analyzed: padma dang ni padma can //
translated: The lotus and the lotus-bearer,

original: zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin mo de rnams yang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin mo de rnams yang /

original: rig sngags kyi dmod mos sdod par mi nus te /
analyzed: rig sngags kyi dmod mos sdod par mi nus te /
translated: They are unable to remain under the curse of the vidyādhara,

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar 'khod pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar 'khod pa'o //
translated: And so they sit in the presence of the Buddha.🔽The flower, the sister, the rākṣasī with the donkey’s nose,

original: me tog so dang sa ga dang // srin mo bong bu'i sna can dang // zhes bya ba ni srin mo de rnams lho phyogs na gnas shing sems can rnams la gnod pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: me tog so dang sa ga dang // srin mo bong bu'i sna can dang // zhes bya ba ni srin mo de rnams lho phyogs na gnas shing sems can rnams la gnod pa byed pa'o //
translated: These rākṣasīs live in the south and harm sentient beings.

original: tsandan dang ni khyab 'jug len //
analyzed: tsandan dang ni khyab 'jug len //
translated: The sandalwood, the Viṣṇu-bearer,

original: seng ge ser skya dmar ser po //
analyzed: seng ge ser skya dmar ser po //
translated: The lion is yellow, the tawny one is red.

original: zhes bya ba ni de dag ni gnod sbyin gyi ded dpon du gnas pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de dag ni gnod sbyin gyi ded dpon du gnas pa /
translated: These are the chief Yakṣa leaders.

original: byis pa'i gdon bco lnga'i gtso bo rnams so //
analyzed: byis pa'i gdon bco lnga'i gtso bo rnams so //
translated: The fifteen child-demons are the chief ones.

original: glang po klu yi so can dang // ri bshes drag po'i mche ba can //
analyzed: glang po klu yi so can dang // ri bshes drag po'i mche ba can //
translated: The elephant has the tusks of a nāga, the mountain friend has the tusks of a tiger.

original: zhes bya ba ni de dang de ldan zhing sems can rnams la gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de dang de ldan zhing sems can rnams la gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: These are the ones who have these and who harm sentient beings.

original: srin mo so bzang yod pa dang // tshangs pa len dang khyab 'jug len //
analyzed: srin mo so bzang yod pa dang // tshangs pa len dang khyab 'jug len //
translated: The rākṣasī has good teeth, Brahmā takes, Viṣṇu takes.

original: zhes bya ba ni ming der grags pa sems can la gnod pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ming der grags pa sems can la gnod pa /
translated: These are the ones who are known by these names and harm sentient beings.

original: skad cig mas gling bzhir rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig mas gling bzhir rgyu ba'o //
translated: They move through the four continents in an instant.🔽The yakṣa Hālāhala, the yakṣa with a beak face,

original: gnod sbyin ha la ha la dang // gnod sbyin rnam pa'i mchu can dag / ces bya ba ni gnod sbyin 'di dag kyang /
analyzed: gnod sbyin ha la ha la dang // gnod sbyin rnam pa'i mchu can dag / ces bya ba ni gnod sbyin 'di dag kyang /

original: lcang lo can gyi pho brang du gnas shing /
analyzed: lcang lo can gyi pho brang du gnas shing /

original: rnam thos kyi bu'i 'khor du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam thos kyi bu'i 'khor du gnas pa'o //

original: mdung dang mda' gzhu kun thogs shing //
analyzed: mdung dang mda' gzhu kun thogs shing //
translated: They all hold spears, arrows, and bows,

original: mi rta ba lang ri dags rnams //
analyzed: mi rta ba lang ri dags rnams //
translated: and men, horses, cattle, and deer.

original: zhes bya ba ni mtshon sna tshogs thogs shing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mtshon sna tshogs thogs shing /

original: sems can rnams la gnod pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la gnod pa byed pa'o //
translated: and they harm sentient beings.

original: za zhing 'tshe ba de dag ni //
analyzed: za zhing 'tshe ba de dag ni //
translated: Those who eat and harm

original: phyogs rnams kun du rgyug cing 'dong //
analyzed: phyogs rnams kun du rgyug cing 'dong //
translated: run around in all directions.

analyzed: zhes @43b bya ba ni sems can rnams la glags tshol zhing srog 'phrog pa rnams so //
translated: They are those who seek an opportunity to harm sentient beings and steal their life force.

original: sa 'di rab tu g-yo bar byed //
analyzed: sa 'di rab tu g-yo bar byed //
translated: They make this earth tremble.

original: nags tshal rnams kyang rab tu skems //🔽zhes bya ba ni ri rab 'gul bar byed cing /
analyzed: nags tshal rnams kyang rab tu skems // zhes bya ba ni ri rab 'gul bar byed cing /
translated: They dry up the forests.🔽They make Mount Meru shake and

original: rgya mtsho yang skems par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho yang skems par byed pa'o //

original: ri rnams kun nas g-yo bar byed //
analyzed: ri rnams kun nas g-yo bar byed //

original: skye dgu 'di dag 'tshe byed cing //
analyzed: skye dgu 'di dag 'tshe byed cing //

original: zhes bya ba ni tshe'i bar chod byed /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshe'i bar chod byed /

original: sems can rnams la 'jigs skrag byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la 'jigs skrag byed pa'o //
translated: and frighten sentient beings.🔽They gather from all around

analyzed: phan tshun nas ni 'du ba dag / rig sngags kyis ni drangs nas lhags //
translated: and are summoned by the vidyā mantra.

original: zhes bya ba ni de dang der ldan pa'i 'byung po rnams la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de dang der ldan pa'i 'byung po rnams la /
translated: The bhūtas that are associated with this and that

original: rig sngags kyi bcing ba lnga'i dmod mo'i zhags pas bsdams pa'o //🔽phyag 'tshal skyes bu dpa' khyod la //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi bcing ba lnga'i dmod mo'i zhags pas bsdams pa'o // phyag 'tshal skyes bu dpa' khyod la //
translated: He is bound by the noose of the curse of the five bonds of the knowledge mantra.🔽Homage to you, O hero of men!

original: phyag 'tshal skyes bu mchog khyod la //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal skyes bu mchog khyod la //
translated: Homage to you, O supreme man!

original: zhes bya ba ni 'byung po de rnams kyis kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'byung po de rnams kyis kyang /
translated: Thus, even those spirits

original: 'jig rten mgon po'i spyan snga ru //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon po'i spyan snga ru //
translated: in the presence of the Lord of the World

original: gus pas phyag 'tshal nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: gus pas phyag 'tshal nas bstod pa'o //
translated: pay homage with devotion and praise.

original: thal mo sbyar nas phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar nas phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: With palms joined, I pay homage!

original: chos rgyal khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //🔽zhes bya ba ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i chos kyi srid mdzad cing /
analyzed: chos rgyal khyod la phyag 'tshal lo // zhes bya ba ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i chos kyi srid mdzad cing /
translated: I pay homage to you, O Dharma King!

original: dam pa'i chos kyi rgyal po la gus par phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi rgyal po la gus par phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Thus, with devotion, they pay homage to the Dharma King who rules over the great trichiliocosm.

original: 'jig rten mgon po'i spyan snga ru //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon po'i spyan snga ru //
translated: In the presence of the Lord of the World,

original: gus pas phyag 'tshal bstod pa'o //
analyzed: gus pas phyag 'tshal bstod pa'o //
translated: they pay homage with devotion and praise.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'byung po rnams kyis so so rang rang gi sgo nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'byung po rnams kyis so so rang rang gi sgo nas /
translated: Thus, the spirits, each in their own way,

original: chos kyi rgyal po la zhu ba phul ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal po la zhu ba phul ba'o //

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni 'byung pos smras pa'i don de nas so //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni 'byung pos smras pa'i don de nas so //

original: rgyal po chen po rnam thos byus //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po rnam thos byus //

analyzed: 'jig rten mgon la 'di skad gsol // zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa la /
translated: spoke to the Lord of the World as follows:

original: rgyal po chen po rnam thos sras kyis zhus pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po rnam thos sras kyis zhus pa'o //

original: bdag gi phyogs cha byang phyogs su //
analyzed: bdag gi phyogs cha byang phyogs su //
translated: In the northern direction of my realm,

original: rgyal po'i gnas su sprul pa ni //
analyzed: rgyal po'i gnas su sprul pa ni //
translated: an emanation of a king

original: zhes bya ba ni ri rab kyi byang phyogs na mnga' mdzad cing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ri rab kyi byang phyogs na mnga' mdzad cing /
translated: This is the one who rules in the northern direction of Mount Meru,

original: byang phyogs skyong bar byed pa'o //🔽lcang lor ldan pa yid du mchi //
analyzed: byang phyogs skyong bar byed pa'o // lcang lor ldan pa yid du mchi //
translated: and protects the northern direction.🔽I am the lord of Aḍakavatī,

original: de bas bdag ni lcang lo'i bdag / zhes bya ba ni lta na sdug cing mdzes par snang ba yid du 'ong bar gnas so //
analyzed: de bas bdag ni lcang lo'i bdag / zhes bya ba ni lta na sdug cing mdzes par snang ba yid du 'ong bar gnas so //
translated: because I dwell there, pleasing to the mind, beautiful and lovely to behold.

original: rgyal po'i pho brang lcang lo can //
analyzed: rgyal po'i pho brang lcang lo can //

original: lha rnams kun gyis bsam par gyur //
analyzed: lha rnams kun gyis bsam par gyur //

original: zhes bya ba ni las kyi lhas byin gyis brlabs pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni las kyi lhas byin gyis brlabs pa /

original: rin po che'i gzhal yas khang du snang ba'o //
analyzed: rin po che'i gzhal yas khang du snang ba'o //

original: phyir shin tu mthon be can //
analyzed: phyir shin tu mthon be can //

analyzed: rin chen kun gyis brgyan pa lags // zhes bya ba ni rin po che @44a * //

original: sna bdun las byas pa /
analyzed: sna bdun las byas pa /
translated: This means made of the seven precious substances,

original: rgya phebs dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rgya phebs dang ldan pa /
translated: with a canopy,

original: bdun thog yod pa'o //
analyzed: bdun thog yod pa'o //

original: 'phang du dpag tshad bcu drug ste //
analyzed: 'phang du dpag tshad bcu drug ste //
translated: Sixteen yojanas high,

original: gser gyi rgyu las bgyis pa lags //
analyzed: gser gyi rgyu las bgyis pa lags //
translated: made of gold.

original: zhes bya ba ni thog re re la dpag tshad bcu drug bcu drug ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thog re re la dpag tshad bcu drug bcu drug ste /
translated: This means each story is sixteen yojanas high,

original: rin po che sna bdun gyis phra byas pa'o //
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun gyis phra byas pa'o //
translated: and made of the seven precious substances.

original: byogs  bzhi lcog ni re re la'ang //
analyzed: byogs  bzhi lcog ni re re la'ang //
translated: In each of the four corners🔽of the palace, Yakshas with vajra in hand

analyzed: gnod sbyin lag na rdo rje dag / ces bya ba ni sgo bzhi dang ldan pa phyogs re re nas srung mar snang ba'o //

original: kun nas rab tu gnas par gyur //
analyzed: kun nas rab tu gnas par gyur //
translated: They are all well established,

original: lag na mtshon cha legs par sprul //
analyzed: lag na mtshon cha legs par sprul //
translated: with weapons well manifested in their hands.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin pho mo mang po gnas shing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin pho mo mang po gnas shing /
translated: This means many male and female Yakshas dwell there,

original: mtshon cha sna tshogs thogs pa'o //🔽rgyal po'i pho brang de yi sgo //
analyzed: mtshon cha sna tshogs thogs pa'o // rgyal po'i pho brang de yi sgo //
translated: holding various weapons.🔽The fourth gate of that royal palace

original: bzhi pa gtod par bgyis pa ni //
analyzed: bzhi pa gtod par bgyis pa ni //
translated: is entrusted to

original: zhes bya ba ni ka ba brgyad kyis mdzes pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ka ba brgyad kyis mdzes pa /

original: rgyan rnam bzhis lta na sdug pa'o //
analyzed: rgyan rnam bzhis lta na sdug pa'o //
translated: It is lovely to behold with its four adornments.

original: gcig ni gser las bgyis pa'i sgo //
analyzed: gcig ni gser las bgyis pa'i sgo //

original: gnyis pa dngul las bgyis pa lags //
analyzed: gnyis pa dngul las bgyis pa lags //
translated: The second is made of silver.

original: zhes bya ba ni thog re re la yang sgo bzhi bzhi dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thog re re la yang sgo bzhi bzhi dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Each of the four sides has four doors.

original: gsum pa shel gyi sgo mo lags //
analyzed: gsum pa shel gyi sgo mo lags //
translated: The third is a crystal door.

original: bzhi pa gser gyis rnam par smras //
analyzed: bzhi pa gser gyis rnam par smras //

original: zhes bya ba ni rim pa bzhin du rin po che rnams kyis byas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rim pa bzhin du rin po che rnams kyis byas pa'o //

original: grong khyer de yi nang dag na //
analyzed: grong khyer de yi nang dag na //
translated: In the middle of the city

original: skyed mos tshal gyi me tog rgyas //
analyzed: skyed mos tshal gyi me tog rgyas //

original: zhes bya ba ni rdzing bu dang / me tog gi ra ba chu las skyes pa dang / thang las skyes pas brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdzing bu dang / me tog gi ra ba chu las skyes pa dang / thang las skyes pas brgyan pa'o //
translated: The ponds and flower gardens are adorned with water-born and land-born flowers.🔽In the middle of that

original: de yi nang na gzhal med khang /
analyzed: de yi nang na gzhal med khang /
translated: is a celestial palace

original: rin chen sna bdun sna tshogs mchis //
analyzed: rin chen sna bdun sna tshogs mchis //

original: zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin pho rnams spyod pa byed pa'i gzhal yas khang snang ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnod sbyin pho rnams spyod pa byed pa'i gzhal yas khang snang ba'o //
translated: The celestial palace appears where the male yakshas carry out their activities.

original: rin chen sna tshogs ljon shing dang // bya bran sna tshogs skad kyang 'byin //
analyzed: rin chen sna tshogs ljon shing dang // bya bran sna tshogs skad kyang 'byin //
translated: and various birds sing.

original: zhes bya ba ni de'i skyed mos tshal dang rdzing bur /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de'i skyed mos tshal dang rdzing bur /

original: khrung khrung dang khu byug la sogs pa bya sna tshogs kyi skad kyis mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: khrung khrung dang khu byug la sogs pa bya sna tshogs kyi skad kyis mdzes pa'o //

original: me tog sna tshogs legs par bkram //
analyzed: me tog sna tshogs legs par bkram //
translated: Various flowers are well arranged,

original: sna tshogs spos kyis byugs pa lags //
analyzed: sna tshogs spos kyis byugs pa lags //
translated: and it is anointed with various fragrances.

original: zhes bya ba ni chu dang thang las skyes pa'i me tog ku mu ta dang punda r'i ka la sogs pas brgyan pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chu dang thang las skyes pa'i me tog ku mu ta dang punda r'i ka la sogs pas brgyan pa /
translated: This is adorned with water and land-born flowers such as kumuda, pundarika, and so on.

original: yan lag brgyad dang sbyar ba'i pog phor dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag brgyad dang sbyar ba'i pog phor dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with incense burners made of the eight branches.🔽The yakshini conqueror,

original: gnod sbyin mo ni 'joms ma dang // glu dang rol mos rab tu brgyan //
analyzed: gnod sbyin mo ni 'joms ma dang // glu dang rol mos rab tu brgyan //
