original: zhes bya ba ni lta na sdug pa rgyags ma dang ldan pa she dag rnams kyis /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lta na sdug pa rgyags ma dang ldan pa she dag rnams kyis /
translated: This is the delightful and proud she-yakshas.

original: rol mo sna tshogs la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rol mo sna tshogs la spyod pa'o //
translated: They enjoy various music.

original: dpal gyi dam pa nyams su myong //
analyzed: dpal gyi dam pa nyams su myong //
translated: Experiencing the supreme glory,

original: der ni 'byung po'i dkyil 'khor @44b der ;
analyzed: der ni 'byung po'i dkyil 'khor @44b der ;
translated: there is the mandala of spirits.

original: ; zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga phun sum tshogs pa de rnams la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: ; zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga phun sum tshogs pa de rnams la spyod pa'o //
translated: This is the enjoyment of the abundance of the five sense objects.

original: gang dag 'khor zhing mchis pa dag / rnam pa'i mchog kun ldan pa ste //
analyzed: gang dag 'khor zhing mchis pa dag / rnam pa'i mchog kun ldan pa ste //
translated: Those who are in the retinue, who have all the best aspects,

original: zhes bya ba ni yid bzhin nor bu bzhin du 'dod pa gang yang 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yid bzhin nor bu bzhin du 'dod pa gang yang 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is the arising of any wish, like a wish-fulfilling gem.

original: chos 'tshal ba dang chos spyod pa //
analyzed: chos 'tshal ba dang chos spyod pa //
translated: Those who know the Dharma and practice the Dharma,

original: zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i bka' nyan nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i bka' nyan nas /
translated: Having listened to the teachings of the Perfectly Awakened One,

original: mi la sogs pa sems can gang la yang gnod pa mi skyel zhing sdom pa gsum la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mi la sogs pa sems can gang la yang gnod pa mi skyel zhing sdom pa gsum la gnas pa'o //
translated: they do not harm any sentient beings, such as humans, and abide in the three vows.

original: srog chags rnams la 'tshe mi bgyid //
analyzed: srog chags rnams la 'tshe mi bgyid //
translated: They do not harm any living beings.

original: zas dang skom gyis mi brel te //
analyzed: zas dang skom gyis mi brel te //
translated: They are not troubled by food and drink.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi sems can rnams la dga' zhing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi sems can rnams la dga' zhing /
translated: This is delighting in the sentient beings of the world,

original: byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa'o //
translated: and possessing the mind of enlightenment.

original: skye dgu mi bzad gzhan dag ni //
analyzed: skye dgu mi bzad gzhan dag ni //
translated: Other unbearable beings

original: longs spyod chen po tshol bgyid cing //
analyzed: longs spyod chen po tshol bgyid cing //
translated: seek great enjoyments.🔽This is delighting in the assembly of humans,

original: zhes bya ba ni mi'i tshogs rnams la phrad par dga' zhing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi'i tshogs rnams la phrad par dga' zhing /
translated: and

original: phun sum tshogs par byas nas skyong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs par byas nas skyong bar byed pa'o //
translated: and having made them perfect, he protects them.

original: phyogs bzhi kun du rnam par lta //
analyzed: phyogs bzhi kun du rnam par lta //
translated: He looks in all four directions.🔽At the gates of the city

original: grong khyer sgo yi gom yo dang // zhes bya ba ni mi'i grong khyer gyi phyogs bzhi nas srung zhing /
analyzed: grong khyer sgo yi gom yo dang // zhes bya ba ni mi'i grong khyer gyi phyogs bzhi nas srung zhing /
translated: he is the one who guards the four directions.

original: de rnams mtho bar dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams mtho bar dga' ba'o //
translated: He is the one who delights in their prosperity.

original: bza' shing rab nags tshal na //
analyzed: bza' shing rab nags tshal na //
translated: In the forest of the garden of trees

original: gnod sbyin srin po 'byung po'i tshogs //
analyzed: gnod sbyin srin po 'byung po'i tshogs //
translated: the hosts of yakṣas, rākṣasas, and bhūtas🔽are the beings who dwell there.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang dag gang du gnas pa'i 'byung po rnams la rig sngags 'di'i dmod mos 'khod pa'o ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang dag gang du gnas pa'i 'byung po rnams la rig sngags 'di'i dmod mos 'khod pa'o ;
translated: They are bound by the curse of this knowledge mantra.

original: ; bye ba stong phrag brgya mchis pa //🔽de dag thams cad mdo sde yi //
analyzed: ; bye ba stong phrag brgya mchis pa // de dag thams cad mdo sde yi //
translated: The hundreds of thousands of millions🔽are all drawn in by the noose🔽of this sūtra

original: zhags pas drangs te brlag par bgyi //
analyzed: zhags pas drangs te brlag par bgyi //
translated: and destroyed.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang yang rung ba gnod pa rnams la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang yang rung ba gnod pa rnams la /
translated: Whoever is harmed

original: rig sngags kyi dmod mo'i zhags pas 'dul bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rig sngags kyi dmod mo'i zhags pas 'dul bar byed pa'o //
translated: is subdued by the noose of the curse of this knowledge mantra.

original: rgyal po'i pho brang dbus na ni //
analyzed: rgyal po'i pho brang dbus na ni //
translated: In the middle of the royal palace

original: chos kyi rgyal po'i gnas gyur pa //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal po'i gnas gyur pa //
translated: is the abode of the Dharma king.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyal po chen po bzhi'i dbus su /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyal po chen po bzhi'i dbus su /
translated: In the middle of the four great kings,

original: dmigs pa med pa'i pho brang snang ba'o //🔽bsil ba'i rdzing bus bskor ba ste //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i pho brang snang ba'o // bsil ba'i rdzing bus bskor ba ste //
translated: the palace of non-apprehension appears.🔽It is surrounded by cool ponds,

original: tsandan nags kyis 'khor ba lags //
analyzed: tsandan nags kyis 'khor ba lags //
translated: and encircled by sandalwood forests.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la bsil bar byed pa'i ye shes kyis bskor zhing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la bsil bar byed pa'i ye shes kyis bskor zhing /
translated: It is surrounded by the wisdom that cools sentient beings,

original: byams pa dang snying rje'i nags tshal gyis bskor ba'o //
analyzed: byams pa dang snying rje'i nags tshal gyis bskor ba'o //
translated: and encircled by the forests of love and compassion.

original: kun nas dpag tshad drug cu ste //
analyzed: kun nas dpag tshad drug cu ste //
translated: It is sixty yojanas in extent,🔽with terraces of stacked houses.

original: khang pa brtsegs pa spul  pa dag / ces bya ba ni sems can gyi gzhal yas khang du snang zhing yid bzhin nor bu lta bu'o //🔽gcig ni gser las bgyis pa ste //
analyzed: khang pa brtsegs pa spul  pa dag / ces bya ba ni sems can gyi gzhal yas khang du snang zhing yid bzhin nor bu lta bu'o // gcig ni gser las bgyis pa ste //
translated: It appears as the immeasurable palace of sentient beings, like a wish-fulfilling gem.🔽One is made of gold,

original: gnyis ni dngul las bgyis pa lags //
analyzed: gnyis ni dngul las bgyis pa lags //
translated: and the other is made of silver.

original: @45a * // zhes bya ba ni phyi nang gnyis su med par rin po che gser dngul las byas pa'o //
analyzed: @45a * // zhes bya ba ni phyi nang gnyis su med par rin po che gser dngul las byas pa'o //
translated: It is made of precious gold and silver, without inner and outer duality.

original: gsum pa bee d'urya las bgyis //
analyzed: gsum pa bee d'urya las bgyis //
translated: The third is made of lapis lazuli,

original: bzhi pa gtsang dang shel gyi rgyu //
analyzed: bzhi pa gtsang dang shel gyi rgyu //
translated: and the fourth is made of crystal and quartz.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos mi 'gyur bar snang bas bee d'urya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos mi 'gyur bar snang bas bee d'urya ste /
translated: This is a vaidurya, because the Dharma appears without changing.

original: phyi nang gnyis su med par gsal ba ni shel lta bu'o //
analyzed: phyi nang gnyis su med par gsal ba ni shel lta bu'o //
translated: It is clear without an inner or outer, like a crystal.

original: lnga pa mu tig dmar po ste //
analyzed: lnga pa mu tig dmar po ste //
translated: The fifth is a red pearl,

original: drug pa rdo yi snying po lags //
analyzed: drug pa rdo yi snying po lags //
translated: and the sixth is a heart of stone.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje pha lam las byas pa'i seng ge'i khar mu tig gi dra ba'i phreng bas te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje pha lam las byas pa'i seng ge'i khar mu tig gi dra ba'i phreng bas te /
translated: This is a lion made of diamond, with a garland of pearl nets.

original: de yang mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa'o //
translated: It is also adorned with the thirty-two major marks and the eighty minor marks.

original: bdun pa spug las bgyis pa ste //
analyzed: bdun pa spug las bgyis pa ste //
translated: The seventh is made of coral,

original: brgyad pa rin chen bdun las bgyis //
analyzed: brgyad pa rin chen bdun las bgyis //
translated: and the eighth is made of the seven precious substances.

original: zhes bya ba ni rin chen dra ba dang dra ba'i yon tan gyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rin chen dra ba dang dra ba'i yon tan gyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: This is adorned with a net of jewels and the qualities of the net.

original: bud med stong phrag brgya dag kyang //
analyzed: bud med stong phrag brgya dag kyang //
translated: And also hundreds of thousands of women

original: de dag re re kun na gnas //
analyzed: de dag re re kun na gnas //
translated: are present in each of them.

original: zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin gnyis su med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin gnyis su med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This is endowed with the nondual wisdom that is the nature of wisdom.

original: lhab lhub sna tshogs mchog dag dang // cha byad sna tshogs mang pos brgyan //
analyzed: lhab lhub sna tshogs mchog dag dang // cha byad sna tshogs mang pos brgyan //
translated: and with many different kinds of attire.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa bzhi'i rgyan gyis brgyan cing mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshad med pa bzhi'i rgyan gyis brgyan cing mdzes pa'o //
translated: This is the beauty of being adorned with the ornaments of the four immeasurables.🔽With various songs and music,

original: glu dang rol mo sna tshogs dang // bzo yi gnas la mkhas pa mchis //
analyzed: glu dang rol mo sna tshogs dang // bzo yi gnas la mkhas pa mchis //
translated: and skilled in the arts.

original: zhes bya ba ni zag pa zad pa'i ye shes dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zag pa zad pa'i ye shes dang ldan zhing /
translated: This is having the wisdom of the exhaustion of defilements,

original: sems can rnams kyi las 'joms par byed pa la mkhas pa'o//
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi las 'joms par byed pa la mkhas pa'o//
translated: and being skilled in destroying the karma of sentient beings.

original: de lta'i rab tu dga' ba yis //
analyzed: de lta'i rab tu dga' ba yis //
translated: With such joy,

original: bde zhing tshim pa'i yid du gyur //
analyzed: bde zhing tshim pa'i yid du gyur //
translated: my mind is blissful and satisfied.

original: zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i ye shes dang ldan zhing bde bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i ye shes dang ldan zhing bde bar gnas pa'o //
translated: This is having perfect wisdom and abiding in bliss.🔽There, I am intoxicated by wine

original: de na bdag ni rgun skyems dang // 'dod pa dag gis rab myos pas //
analyzed: de na bdag ni rgun skyems dang // 'dod pa dag gis rab myos pas //
translated: and desires.

original: zhes bya ba ni de yang 'byung po la sogs pa'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la spyod cing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de yang 'byung po la sogs pa'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la spyod cing /
translated: This is enjoying the five sense objects of spirits and so forth,

original: 'dod pa'i zhags pas bcings pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zhags pas bcings pa'o //
translated: and being bound by the noose of desire.

original: bdag gi 'khor rnams 'phyan bgyid cing //
analyzed: bdag gi 'khor rnams 'phyan bgyid cing //
translated: My retinue wanders

original: phyogs bcu dag tu 'jigs pa skyed //
analyzed: phyogs bcu dag tu 'jigs pa skyed //
translated: They cause fear in the ten directions.

original: ces bya ba ni rgyal po chen po rnam thos kyi bu'i 'khor tshan gcig kyang /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rgyal po chen po rnam thos kyi bu'i 'khor tshan gcig kyang /
translated: This refers to a group of the retinue of the great king Vaiśravaṇa

original: sdig la dga' bas sems can la 'jigs skrag byed pa'o //
analyzed: sdig la dga' bas sems can la 'jigs skrag byed pa'o //
translated: who frighten sentient beings with evil.🔽Women, men, and likewise boys and girls

original: bud med dag dang skyes pa dang // de bzhin khye'u dang bu mo dang // zhes bya ba ni gzi brjid 'phrog pa she dag go //
analyzed: bud med dag dang skyes pa dang // de bzhin khye'u dang bu mo dang // zhes bya ba ni gzi brjid 'phrog pa she dag go //
translated: are the ones who steal splendor.

original: mngal na gnas pa 'jigs par byed //
analyzed: mngal na gnas pa 'jigs par byed //
translated: They cause fear in the womb.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas gtogs pa la'ang 'tshe //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas gtogs pa la'ang 'tshe //
translated: They harm those who are born as animals.

original: zhes bya ba ni mer mer po dang nur nur po rnams 'phrog cing dud 'gro rnams kyi srog @45b 'phrog pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mer mer po dang nur nur po rnams 'phrog cing dud 'gro rnams kyi srog @45b 'phrog pa'o //
translated: This refers to those who steal embryos and fetuses and take the lives of animals.🔽The stars, the sun and moon,

original: skar ma dag dang nyi zla dang // gtum pa'i gza' rnams gnod par bgyid //
analyzed: skar ma dag dang nyi zla dang // gtum pa'i gza' rnams gnod par bgyid //
translated: and the fierce planets cause harm.

original: ces bya ba ni zla ba nyi ma mi snang bar byas shing /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni zla ba nyi ma mi snang bar byas shing /
translated: This refers to those who make the moon and sun invisible

original: bza' ba dang btung ba rnams 'phrog pa'o //
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba rnams 'phrog pa'o //
translated: and steal food and drink.

original: lo thogs bon 'bras bu dang // me tog sman dang zas skom dang // zhes bya ba ni 'byung po de rnams kyis kyang dus ma yin pa'i rlung dang ser ba gtong ba'o //
analyzed: lo thogs bon 'bras bu dang // me tog sman dang zas skom dang // zhes bya ba ni 'byung po de rnams kyis kyang dus ma yin pa'i rlung dang ser ba gtong ba'o //
translated: This means that those spirits also send untimely winds and hail.

original: mi rnams kyi ni dpal 'phrog cing //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi ni dpal 'phrog cing //
translated: They steal the glory of humans,

original: mthon po rnams kyang dma' bar bgyid //
analyzed: mthon po rnams kyang dma' bar bgyid //
translated: and make the lofty low.

original: ces bya ba ni gzi brjid dang phun sum tshogs pa 'phrog par byed pa /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gzi brjid dang phun sum tshogs pa 'phrog par byed pa /
translated: This means that they steal away splendor and excellence.

original: phyug po ltogs por gtong ba dag go //
analyzed: phyug po ltogs por gtong ba dag go //
translated: They make the rich poor.

original: 'jig rten dag la nongs pa rnams //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag la nongs pa rnams //
translated: The misfortunes in the world,🔽the wars, the quarrels, the intrigues,

original: dmag dang 'thab mo shar gnyer dang // zhes bya ba ni khrag khrug la dga' bar byed pa 'am /
analyzed: dmag dang 'thab mo shar gnyer dang // zhes bya ba ni khrag khrug la dga' bar byed pa 'am /
translated: This means that they delight in chaos,

original: mi'i 'jig rten gyi sems rnam par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi'i 'jig rten gyi sems rnam par byed pa'o //
translated: or they disturb the minds of the people of the world.

original: tshig gam zhig gam gsad bya ba //
analyzed: tshig gam zhig gam gsad bya ba //
translated: The words, the quarrels, the killings,

original: de kun 'byung po'i rnam par gyur //
analyzed: de kun 'byung po'i rnam par gyur //
translated: all that is the work of spirits.

original: zhes bya ba ni khrag khrug la sman ma byas shing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khrag khrug la sman ma byas shing /
translated: This means that they do not bring peace to the chaos,

original: mi rnams kyi srog 'phrog pa'o //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi srog 'phrog pa'o //
translated: and they steal away the lives of humans.

original: sbed cing stor bar bgyid pa dang // zlog par bgyid cing rgod par byed //
analyzed: sbed cing stor bar bgyid pa dang // zlog par bgyid cing rgod par byed //
translated: they cause reversal and agitation.

original: ces bya ba ni 'byung po de rnams bzung nas /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'byung po de rnams bzung nas /
translated: Having seized those beings,

original: zas dang skom yang mi 'ju zhing bzlog ste /
analyzed: zas dang skom yang mi 'ju zhing bzlog ste /
translated: they do not digest food and drink, and cause reversal.

original: sped pa ni nad sna tshogs gtong zhing sems yang stor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sped pa ni nad sna tshogs gtong zhing sems yang stor bar byed pa'o //
translated: Hiding means they send various illnesses and cause the mind to be lost.

original: res 'ga' yang sems smyo bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' yang sems smyo bar byed pa'o //
translated: Sometimes they cause the mind to go crazy.

original: byed pa rgod pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa rgod pa'o //
translated: Agitation means they cause agitation.

original: 'jigs par byed cing lta bar bgyid //
analyzed: 'jigs par byed cing lta bar bgyid //
translated: They cause fear and make them look.

original: dgrar 'gyur ba yang ston par bgyid //
analyzed: dgrar 'gyur ba yang ston par bgyid //
translated: They show themselves as enemies.

original: ces bya ba ni skyes pa bud med khye'u bu mo rnams la rims dang yams nad gyis btab cing /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni skyes pa bud med khye'u bu mo rnams la rims dang yams nad gyis btab cing /
translated: This means they afflict men, women, boys, and girls with fever and plague,

original: 'jigs skrag byed cing bla 'tshol smra ba'o //
analyzed: 'jigs skrag byed cing bla 'tshol smra ba'o //
translated: and cause fear and make them speak of seeking a life force.

original: lta ba ni dran pa stor zhing nam mkha' dang sa gzhi la lta ba rnams te /
analyzed: lta ba ni dran pa stor zhing nam mkha' dang sa gzhi la lta ba rnams te /
translated: Looking means they cause loss of memory and make them look at the sky and the ground.

original: sems mi dga' bar byas nas du ba'i sgra 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: sems mi dga' bar byas nas du ba'i sgra 'byin pa'o //
translated: Having made the mind unhappy, they emit the sound of smoke.

original: sdig pa'i rmi lam mthong bar bgyid //
analyzed: sdig pa'i rmi lam mthong bar bgyid //
translated: They cause one to see evil dreams.

original: nyal ba dag la gnod par bgyid //
analyzed: nyal ba dag la gnod par bgyid //
translated: They harm those who are sleeping.

original: ces bya ba ni shin tu 'jigs pa'i rmi lam dang / mi dge ba'i ltas ston te /🔽skyes pa la mor sgyur cing gnod la /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni shin tu 'jigs pa'i rmi lam dang / mi dge ba'i ltas ston te / skyes pa la mor sgyur cing gnod la /
translated: This indicates very frightening dreams and inauspicious omens.🔽It harms men by turning them into women,

original: bud med la phor sgyur cing gnod pa'o //
analyzed: bud med la phor sgyur cing gnod pa'o //
translated: and it harms women by turning them into men.

original: sgo nas se gol sgra 'byung zhing //
analyzed: sgo nas se gol sgra 'byung zhing //
translated: It makes sounds with the mouth,

original: mi dran brjed de za bar bgyid //
analyzed: mi dran brjed de za bar bgyid //
translated: and it causes one to eat while absentminded and forgetful.

original: ces bya ba ni grong dang grong khyer du rgyu zhing /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni grong dang grong khyer du rgyu zhing /
translated: This indicates wandering in villages and towns,

original: se gol tsam gyis khrag khrug byed do //🔽khrag khrug gi sman mas za ba dang 'thung @46a * //
analyzed: se gol tsam gyis khrag khrug byed do // khrag khrug gi sman mas za ba dang 'thung @46a * //
translated: and making a commotion with just a snap of the fingers.

original: bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bar byed pa'o //
translated: It causes one to eat and drink the food and drink of a commotion.

original: mdza' bo gnyen bshes gzugs dag tu //
analyzed: mdza' bo gnyen bshes gzugs dag tu //
translated: In the forms of friends and relatives,

original: dga' zhing bka' mchid smra bar bgyid //
analyzed: dga' zhing bka' mchid smra bar bgyid //
translated: it speaks pleasantly.

original: ces bya ba ni tshe 'di dang phyi ma yang /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni tshe 'di dang phyi ma yang /
translated: This indicates being born in this life and the next

original: mdza' bo dang gnyen bshes su skyes shing mi de la gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mdza' bo dang gnyen bshes su skyes shing mi de la gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: as friends and relatives, and it harms that person.

original: bu mo sdu gu'i gzugs dag tu //
analyzed: bu mo sdu gu'i gzugs dag tu //
translated: In the forms of beautiful girls,

original: 'dod la spyod pa dga' bar bgyid //
analyzed: 'dod la spyod pa dga' bar bgyid //
translated: it delights in the enjoyment of desire.

original: ces bya ba ni mdzes sdug pa bu mo'i gzugs su byas nas /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni mdzes sdug pa bu mo'i gzugs su byas nas /
translated: This indicates taking on the form of a beautiful girl,🔽and

original: byang chub sems dang tshe 'phrog ma'o //🔽nyi ma skar ma'i gzugs dang ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dang tshe 'phrog ma'o // nyi ma skar ma'i gzugs dang ni //
translated: The bodhisattva and the life-stealer.🔽They appear in the form of the sun, stars,

original: zla ba'i gzugs su gda' bar bgyid //
analyzed: zla ba'i gzugs su gda' bar bgyid //
translated: and the form of the moon.

original: ces bya ba ni rmi lam dang ltas la yang de lta bu'i rmi lam rmi pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rmi lam dang ltas la yang de lta bu'i rmi lam rmi pa'o //
translated: This is also the kind of dream that is dreamt in dreams and omens.

original: rlung dang skar mda'i lce gzugs su //
analyzed: rlung dang skar mda'i lce gzugs su //
translated: The wind and the tongue of a shooting star,

original: tshe la gnod par de dag gda' //
analyzed: tshe la gnod par de dag gda' //
translated: in the form of those, they appear to harm life.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyugs chen por gyur cing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyugs chen por gyur cing /
translated: This is when one becomes a great animal,

original: nam mkha' nas 'brug sgra dang glog babs te /
analyzed: nam mkha' nas 'brug sgra dang glog babs te /
translated: and thunder and lightning strike from the sky,

original: bar snang la 'od chen po snang ba'o //
analyzed: bar snang la 'od chen po snang ba'o //
translated: and a great light appears in the sky.

original: skar ma'i tshogs dang 'dra ba dag /'jigs par bgyid pa wa dang khyi //
analyzed: skar ma'i tshogs dang 'dra ba dag /'jigs par bgyid pa wa dang khyi //
translated: Like a multitude of stars, the terrifying fox and dog,

original: zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang rmi lam la yang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang rmi lam la yang /
translated: This is also when, in reality and in dreams,

original: gcan gzan gyi gzugs su sprul nas gnod pa'o //
analyzed: gcan gzan gyi gzugs su sprul nas gnod pa'o //
translated: they emanate in the form of beasts and harm.🔽Emanating, they appear in the abodes of trees

original: rnam par sprul nas ljon shing dang // mchod rten dag gi gnas na gda' //
analyzed: rnam par sprul nas ljon shing dang // mchod rten dag gi gnas na gda' //
translated: and stupas.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnas de dag tu gnas shing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnas de dag tu gnas shing /
translated: This is when they abide in those places

original: sems can rnams la gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: and harm sentient beings.

original: skyes pa gzhon nu'i gzugs mdzes pas //
analyzed: skyes pa gzhon nu'i gzugs mdzes pas //
translated: They appear in the form of beautiful young men,

original: 'bar zhing shing rta'i sgra yang 'byin //
analyzed: 'bar zhing shing rta'i sgra yang 'byin //
translated: blazing with light and making the sound of a chariot.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'byung po de rnams kyis khye'u dang bu mor skyes nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'byung po de rnams kyis khye'u dang bu mor skyes nas /
translated: When these spirits are born as boys and girls,

original: pha ma dag la gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: pha ma dag la gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: they harm their parents.

original: shing rta'i sgra ni skad sna tshogs su 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: shing rta'i sgra ni skad sna tshogs su 'byung ba'o //
translated: The sound of a chariot is the sound of various voices.

original: gnas rnams dang ni shul dag tu //
analyzed: gnas rnams dang ni shul dag tu //
translated: In their abodes and on the roads,

original: rnam pa sna tshogs rjes kyang ston /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs rjes kyang ston /
translated: they leave various kinds of traces.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang 'od dang rdzu 'phrul ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang 'od dang rdzu 'phrul ston pa'o //
translated: They display forms, light, and magical powers.🔽The yakshas open the doors

original: grong khyer dag dang khyim rnams kyi //🔽sgro yang gnod sbyin de dag 'byed //🔽ces bya ba ni 'byung po de rnams kyi phyir 'brang zhing /🔽grong dang grong khyer rnams la gnod par byed de /
analyzed: grong khyer dag dang khyim rnams kyi // sgro yang gnod sbyin de dag 'byed // ces bya ba ni 'byung po de rnams kyi phyir 'brang zhing / grong dang grong khyer rnams la gnod par byed de /
translated: of cities and houses.🔽These spirits follow them and harm the villages and cities.

original: sgo phug dang 'phrang kar bsdad cing 'dzin pa'o ;
analyzed: sgo phug dang 'phrang kar bsdad cing 'dzin pa'o ;
translated: They stay in the doorways and narrow passages and seize them.

original: ; srog dang lus kyang blang bgyis shing //
analyzed: ; srog dang lus kyang blang bgyis shing //
translated: They take their lives and bodies

original: lam ngan kun du bskor bar bgyid //
analyzed: lam ngan kun du bskor bar bgyid //
translated: and lead them around on bad paths.

original: ces bya ba ni lus la na tsha drag por byas shing /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni lus la na tsha drag por byas shing /
translated: This means that he will cause severe illness in the body,

original: srog 'bral bar bgyid pa'o //
analyzed: srog 'bral bar bgyid pa'o //
translated: and will take away life.

original: bskal pa bdun gyi bar du yang rjes snyag pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa bdun gyi bar du yang rjes snyag pa'o //
translated: He will pursue (the victim) for seven aeons.🔽With various forms,🔽and with various sounds,

original: rnam pa sna tshogs gzugs dag dang // rnam pa sna @46b tshogs sgra rnams dang // zhes bya ba ni gzugs sna tshogs su sgyur zhing /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs gzugs dag dang // rnam pa sna @46b tshogs sgra rnams dang // zhes bya ba ni gzugs sna tshogs su sgyur zhing /
translated: This means that he will transform into various forms,

original: kha dog sna tshogs sprul pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog sna tshogs sprul pa'o //
translated: and will emanate various colors.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs nad rnams kyis //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs nad rnams kyis //
translated: With various illnesses,

original: lus la na bar gnas par ston //
analyzed: lus la na bar gnas par ston //
translated: he will show himself as being ill in the body.

original: zhes bya ba ni mdze dang lhog ba phol mig la sogs pa'i nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi ston bdag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mdze dang lhog ba phol mig la sogs pa'i nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi ston bdag go //
translated: This means that he will show the four hundred and four illnesses, such as leprosy, tumors, and boils.

original: nad rnams kun gyi mtshan nyid kyang //
analyzed: nad rnams kun gyi mtshan nyid kyang //
translated: The characteristics of all illnesses

original: phyin ci log tu ston par byed //🔽ces bya ba ni rlung dang bad kan mkhris par ston cing /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu ston par byed // ces bya ba ni rlung dang bad kan mkhris par ston cing /
translated: are shown in a distorted way.🔽This means that he will show (the victim) wind, bile, and phlegm,

original: bad kan rlung dang mkhris par ston te rtsa 'khrug par snang ba'o //
analyzed: bad kan rlung dang mkhris par ston te rtsa 'khrug par snang ba'o //
translated: and will show phlegm, wind, and bile, appearing to disturb the channels.

original: ji snyed 'jig rten rang bzhin dag / thams cad log par de dag ston //
analyzed: ji snyed 'jig rten rang bzhin dag / thams cad log par de dag ston //
translated: all of them are shown to be false.

original: zhes bya ba ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams skad cig thang cig yud tsam gyis rgyu zhing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams skad cig thang cig yud tsam gyis rgyu zhing /
translated: This means that in an instant, a short moment, a brief second, they travel through the world systems of the great trichiliocosm,

original: sems can rnams la 'tshe ba phyin ci log par ston pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la 'tshe ba phyin ci log par ston pa'o //
translated: and to sentient beings they show harm and perversity.

original: rig sngags zhags pas drangs bas na //
analyzed: rig sngags zhags pas drangs bas na //
translated: Drawn by the noose of the knowledge mantra,

original: de dag kun kyang 'dir mchis so //
analyzed: de dag kun kyang 'dir mchis so //
translated: all of them are here.

original: zhes bya ba ni stong chen mo rab tu 'joms ma'i dmod mo'i zhags pas ma rungs pa'i 'byung po rnams bcings pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni stong chen mo rab tu 'joms ma'i dmod mo'i zhags pas ma rungs pa'i 'byung po rnams bcings pa'o //
translated: This means that with the curse noose of the Great Destroyer of the trichiliocosm, the evil spirits are bound.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Then,

original: 'byung po bshad pa'i de nas so //
analyzed: 'byung po bshad pa'i de nas so //
translated: after the explanation of the spirits,

original: rgyal po chen po rnam thos bu //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po rnam thos bu //
translated: the great king Vaiśravaṇa,

original: zhes bya ba ni byang phyogs kyi gdon gnod par byed pa rnams la chad pa gcod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byang phyogs kyi gdon gnod par byed pa rnams la chad pa gcod pa'o //
translated: the one who punishes the harmful spirits of the north,🔽arose from his seat,

original: langs te thal mo rab sbyar nas //
analyzed: langs te thal mo rab sbyar nas //
translated: joined his palms,

original: zhes bya pa ni 'khor gyi nang nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar langs so //
analyzed: zhes bya pa ni 'khor gyi nang nas sangs rgyas kyi spyan sngar langs so //
translated: and from within the assembly rose up in the presence of the Buddha.

original: zhabs la 'khor lo'i mtshan mnga' ba //
analyzed: zhabs la 'khor lo'i mtshan mnga' ba //
translated: His feet bear the mark of a wheel.

original: gser gyi mchod sdong 'bar ba bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba ni mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan zhing /🔽dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa /
analyzed: gser gyi mchod sdong 'bar ba bzhin // zhes bya ba ni mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan zhing / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa /
translated: Like a blazing golden sacrificial post.🔽This describes the body that is the nature of the aggregates of the Dharma,🔽adorned with the thirty-two major marks and

original: chos kyi phung po'i rang bzhin gyi sku'o ;
analyzed: chos kyi phung po'i rang bzhin gyi sku'o ;
translated: the eighty minor marks.

original: ;'jig rten snang bar mdzad pa po //
analyzed: ;'jig rten snang bar mdzad pa po //
translated: The Illuminator of the world,

original: thub pa chen po me dang 'dra //
analyzed: thub pa chen po me dang 'dra //
translated: the Great Sage, is like a fire.

original: zhes bya ba ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na chos kyi rgyal por snang ba bskal pa me ltar 'bar ba'i 'od do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na chos kyi rgyal por snang ba bskal pa me ltar 'bar ba'i 'od do //
translated: This describes the light of the eon-ending fire that illuminates the Dharma King in the worlds of the great trichiliocosm.

original: stong phrag drug cu rtsa bzhi ni //
analyzed: stong phrag drug cu rtsa bzhi ni //
translated: The sixty-four thousand

original: gnod sbyin gsang sngags mi bzad can//🔽zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis stong chen mo'i rig sngags zhal nas gsungs pas /
analyzed: gnod sbyin gsang sngags mi bzad can// zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis stong chen mo'i rig sngags zhal nas gsungs pas /
translated: yakṣas, with their terrifying mantras,

original: gnod sbyin gyi gdon rnams brlag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi gdon rnams brlag par byed pa'o //
translated: This describes the mantras of the Blessed Buddha that destroy the yakṣa demons.

original: byang phyogs cha yi phyogs cha gnas //
analyzed: byang phyogs cha yi phyogs cha gnas //
translated: They dwell in the northern direction.

original: byang phyogs dag tu gnod par bgyid //
analyzed: byang phyogs dag tu gnod par bgyid //
translated: And bring harm to the northern direction.

original: ces bya ba ni gnod sbyin 'byung po ma rungs pa @47a * //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gnod sbyin 'byung po ma rungs pa @47a * //
translated: The harmful yakshas and bhutas

original: rnams so // 'jig rten mgon po'i spyan sngar ni //
analyzed: rnams so // 'jig rten mgon po'i spyan sngar ni //
translated: Are all gathered here before the Lord of the World.

original: de dag chad pa bdag gis bshad //
analyzed: de dag chad pa bdag gis bshad //
translated: I will now pronounce their punishment.

original: ces bya ba ni stong chen mo'i rig sngags kyi chad pas gcod pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni stong chen mo'i rig sngags kyi chad pas gcod pa'o //
translated: This is the punishment of the great thousandfold world system.

original: sy'ad ya the dan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sy'ad ya the dan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Sya dya tham.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This means:

original: gang la zhe na rig sngags 'di'o //
analyzed: gang la zhe na rig sngags 'di'o //
translated: What? This knowledge mantra.

original: byang phyogs su bdag bde legs su gyur cig ces bya ba ni bdag nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: byang phyogs su bdag bde legs su gyur cig ces bya ba ni bdag nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: May there be well-being for me in the northern direction.

original: bde legs ni sems can thams cad phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: bde legs ni sems can thams cad phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par gyur cig pa'o //
translated: Well-being means may all sentient beings be endowed with perfection.

original: de dag ni rgyal po bzhi dang phyogs skyong ba bcu'i chad pa sgres pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni rgyal po bzhi dang phyogs skyong ba bcu'i chad pa sgres pa ste /
translated: These are the punishments of the four kings and the ten directions.

original: tshangs pa dang ni brgya byin dang // 'jig rten skyong ba dbang phyug che //
analyzed: tshangs pa dang ni brgya byin dang // 'jig rten skyong ba dbang phyug che //
translated: Brahma, Indra, the world guardians, Mahesvara,

original: zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa la sogs pa gzugs khams kyi lha rnams dang / brgya byin la sogs pa 'dod khams kyi lha rnams dang / 'jig rten skyong ba bcu po dang / gnas gtsang ma dang dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa'i lha rnams dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa la sogs pa gzugs khams kyi lha rnams dang / brgya byin la sogs pa 'dod khams kyi lha rnams dang / 'jig rten skyong ba bcu po dang / gnas gtsang ma dang dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa'i lha rnams dang /
translated: The gods of the form realm, such as Brahma, and the gods of the desire realm, such as Indra, the ten world guardians, the gods of the pure abodes, Mahesvara, and so forth,🔽all the yaksha leaders,🔽together with the sons of Hara.

original: gnod sbyin ded dpon thams cad dang // 'phrog ma'i bu dang bcas pa dang // zhes bya ba ni mthu bo che sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / gnod sbyin gyi ded dpon nyi shu rtsa brgyad dang / gnod sbyin gyi ded dpon lngas rtsen dang /
analyzed: gnod sbyin ded dpon thams cad dang // 'phrog ma'i bu dang bcas pa dang // zhes bya ba ni mthu bo che sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / gnod sbyin gyi ded dpon nyi shu rtsa brgyad dang / gnod sbyin gyi ded dpon lngas rtsen dang /
translated: The thirty-two great yakshas, the twenty-eight yaksha leaders, the yaksha leader Pancasikha,

original: 'phrog ma'i bu lnga brgya'o //
analyzed: 'phrog ma'i bu lnga brgya'o //
translated: and the five hundred sons of Hara.🔽Accept this flower and incense

original: bdag gi me tog spos dag dang // sbyin sreg 'di ni blang bar gyis //
analyzed: bdag gi me tog spos dag dang // sbyin sreg 'di ni blang bar gyis //
translated: and this burnt offering of mine.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyal chen rnam thos kyi bus /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyal chen rnam thos kyi bus /
translated: The great king Vaishravana

original: sems can gyi don du de dag 'bul ba'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don du de dag 'bul ba'o //
translated: offers them for the benefit of sentient beings.🔽By their diligence,

original: de dag gi ni brtson 'grus dang // gzi brjid dbang phyug stobs kyis kyang //
analyzed: de dag gi ni brtson 'grus dang // gzi brjid dbang phyug stobs kyis kyang //
translated: their splendor, lordship, and strength,

original: zhes bya ba ni lha de dag gi mthu'i nus pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lha de dag gi mthu'i nus pa'o //
translated: This is the power of the might of those gods.

original: nad rnams thams cad bcom par gyur //
analyzed: nad rnams thams cad bcom par gyur //
translated: All diseases are destroyed.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is

original: rlung mkhris bad kan la sogs pa nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: rlung mkhris bad kan la sogs pa nad bzhi brgya rtsa bzhi 'joms pa'o //
translated: the destruction of the four hundred and four diseases, such as wind, bile, and phlegm.

original: bdag 'jigs pa dang / gnod pa thams cad las bde legs su gyur cig sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: bdag 'jigs pa dang / gnod pa thams cad las bde legs su gyur cig sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni //
translated: May I be safe and well from all fears and harms, svāhā.

original: gang zag 'di la gus par byed pa nad dang 'jigs pa las thar ba'o //🔽phyag 'tshal skyes bu dpa' khyod la //
analyzed: gang zag 'di la gus par byed pa nad dang 'jigs pa las thar ba'o // phyag 'tshal skyes bu dpa' khyod la //
translated: This is the liberation from disease and fear of those who respect this person.🔽Homage to you, O Hero,

original: phyag 'tshal skyes bu mchog khyod la ;🔽; zhes bya ba ni rgyal po chen po rnam thos kyi bus kyang /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal skyes bu mchog khyod la ; ; zhes bya ba ni rgyal po chen po rnam thos kyi bus kyang /
translated: Homage to you, O Supreme Being.

original: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus sku la brgyan pa'i sbrul pa'i sku la gus pas phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus sku la brgyan pa'i sbrul pa'i sku la gus pas phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: This is the homage with respect to the emanation body adorned with the thirty-two marks and eighty minor marks of a great being by Vaiśravaṇa, the great king.

original: thal mo sbyar te phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar te phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: With palms joined, I pay homage.

original: chos rgyal khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: chos rgyal khyod la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to you, O Dharma King.

original: zhes bya ba ni stong @47b gsum gyi stong 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi rgyal srid mdzad cing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni stong @47b gsum gyi stong 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi rgyal srid mdzad cing /
translated: This is the homage to the nature of the body, speech, and mind of the one who rules the Dharma-kingdom of the billion-world universe,

original: chos kyi rang bzhin gyis khyab ste /🔽de la sku gsung thugs kyis gus par phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin gyis khyab ste / de la sku gsung thugs kyis gus par phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: pervading it with the nature of Dharma.

original: rgyal chen yul 'khor srung ba yang //
analyzed: rgyal chen yul 'khor srung ba yang //
translated: The great king Dhṛtarāṣṭra🔽arose from his seat,

original: langs te thal mo sbyar btud nas //
analyzed: langs te thal mo sbyar btud nas //
translated: bowed with palms joined,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten mgon gyi spyan sngar gus par 'dud pa'o //🔽me tog lta bur rgyas gyur cig / ka la pingka'i sgra dbyangs can //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten mgon gyi spyan sngar gus par 'dud pa'o // me tog lta bur rgyas gyur cig / ka la pingka'i sgra dbyangs can //
translated: and said to the Lord of the World:🔽“May the lotus of your face bloom,🔽with the melodious voice of a kalaviṅka bird,

original: zhes bya ba ni zhal padma rgyas pa dang 'dra ba /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zhal padma rgyas pa dang 'dra ba /
translated: like a blooming lotus face,

original: dbyangs gsal ba la phra ba'o //🔽khu byug dang ni rma bya'i sgra //
analyzed: dbyangs gsal ba la phra ba'o // khu byug dang ni rma bya'i sgra //
translated: with a clear and subtle voice.🔽The sound of cuckoos and peacocks,

original: rnga dang 'brug gi sgra sgrogs pa //
analyzed: rnga dang 'brug gi sgra sgrogs pa //
translated: like the sound of drums and thunder,

original: zhes bya ba ni sgra gsal ba yid du 'od ba /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sgra gsal ba yid du 'od ba /
translated: with a clear and pleasing sound,

original: rol mo'i tshogs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rol mo'i tshogs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: accompanied by a host of musical instruments.🔽The great sage, with sixty-four thousand yakṣas,

original: thub chen gnod sbyin srin po dang // dri za stong phrag drug cu bzhi //
analyzed: thub chen gnod sbyin srin po dang // dri za stong phrag drug cu bzhi //
translated: rākṣasas, and gandharvas,

original: zhes bya ba ni shar phyogs na 'khod pa'i 'byung po rnams so //🔽shar gyi phyogs cha'i phyogs na gnas //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shar phyogs na 'khod pa'i 'byung po rnams so // shar gyi phyogs cha'i phyogs na gnas //
translated: This is the spirits dwelling in the east.🔽They dwell in the eastern quarter.

original: shar phyogs pa la gnod par bgyid //
analyzed: shar phyogs pa la gnod par bgyid //
translated: They harm those in the east.

original: ces bya ba ni ma rungs pa de rnams la rig sngags kyi dmod mos chad pa gcod pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni ma rungs pa de rnams la rig sngags kyi dmod mos chad pa gcod pa'o //
translated: This is the curse of the knowledge mantra against those evildoers.

original: 'jig rten mgon gyi spyan sngar ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon gyi spyan sngar ni //
translated: In the presence of the Lord of the World,

original: de dag thams cad bdag gis bshad //
analyzed: de dag thams cad bdag gis bshad //
translated: I will explain all of them.

original: ces bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i spyan sngar /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i spyan sngar /
translated: This is in the presence of the Perfectly Awakened Blessed One Shakyamuni.

original: rgyal po chen po yul 'khor srung gis zhus pa'o//
analyzed: rgyal po chen po yul 'khor srung gis zhus pa'o//
translated: It is the request of the Great King Dhritarashtra.

original: gang zhus na /
analyzed: gang zhus na /
translated: What was requested?

original: dri za la sogs pa'i srog snying rig sngags snying pos zhus pa'o //
analyzed: dri za la sogs pa'i srog snying rig sngags snying pos zhus pa'o //
translated: The life essence of the gandharvas and so forth, requested with the essence of the knowledge mantra.

original: gsang sngags ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsang sngags ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The secret mantra is as follows:

original: dh'a ra ni la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dh'a ra ni la sogs pa'o //
translated: Dharani and so forth.

original: shar phyogs su bdag bde legs su gyur cig sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni gang dag 'di la gus pa shar phyogs su gnod pa dang / 'jigs pa mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: shar phyogs su bdag bde legs su gyur cig sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni gang dag 'di la gus pa shar phyogs su gnod pa dang / 'jigs pa mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: In the east may there be well-being for me, svāhā. This means that for those who have devotion to this [dhāraṇī], there will be no harm or fear in the east.

original: 'di yang yul 'khor srung gis gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di yang yul 'khor srung gis gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is also spoken by Dhṛtarāṣṭra.

original: tshangs pa dang brgya byin la sogs pa ni //
analyzed: tshangs pa dang brgya byin la sogs pa ni //
translated: Brahmā, Śakra, and so forth

original: gong du bshad pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: should be understood as explained above.

original: de dag gi gzi brjid dang mthu'i dbang gis /
analyzed: de dag gi gzi brjid dang mthu'i dbang gis /
translated: By the power of their splendor and might,

original: gang zag nad dang 'jigs pa las thar pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag nad dang 'jigs pa las thar pa'o //
translated: individuals are liberated from illness and fear.

original: phyag 'tshal skyes bu dpa' khyod la sogs pa ni gong du bshad pa bzhin bya'o //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal skyes bu dpa' khyod la sogs pa ni gong du bshad pa bzhin bya'o //
translated: Homage to you, O Hero, and so forth, should be done as explained above.

original: rgyal po chen po 'phags skyes po //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po 'phags skyes po //
translated: The great king Virūḍhaka,

original: thal mo sbyar te de nas langs //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar te de nas langs //
translated: having joined his palms, then arose,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten mgon gyi spyan sngar gus pas thal mo sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten mgon gyi spyan sngar gus pas thal mo sbyar ba'o //
translated: means respectfully joining palms in the presence of the Lord of the World.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad gzigs //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad gzigs //
translated: The Omniscient One, the Seer of All,

original: smra ba @48a * //
analyzed: smra ba @48a * //
translated: the Speaker,

original: thams cad rab 'joms pa //
analyzed: thams cad rab 'joms pa //
translated: the Subduer of All,

original: zhes bya ba ni rin po che rang gi lag mthil du snang ba dang 'dra ba 'jig rten gyi khams thugs rjes lta ba /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rin po che rang gi lag mthil du snang ba dang 'dra ba 'jig rten gyi khams thugs rjes lta ba /
translated: This is like a jewel appearing in the palm of one's hand, and is the compassionate vision of the world.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo bdud bzhi 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo bdud bzhi 'joms pa'o //
translated: The nature of conceptualization is the overcoming of the four demons.

original: the tshom thams cad gcod mdzad pa //
analyzed: the tshom thams cad gcod mdzad pa //
translated: You cut through all doubts,

original: 'jig rten thams cad rnam 'dren pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad rnam 'dren pa //
translated: You lead all worlds.

original: zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i ngo bo nyid nyon mongs pa rnams 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i ngo bo nyid nyon mongs pa rnams 'joms pa'o //
translated: This is the overcoming of the afflictions, which are the nature of ignorance.

original: ye shes kyi 'od zer gyis 'jig rten gyi sems can mtho ris su 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi 'od zer gyis 'jig rten gyi sems can mtho ris su 'dren pa'o //
translated: With the light rays of wisdom, you lead the sentient beings of the world to the higher realms.🔽The 6,400,000

original: grul bum yi dags srul po dag / stong phrag drug cu rtsa bzhi rnams //
analyzed: grul bum yi dags srul po dag / stong phrag drug cu rtsa bzhi rnams //
translated: Kumbhāṇḍas, pretas, and pūtanas

original: zhes bya ba ni ma rungs pa'i grul bum la sogs pa rig sngags kyi chad pas gcod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ma rungs pa'i grul bum la sogs pa rig sngags kyi chad pas gcod pa'o //
translated: This is the punishment of the wicked kumbhāṇḍas and so forth with the law of the vidyā mantra.

original: lho phyogs cha yi phyogs na gnas //

original: dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i skye dgu dang / lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni /🔽'jig rten mi la gang yang 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i skye dgu dang / lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni / 'jig rten mi la gang yang 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of Mara, for the sake of Brahma, for the sake of the ascetics and priests, for the sake of the people, for the sake of the gods, humans, and titans,

original: de'i don du sangs rgyas rnams kyis thugs rje'i spyan gyis lta ba'o ;
analyzed: de'i don du sangs rgyas rnams kyis thugs rje'i spyan gyis lta ba'o ;
translated: means that the Buddhas look with the eye of compassion for the sake of the people of the world.

original: ; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ; sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas, etc.

original: sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed tsam mo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed tsam mo //
translated: The Buddhas are as numerous as the sands of the Ganges.

original: 'jig rten du byung ste zhes pa ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten du byung ste zhes pa ni //
translated: They appear in the world, etc.

original: gcig gi don du ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig gi don du ma yin no //
translated: They do not appear for the sake of one person.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis lung bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis lung bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are predicted by the Buddhas.🔽He, etc.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The Buddha is the Blessed One.

original: dper na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For example, etc.

original: sman pa mkhas pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: sman pa mkhas pa'i dpe'o //
translated: The example is that of a skilled physician.

original: sman pa mkhas pa mchog tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sman pa mkhas pa mchog tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The skilled physician is the best, etc.

original: gcig gi don du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig gi don du ni ma yin no //
translated: He does not appear for the sake of one person.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it so? Because he acts for the sake of all beings.

original: gso ba la brtson pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gso ba la brtson pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He is intent on healing, etc.

original: yon tan dang ldan pa'o ;
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa'o ;
translated: He is endowed with good qualities.

original: ; sman pas shes bar bya ba bzhin du bslab pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ; sman pas shes bar bya ba bzhin du bslab pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He is trained in the knowledge of the physician, etc.

original: yon tan ni rig pa bslabs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan ni rig pa bslabs pa'o //
translated: His good qualities are his training in the sciences.

original: rgyal po gcig gi don du byung ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyal po gcig gi don du byung ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He does not appear for the sake of one king, etc.

original: rgyal po'i don du ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyal po'i don du ma yin no //
translated: Not for the sake of a king.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis rgyal srid byed pa'i @50a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis rgyal srid byed pa'i @50a * //
translated: Because the Lord Buddhas are kings.

original: phyir ro // yang na sems can gyi don byed do //
analyzed: phyir ro // yang na sems can gyi don byed do //
translated: Or else, they act for the sake of sentient beings.

original: yul gcig gi don du byung ba ma yin pa nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yul gcig gi don du byung ba ma yin pa nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Not for the sake of a single country, etc.

original: grod  dang grong khyer dang grod  rdal dang / ljongs rnams su rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: grod  dang grong khyer dang grod  rdal dang / ljongs rnams su rgyu ba'o //
translated: means that they move about in villages, towns, cities, and countries.

original: sems can gcig gi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems can gcig gi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Not for the sake of a single sentient being, etc.

original: grong khyer yangs pa can no //
analyzed: grong khyer yangs pa can no //
translated: means that they move about in the city of Vaiśālī.

original: rab tu byung zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab tu byung zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Not for the sake of going forth, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'o //
translated: means that they move about in the world of the Lord Śākyamuni.

original: ma yin pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽theg pa chung du ma yin pas /
analyzed: ma yin pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni / theg pa chung du ma yin pas /
translated: Not for the sake of a single vehicle, etc.

original: theg pa chen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means that they move about in the Great Vehicle, not in the Lesser Vehicle.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub kyi sems kyis 'khor ba la gnas pa'i sems can rnams 'don pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyis 'khor ba la gnas pa'i sems can rnams 'don pa'o //
translated: means that they rescue sentient beings who remain in cyclic existence through the thought of awakening.

original: phyogs gang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyogs gang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In whatever direction the Lord Buddhas are, etc.

original: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas rnams so //
translated: the Buddhas of the past.

original: bzhugs pa'i phyogs de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bzhugs pa'i phyogs de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The place is

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bzhugs pa'o //
translated: the worlds of the ten directions.

original: de dag tu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag tu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The there is

original: sems can gyi don no //
analyzed: sems can gyi don no //
translated: the benefit of sentient beings.🔽 The humans and non-humans are🔽those who do not harm.

original: mi rnams dang / mi ma yin pa dag kyang rnam par 'tshe bar mi bya bar sems kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi rnams dang / mi ma yin pa dag kyang rnam par 'tshe bar mi bya bar sems kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The thought is

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sems kyis dgongs nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sems kyis dgongs nas /
translated: the thought of the Blessed Buddhas.

original: grong khyer yangs pa can gyi don du bzhengs so //
analyzed: grong khyer yangs pa can gyi don du bzhengs so //
translated: The for the sake of the city of Vaiśālī is🔽the city of Vaiśālī.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mun nag byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mun nag byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the arising of darkness.

original: nga yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nga yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The I is

original: sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa'o //
translated: Śākyamuni Buddha.

original: yangs ba can gyi grong khyer chen po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yangs ba can gyi grong khyer chen po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The great city of Vaiśālī is

original: zheng dang chu ru dpag tshad lnga bcu'o //
analyzed: zheng dang chu ru dpag tshad lnga bcu'o //
translated: fifty yojanas wide and long.

original: rgya che ba yangs pa skye po mang po'i tshogs 'du ba /
analyzed: rgya che ba yangs pa skye po mang po'i tshogs 'du ba /
translated: It is vast, with a large gathering of people,

original: 'o bas rim pa bdun gyis bskor ba /
analyzed: 'o bas rim pa bdun gyis bskor ba /
translated: surrounded by seven ramparts.🔽

original: shing ljon pa rnams phyogs phyogs na yod pa /🔽skyed mos tshal phyogs nas brgyan pa /
analyzed: shing ljon pa rnams phyogs phyogs na yod pa / skyed mos tshal phyogs nas brgyan pa /
translated: The trees are in all directions.🔽The parks are in all directions.

original: skyed mos tshal re re yang rdzing du re re dang bcas pa /🔽rdzing bu'i nang na me tog padma dang / punda r'i ka dang / autpala dang / ku mu ta la sogs te /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal re re yang rdzing du re re dang bcas pa / rdzing bu'i nang na me tog padma dang / punda r'i ka dang / autpala dang / ku mu ta la sogs te /
translated: Each park has a pond.

original: dri zhim po'i me tog skye ba /
analyzed: dri zhim po'i me tog skye ba /
translated: In the ponds grow fragrant flowers such as lotuses, punarvasus, utpalas, kumudas, and so forth.

original: chu de yang tsandan la sogs pa'i dri zhim pa skye ba /
analyzed: chu de yang tsandan la sogs pa'i dri zhim pa skye ba /
translated: The water is fragrant with the scent of sandalwood and so forth.

original: rdzing bu de rnams kyi nang na /
analyzed: rdzing bu de rnams kyi nang na /
translated: In those ponds

original: bya'i tshogs yod pa /
analyzed: bya'i tshogs yod pa /
translated: are flocks of birds.

original: ngang ba dang / dur pa dang / khrung khrung dang / sa ra sa la sogs pa yod pa /
analyzed: ngang ba dang / dur pa dang / khrung khrung dang / sa ra sa la sogs pa yod pa /
translated: There are geese, ducks, cranes, and sarasas.🔽In those parks grow fragrant flowers such as jasmine, kumuda, champak, yellow, red, white, blue, green,

original: skyed mos tshal de rnams na thang las skyes pa'i me tog dri zhim pa dz'a ti'i me tog dang ku mu da dang / tsam pa ka dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / sngon po dang / mthing ga dang /🔽le brgan la sogs pa'i dri zhim po skye ba /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal de rnams na thang las skyes pa'i me tog dri zhim pa dz'a ti'i me tog dang ku mu da dang / tsam pa ka dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / sngon po dang / mthing ga dang /🔽le brgan la sogs pa'i dri zhim po skye ba /
translated: and magenta flowers.

original: skyed mos tshal @50b gyi 'gram nas 'bras bu can gyi shing skyes pa /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal @50b gyi 'gram nas 'bras bu can gyi shing skyes pa /
translated: Fruit trees grew in the parks.

original: aa 'bras kyi shing dang / 'jam 'bras kyi shing dang / star ga dang / au nu'i shing dang / se ba dang / rgya'i se ba dang / shug pa dang / rgya shug dang / shing bal po se'u dang / au dumw'ar dang / ner 'go'i shing la sogs pa'i shing yod do //
analyzed: aa 'bras kyi shing dang / 'jam 'bras kyi shing dang / star ga dang / au nu'i shing dang / se ba dang / rgya'i se ba dang / shug pa dang / rgya shug dang / shing bal po se'u dang / au dumw'ar dang / ner 'go'i shing la sogs pa'i shing yod do //
translated: There were mango trees, rose-apple trees, breadfruit trees, uḍumbarī trees, jujube trees, Chinese jujube trees, juniper trees, buckthorn trees, cotton trees, udumbara trees, and so on.

original: grong khyer yangs pa can gyi phyogs phyogs na mchod rten gyis bskor ba /
analyzed: grong khyer yangs pa can gyi phyogs phyogs na mchod rten gyis bskor ba /
translated: In the various directions around the city of Vaiśālī, there were stūpas.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos dar ba /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos dar ba /
translated: The teachings of the perfectly awakened buddhas were flourishing.

original: dge slong ngam dge slong ma 'am /
analyzed: dge slong ngam dge slong ma 'am /
translated: There were monks and nuns,

original: dge bsnyen nam dge bsnyen ma'am /
analyzed: dge bsnyen nam dge bsnyen ma'am /
translated: and male and female lay practitioners.

original: de dag kyang sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa de bzhin srung pa /
analyzed: de dag kyang sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa de bzhin srung pa /
translated: They all upheld the teachings of the Buddha.

original: bram ze 'am /
analyzed: bram ze 'am /
translated: There were brahmins,

original: bram ze mo'am /
analyzed: bram ze mo'am /
translated: brahmin women,

original: rgyal po 'am /
analyzed: rgyal po 'am /
translated: kings,

original: rgyal mo'am / btsun mo 'am /
analyzed: rgyal mo'am / btsun mo 'am /
translated: queens, consorts,🔽and female consorts.🔽There were also kṣatriyas,

original: btsan mo'am / rje rigs sam /
analyzed: btsan mo'am / rje rigs sam /
translated: vaiśyas,

original: dmangs rigs la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: dmangs rigs la sogs pa'am /
translated: śūdras, and so on.

original: skye bo mang po 'dus pa'am /🔽byol song ngam /
analyzed: skye bo mang po 'dus pa'am / byol song ngam /
translated: in the presence of many people,🔽or in the presence of many animals,

original: phyugs la sogs pa mang po yod pa /
analyzed: phyugs la sogs pa mang po yod pa /
translated: or in the presence of many cattle,

original: grong khyer chen po yangs pa can no //
analyzed: grong khyer chen po yangs pa can no //
translated: in the great city of Vaiśālī.

original: gal bder zhes bya ba ni grong gi nad du'o //
analyzed: gal bder zhes bya ba ni grong gi nad du'o //
translated: “There” means in the city.

original: yangs pa can gyi grong khyer chen po'i skye bo'i tshogs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yangs pa can gyi grong khyer chen po'i skye bo'i tshogs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The multitude of people in the great city of Vaiśālī”

original: li tstsha b'i la sogs pa'i bram ze'o //
analyzed: li tstsha b'i la sogs pa'i bram ze'o //
translated: refers to the brahmins such as the Licchavis.

original: phal po che'i don yang byas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phal po che'i don yang byas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “They will have accomplished the purpose of the Flower Ornament Sutra”

original: grags pa chen po byung ba'o //
analyzed: grags pa chen po byung ba'o //
translated: means they will have attained great fame.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mun nag chen po byung ba dang / mu ge byung ba dang / nad sna tshogs byung ba'o //
analyzed: mun nag chen po byung ba dang / mu ge byung ba dang / nad sna tshogs byung ba'o //
translated: Because a great darkness has arisen, a famine has arisen, and various diseases have arisen.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa yang byas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa yang byas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “They will have accomplished the deeds of a buddha”

original: sangs rgyas kyi don yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi don yin no //
translated: means they will have attained the purpose of a buddha.

original: mnyam du dgongs te zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: mnyam du dgongs te zhes bya ba ni //
translated: “They will have had the same intention”

original: sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid du bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid du bsgom pa'o //
translated: means they will have cultivated the sameness of all sentient beings.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid du bsgoms pa'i rting la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid du bsgoms pa'i rting la'o //
translated: Then means after meditating on sameness.

original: bcom ldan 'das snga dro'i dus kyi tshe zhes bya ba ni nyi ma shar ba'i dus so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das snga dro'i dus kyi tshe zhes bya ba ni nyi ma shar ba'i dus so //
translated: In the morning means at sunrise.

original: chos gos dang / sham thabs dang / lhung bzed bsnams te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos gos dang / sham thabs dang / lhung bzed bsnams te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Holding his Dharma robes, bowl, and lower robe means

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das stan las langs te gsil byed dang lhung bzed thogs nas bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri las babs nas grong khyer yangs pa can la kha bltas pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das stan las langs te gsil byed dang lhung bzed thogs nas bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri las babs nas grong khyer yangs pa can la kha bltas pa'o //
translated: that the Buddha Bhagavān rose from his seat, took his staff and bowl, descended from Vulture Peak, and looked toward the city of Vaiśālī.

original: dge slong nyis brgya lnga bcu dang thabs cig tu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong nyis brgya lnga bcu dang thabs cig tu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Together with two hundred and fifty monks means

original: bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
translated: that the Bhagavān was accompanied by an assembly.

original: bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri las shod du gshegs pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri las shod du gshegs pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Descending from Vulture Peak means

original: lha dang lha ma yin la sogs pas mchod pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang lha ma yin la sogs pas mchod pa byed pa'o //
translated: that he was worshipped by gods, asuras, and so forth.

original: mi mjed kyi bdag @51a * //
analyzed: mi mjed kyi bdag @51a * //
translated: The Lord of the Sahā world

original: po tshangs pas lha'i gdugs lnga brgya tsam blangs te zhes bya ba ni lha'i rdzas dang / me tog dang mchod pa la sogs pa 'bul te lha'i bu tshangs pa dang tshangs chen dang / dga' ldan gyi lha'i bu la sogs pas mchod pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: po tshangs pas lha'i gdugs lnga brgya tsam blangs te zhes bya ba ni lha'i rdzas dang / me tog dang mchod pa la sogs pa 'bul te lha'i bu tshangs pa dang tshangs chen dang / dga' ldan gyi lha'i bu la sogs pas mchod pa byed pa'o //
translated: Brahma held about five hundred divine parasols means that he offered divine substances, flowers, worship, and so forth, and the divine sons Brahma, Mahabrahma, and the sons of the Tushita gods and so forth made offerings.

original: bcom ldan 'das la g-yas rol nas phul lo zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi la sogs pa gus pa byas nas 'bul ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la g-yas rol nas phul lo zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi la sogs pa gus pa byas nas 'bul ba'o //
translated: They offered to the right of the Bhagavan means that after respectfully making offerings, they offered.

original: yad na ni bcom ldan 'das gar gshegs pa'i sar /
analyzed: yad na ni bcom ldan 'das gar gshegs pa'i sar /
translated: Then, wherever the Bhagavan went,

original: lha'i za 'og dang / dar dang / sa gzhi la bting nas gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i za 'og dang / dar dang / sa gzhi la bting nas gshegs pa'o //
translated: the gods spread divine silk and brocade on the ground and he went there.

original: phul nas bcom ldan 'das la rdul yab kyis g-yob cing 'dug par gyur to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phul nas bcom ldan 'das la rdul yab kyis g-yob cing 'dug par gyur to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: After offering, they stood there fanning the Bhagavan with yak-tail whisks.

original: dga' ldan gyi lha'i bu dang / tshangs pa dang tshangs chen la sogs pas /
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi lha'i bu dang / tshangs pa dang tshangs chen la sogs pas /
translated: The sons of the Tushita gods, Brahma, Mahabrahma, and so forth

original: lha rdzas kyi me tog dang dri la sogs pa'i char 'bebs pa'o //
analyzed: lha rdzas kyi me tog dang dri la sogs pa'i char 'bebs pa'o //
translated: caused a rain of divine flowers, fragrances, and so forth to fall.

original: lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis kyang gdugs lnga brgya tsam blangs te zhes bya ba ni /🔽lha'i dbang po brgya byin nam /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis kyang gdugs lnga brgya tsam blangs te zhes bya ba ni / lha'i dbang po brgya byin nam /
translated: This means that Sakra, Lord of the Gods,

original: lha'i bu dbang phyug chen po'am /
analyzed: lha'i bu dbang phyug chen po'am /
translated: or the son of the gods Mahesvara,

original: khyab 'jug gam 'khor dang bcas pas bcom ldan 'das la phul ba'o //
analyzed: khyab 'jug gam 'khor dang bcas pas bcom ldan 'das la phul ba'o //
translated: or Vishnu, together with his retinue, offered them to the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das la g-yon rol nas phul lo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la g-yon rol nas phul lo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They offered them to the Blessed One from the left.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum lha'i bu dang / bu mo rnams kyis kyang phul lo //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum lha'i bu dang / bu mo rnams kyis kyang phul lo //
translated: This means that the sons and daughters of the gods of the Thirty-Three also offered them.

original: phul nas bcom ldan 'das la rdul yab kyis g-yob cing 'dug par gyur to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phul nas bcom ldan 'das la rdul yab kyis g-yob cing 'dug par gyur to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having offered them, they stood there fanning the Blessed One with yak-tail whisks.

original: lha'i za 'og dang dar la sogs pa dogs la bting ba'o //
analyzed: lha'i za 'og dang dar la sogs pa dogs la bting ba'o //
translated: This means that they spread divine silks and cottons and so on on the ground.

original: rgyal po chen po bzhis kyang re re zhing lha'i gdugs lnga brgya tsam blangs te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhis kyang re re zhing lha'i gdugs lnga brgya tsam blangs te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Four Great Kings also took five hundred parasols each.

original: rgyal chen gyi lha rnams dang lha'i bu mo re re blangs nas phul ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal chen gyi lha rnams dang lha'i bu mo re re blangs nas phul ba'o //
translated: This means that each of the gods of the Great Kings and each of the daughters of the gods took them and offered them.

original: bcom ldan 'das la snam logs nas phul zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la snam logs nas phul zhes bya ba ni //
translated: The phrase from behind the Blessed One means from the rear.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi mdun du yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi mdun du yin te /
translated: Behind the Lord means in front of the Lord.

original: me tog gi char phab pa'o //
analyzed: me tog gi char phab pa'o //
translated: It is a rain of flowers.

original: bcom ldan 'das la rdul yab kyis g-yob cing 'khod par gyur to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la rdul yab kyis g-yob cing 'khod par gyur to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They stood there, fanning the Lord with a chowrie.

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha'i bu dang bu mos lha'i za 'og dang / dar la sogs pa dog sa la bting ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha'i bu dang bu mos lha'i za 'og dang / dar la sogs pa dog sa la bting ba'o //
translated: The sons and daughters of the gods of the Four Great Kings spread out divine silk and cotton cloths on the ground.

original: lha'i bu dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa so so nas lha'i gdugs dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lha'i bu dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa so so nas lha'i gdugs dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The sons of the gods, Maheśvara and so on, each held up a divine parasol.

original: lha dang lha mo dang gnod sbyin dang gnod sbyin mo la sogs pas so so'i lag nas phul ba'o //
analyzed: lha dang lha mo dang gnod sbyin dang gnod sbyin mo la sogs pas so so'i lag nas phul ba'o //
translated: The gods, goddesses, yakṣas, yakṣiṇīs and so on offered them with their own hands.

original: nyan thos rnams la phul nas zhes bya ba ni sngon du bcom ldan 'das la phul nas /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la phul nas zhes bya ba ni sngon du bcom ldan 'das la phul nas /
translated: Having offered them to the śrāvakas,  means having first offered them to the Lord.

original: nyan thos rnams la yang bkur sti byas pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la yang bkur sti byas pa'o //
translated: They also honored the śrāvakas.

original: de @51b lta bu'i grags pa dang bkur sti dang brnyes par bya ba brnyes nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de @51b lta bu'i grags pa dang bkur sti dang brnyes par bya ba brnyes nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having attained such fame and honor,  means having attained such fame and honor.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa rnams la'o //
translated: to the Blessed One and his retinue.

original: bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang thabs cig tu bya rgod phung po'i ri las shod du babs te zhes bya ba ni grong khyer yangs pa can gyi sems can gyi don du'o//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun dang thabs cig tu bya rgod phung po'i ri las shod du babs te zhes bya ba ni grong khyer yangs pa can gyi sems can gyi don du'o//
translated: The Blessed One, together with the saṅgha of monks, descended from Vulture Peak to the plain, for the sake of the beings in the city of Vaiśālī.

original: yangs pa can gyi grong khyer chen po ga la ba der gshegs pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yangs pa can gyi grong khyer chen po ga la ba der gshegs pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He went to the great city of Vaiśālī,

original: yangs pa can gyi mi rnams kyis mthong nas /🔽gdugs dang rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang rol mo'i tshogs kyis /
analyzed: yangs pa can gyi mi rnams kyis mthong nas / gdugs dang rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang rol mo'i tshogs kyis /
translated: and when the people of Vaiśālī saw him,

original: bcom ldan 'das rnams la sdun du zhu'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnams la sdun du zhu'o //
translated: they welcomed the Blessed One with parasols, banners, flags, and musical instruments.🔽They went to the great city of Vaiśālī,🔽to the villages, towns, and outskirts of the city,

original: grong khyer yangs ba can gyi grong dang / grong bar dang / grong gi phyi rol dang / ba dan dang / rgyal mtshan dang / gdugs dang / me tog gi phreng ba dang / mu tig dang / mu tig gi phreng ba dang / dra ba dang /
analyzed: grong khyer yangs ba can gyi grong dang / grong bar dang / grong gi phyi rol dang / ba dan dang / rgyal mtshan dang / gdugs dang / me tog gi phreng ba dang / mu tig dang / mu tig gi phreng ba dang / dra ba dang /
translated: with parasols, banners, flags, flower garlands, pearls, pearl necklaces, and nets,

original: dra ba phyed ba dang // bsil yab dang / rnga ma dang / rnga ma dkar po dang / dar dpyangs dang / bla re dang / dog sa la za 'og dang / dar bting ba dang / grong bar du zur zur bkra shis bum pa gang ba yang dag par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: dra ba phyed ba dang // bsil yab dang / rnga ma dang / rnga ma dkar po dang / dar dpyangs dang / bla re dang / dog sa la za 'og dang / dar bting ba dang / grong bar du zur zur bkra shis bum pa gang ba yang dag par gzhag pa'o //
translated: fans, tails, white tails, silk tassels, canopies, and on the ground, silk and brocade were spread, and in the villages, auspicious vases were filled and properly placed.

original: yangs pa can gyi litstsha b'i rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni /🔽bcom ldan 'das shin tu byon pa dga' nas litstsha 'am litstsha'i chung ma'am li tstsha'i bu'am bu mo 'am /🔽litstsha'i 'khor pho'am /
analyzed: yangs pa can gyi litstsha b'i rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni / bcom ldan 'das shin tu byon pa dga' nas litstsha 'am litstsha'i chung ma'am li tstsha'i bu'am bu mo 'am / litstsha'i 'khor pho'am /
translated: The Licchavis of Vaishali, it is said,🔽 when the Blessed One arrived, were delighted, and with minds full of joy, they said to the Licchavis, the Licchavi wives, the Licchavi sons and daughters,

original: 'khor mo'am / nye ba rnams la dga' ba'i sems dang ldan no //
analyzed: 'khor mo'am / nye ba rnams la dga' ba'i sems dang ldan no //
translated: the Licchavi retinue, male and female, and to their neighbors, The Blessed One has arrived.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad dang bral ba ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad dang bral ba ni /
translated: We are free from all suffering.

original: dper na mi cig btson du bzung ba dang brtson thon nas sdug bsngal dang bral ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mi cig btson du bzung ba dang brtson thon nas sdug bsngal dang bral ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like when a person is imprisoned and, after being released from prison, is free from suffering.

original: bcom ldan 'das shin tu mdzes pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shin tu mdzes pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Blessed One is very handsome, it is said,🔽 and the Blessed One is very beautiful.

original: dper na bu mo gzhon nu ma bag mar 'gro ba bcas pa lta bu ste yang na dbyar ka'i nam mkha' la nyi zla shar ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bu mo gzhon nu ma bag mar 'gro ba bcas pa lta bu ste yang na dbyar ka'i nam mkha' la nyi zla shar ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like a young girl who is about to be married, or like the sun and moon shining in the sky in summer.

original: skar ma rnams ni nyan thos la sogs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: skar ma rnams ni nyan thos la sogs pa lta bu ste /
translated: The stars are like the Sravakas, etc.

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das la mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das la mdzes pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the Blessed One is beautiful.

original: dad par 'os pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dad par 'os pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Worthy of offerings means

original: dper na bu gces ba tshong la song nas /
analyzed: dper na bu gces ba tshong la song nas /
translated: for example, like a beloved son who has gone on a business trip,

original: yun ring por lon nas ma dang phrad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yun ring por lon nas ma dang phrad pa lta bu'o //
translated: and after a long time, meets his mother and father.

original: dbang po zhi ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbang po zhi ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Tranquil faculties means

original: mu stegs shin tu nga rgyal che ba bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal mthong nas dad pa skyes pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: mu stegs shin tu nga rgyal che ba bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal mthong nas dad pa skyes pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: for example, like the tirthikas who, having seen the face of the Blessed One, gave rise to faith.

original: yang na ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: yang na ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang bral ba'o //
translated: Or, it is free from the five sense objects.🔽Tranquil mind means

original: thugs zhi ba zhes bya ba ni sems mi 'phro ba lta bu'o //
