original: 'on kyang rgyal po'i khab na rgyal po sbyin pa sar ri rgyal khrims yin pa dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa de'i dus na beed'urya shel zhes bya ba'i lha khang na bzhugs te dus @58a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyal po'i khab na rgyal po sbyin pa sar ri rgyal khrims yin pa dang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa de'i dus na beed'urya shel zhes bya ba'i lha khang na bzhugs te dus @58a * //
translated: However, in Rājagṛha, King Dānaśūra was the king. At that time, the perfect, complete Buddha Śākyamuni was dwelling in the Vairocana Crystal Temple.

original: gcig na bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi don byed la dgongs nas bsod snyoms mdzad de tshong dpon chen po bkra shis dpal dang / yum dpal ldan grags ma zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gcig na bcom ldan 'das sems can gyi don byed la dgongs nas bsod snyoms mdzad de tshong dpon chen po bkra shis dpal dang / yum dpal ldan grags ma zhes bya ba ste /
translated: One day, the Blessed One, intending to benefit sentient beings, took his alms round. The great merchant was called Maṅgalakīrti, and his mother was called Śrīmati.

original: yo byad phun sum tshogs pa me tog gi ra ba dang skyed mos tshal la sogs pa kho'i gnas ni shin tu yid du 'od pa dang / sems dga' ba dang / tshong dpon de'i slob dpon mu stegs gcer bu yin te /
analyzed: yo byad phun sum tshogs pa me tog gi ra ba dang skyed mos tshal la sogs pa kho'i gnas ni shin tu yid du 'od pa dang / sems dga' ba dang / tshong dpon de'i slob dpon mu stegs gcer bu yin te /
translated: The teacher of that merchant was a naked tīrthika.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pas de'i khyim du bsod snyoms la gshegs te /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pas de'i khyim du bsod snyoms la gshegs te /
translated: The perfect, complete Buddha Śākyamuni went to his house to receive alms.

original: de nas tshong dpon yab yum dad pa skyes nas /
analyzed: de nas tshong dpon yab yum dad pa skyes nas /
translated: Then the merchant and his wife gave rise to faith.

original: yang dag par rdzogs ba'i sangs rgyas ma byon pa di ring 'dir byon pa shin tu legs so //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs ba'i sangs rgyas ma byon pa di ring 'dir byon pa shin tu legs so //
translated: They said, It is very good that the perfect, complete Buddha, who has not come here before, has come today.

original: chos ston drangs /
analyzed: chos ston drangs /
translated: Please teach the Dharma.

original: bkur sti byas /
analyzed: bkur sti byas /
translated: They made offerings,

original: yo byad la sogs pa phul nas /
analyzed: yo byad la sogs pa phul nas /
translated: and offered him their possessions and so forth.

original: de nas tshong dpon gyi chung ma nad pa de bcom ldan 'das la gzigs su phul lo //
analyzed: de nas tshong dpon gyi chung ma nad pa de bcom ldan 'das la gzigs su phul lo //
translated: Then the merchant's wife, who was sick, was brought to see the Bhagavān.

original: tshong dpon gyis de skad smras so //
analyzed: tshong dpon gyis de skad smras so //
translated: The merchant said this.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni mngon par shes pa mdzad de 'di'i lus la ci skye zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni mngon par shes pa mdzad de 'di'i lus la ci skye zhe na /
translated: The Bhagavān manifested his supernormal knowledge and thought, What is growing in her body?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said,

original: tshong dpon 'di'i lus la skyes bu dam pa skye'o //
analyzed: tshong dpon 'di'i lus la skyes bu dam pa skye'o //
translated: In the body of this merchant, a holy being will be born.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa bsrung ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa bsrung ba /
translated: He will protect the teachings of the Buddha,

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa /
translated: attain the fruit of arhatship,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang ldan pa myur du thob ba skye'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang ldan pa myur du thob ba skye'o //
translated: and quickly attain the bases of miraculous powers.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs pa dang tshong dpon dga' ba'i sems dang ldan no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs pa dang tshong dpon dga' ba'i sems dang ldan no //
translated: When the Blessed One said this, the merchant was filled with joy.

original: bcom ldan 'das la phyag lan gsum btsal nas yang bkur sti la sogs pa byas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la phyag lan gsum btsal nas yang bkur sti la sogs pa byas so //
translated: He prostrated to the Blessed One three times and again showed respect and so forth.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das gshegs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das gshegs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One departed.

original: gshegs pa'i dus su mu stegs gcer bu dang 'phrad do //
analyzed: gshegs pa'i dus su mu stegs gcer bu dang 'phrad do //
translated: As he was leaving, he encountered the naked tīrthikas.

original: gcer bu'i sems la da'i yon bdag goo thams phrogs so snyam nas /
analyzed: gcer bu'i sems la da'i yon bdag goo thams phrogs so snyam nas /
translated: The tīrthikas thought, The patron of this merchant has been stolen away.

original: nang du phyin nas tshong dpon la smras so //
analyzed: nang du phyin nas tshong dpon la smras so //
translated: They went inside and said to the merchant,

original: kye tshong dpon goo ta ma ci la byon smras pas /
analyzed: kye tshong dpon goo ta ma ci la byon smras pas /
translated: Hey merchant, why did Gautama come?

original: tshod dpon gyi zhal nas /
analyzed: tshod dpon gyi zhal nas /
translated: The merchant said,

original: bcom ldan 'das bsod snyoms la byon pa lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bsod snyoms la byon pa lags /
translated: The Blessed One came for alms.

original: dad pa skyes nas bkur sti byas pa yin da'i 'di'i nad pa gzigs su phul ba lags /
analyzed: dad pa skyes nas bkur sti byas pa yin da'i 'di'i nad pa gzigs su phul ba lags /
translated: With faith, I have honored him. I have offered this patient to him.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal nas 'di'i lus la skyes bu dam pa dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal nas 'di'i lus la skyes bu dam pa dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said, In his body, a holy being will attain the fruit of an arhat.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa bsrung ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa bsrung ba /
translated: He will protect the teachings of the Buddha.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa myur du 'thob pa skye'o gsungs so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa myur du 'thob pa skye'o gsungs so //
translated: He will quickly attain the bases of miraculous powers.

original: gcer @58b bu'i mtshan nyid ni mngon par shes pa gcer bu ra'i 'phongs la thal lcag brgyab pas gcer bu ra dang 'dra ba bzhi lnga lnga 'thon pa de bzhin du mtshan nyid dang 'dra ba'i gcer bus brdzun po smras so //
analyzed: gcer @58b bu'i mtshan nyid ni mngon par shes pa gcer bu ra'i 'phongs la thal lcag brgyab pas gcer bu ra dang 'dra ba bzhi lnga lnga 'thon pa de bzhin du mtshan nyid dang 'dra ba'i gcer bus brdzun po smras so //
translated: The naked one's characteristics are that he is naked, and four or five naked ones like the naked one will emerge from his buttocks when struck with the palm of the hand. In the same way, the naked one who is similar to the characteristics spoke a lie.

original: kye tshong dpon goo ta ma'i 'dod pa yin /
analyzed: kye tshong dpon goo ta ma'i 'dod pa yin /
translated: Oh, it is the desire of the merchant Gautama.

original: kye bu dang skye ste skyes ma thag nas ma gsod pa de'i rting la khyod kyi yo byad phun sum tshogs pa thams cad zad par byed pa de'i rting la pha bsad nas kho rang rab tu byung ba yin /
analyzed: kye bu dang skye ste skyes ma thag nas ma gsod pa de'i rting la khyod kyi yo byad phun sum tshogs pa thams cad zad par byed pa de'i rting la pha bsad nas kho rang rab tu byung ba yin /
translated: Oh, a son was born, and as soon as he was born, he killed his mother. After that, he exhausted all of your abundant wealth. After that, he killed his father and went forth himself.

original: de lta bu skye ba yin /
analyzed: de lta bu skye ba yin /
translated: This is how it happens.

original: khyed kyis myur du ma bsad na /
analyzed: khyed kyis myur du ma bsad na /
translated: If you do not quickly kill me,

original: de bzhin du khyod la de dag myur du 'ong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyod la de dag myur du 'ong ngo //
translated: this will happen to you very soon.”

original: de nas tshong dpon gyis nub mo'i dus su chung ma'i gsus pa phyag gnyis kyis mnyes so //
analyzed: de nas tshong dpon gyis nub mo'i dus su chung ma'i gsus pa phyag gnyis kyis mnyes so //
translated: Then the merchant, in the evening, with both hands kneaded his wife’s belly.

original: mnyes pas mo ma bzod nas skad ngan chen po byung ngo //
analyzed: mnyes pas mo ma bzod nas skad ngan chen po byung ngo //
translated: As he kneaded it, she could not stand the pain and let out a loud cry.

original: de nas khyim mtshes dang nye ba la sogs pas thos nas /
analyzed: de nas khyim mtshes dang nye ba la sogs pas thos nas /
translated: Then the neighbors and relatives heard it and came to her aid.

original: ra mda' byas pas de'i nub mo dbugs dang ma bral lo //
analyzed: ra mda' byas pas de'i nub mo dbugs dang ma bral lo //
translated: That night she did not die.

original: yang phyi de nub mo'i dus su me tog gi rab yod pa'i skyed mos tshal gyi dbus su khang pa cig gi nang du yang khrid nas chung ma'i gsus pa mnyes so //
analyzed: yang phyi de nub mo'i dus su me tog gi rab yod pa'i skyed mos tshal gyi dbus su khang pa cig gi nang du yang khrid nas chung ma'i gsus pa mnyes so //
translated: Again, in the evening of the next day, he took her to the middle of a flower garden with a house and kneaded his wife’s belly.

original: mnyes pa dang bud med de na tsha chen po byung bas dbugs chad do //
analyzed: mnyes pa dang bud med de na tsha chen po byung bas dbugs chad do //
translated: As he kneaded it, the woman had a great pain and died.

original: de nas tshong dpon gyis kha skad bsgyur nas smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshong dpon gyis kha skad bsgyur nas smras so //
translated: Then the merchant, through an interpreter, said,

original: nga'i chung ma de yang byis ba ma thon par gum mo zhes smras so //
analyzed: nga'i chung ma de yang byis ba ma thon par gum mo zhes smras so //
translated: “My wife died without giving birth.”

original: mya ngan gyi tshul yang byas de nas mu stegs gcer bu'i tshogs rnams kyang rgyal po'i pho brang ngam /🔽srang ga'am srang ga chen po'am /
analyzed: mya ngan gyi tshul yang byas de nas mu stegs gcer bu'i tshogs rnams kyang rgyal po'i pho brang ngam / srang ga'am srang ga chen po'am /
translated: Then the assembly of naked tīrthikas went to the king’s palace,🔽to the streets, the main streets,

original: grong ngam grong khyer chen po'am /
analyzed: grong ngam grong khyer chen po'am /
translated: the towns, the big cities,

original: grong rdal la sogs pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: grong rdal la sogs pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: and the villages, and so forth, and said,

original: kye rgyal po skyes bu rnams goo ta ma'i brdzun po la tshong dpon de'i bud med la bu khye'u re mo yang shi /
analyzed: kye rgyal po skyes bu rnams goo ta ma'i brdzun po la tshong dpon de'i bud med la bu khye'u re mo yang shi /
translated: “O King! The man of Gautama’s lies has died, and so has the son of the merchant’s wife.🔽The man of Gautama’s lies has caused all sentient beings to develop faith.”

original: goo ta ma'i brdzun po la sems can thams cad dad pa skyed de skad bzhin du gcer bu'i tshogs rnams yang nas yang du smra zhing dril bu dkrol zhing ba dan phyar zhing yar 'gro mar 'gro byas so //
analyzed: goo ta ma'i brdzun po la sems can thams cad dad pa skyed de skad bzhin du gcer bu'i tshogs rnams yang nas yang du smra zhing dril bu dkrol zhing ba dan phyar zhing yar 'gro mar 'gro byas so //
translated: The assembly of naked ones said this again and again, rang bells, raised banners, and went up and down.

original: gcer bu'i tshogs rnams kyang rang dong skyes so //
analyzed: gcer bu'i tshogs rnams kyang rang dong skyes so //
translated: The assembly of naked ones also went to their own homes.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis bee d'u rya'i ri shel gyi gtsug lag khang gi nang du seng ge'i gdan la rdo rje skyil krung du bzhugs te /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis bee d'u rya'i ri shel gyi gtsug lag khang gi nang du seng ge'i gdan la rdo rje skyil krung du bzhugs te /
translated: Then, the Blessed One, in the crystal temple of Vaidūrya, seated on a lion throne in vajra posture,

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang dgra bcom pa'i nyan thos dang dge slong ngam dge slong ma'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang dgra bcom pa'i nyan thos dang dge slong ngam dge slong ma'am /
translated: with the bodhisattvas, the arhat śrāvakas, the bhikṣus and bhikṣuṇīs,

original: dge bsnyen nam dge bsnyen ma'am /
analyzed: dge bsnyen nam dge bsnyen ma'am /
translated: the upāsakas and upāsikās,

original: 'khor gyi dbus su ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //🔽yang dag par @59a * //
analyzed: 'khor gyi dbus su ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so // yang dag par @59a * //
translated: in the midst of the assembly, entered into samādhi.

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mdzod spu nas 'od zer gyi dra ba nyi ma'i 'od dang ldan pa stong gsum gyi stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams chen po khyab bo //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mdzod spu nas 'od zer gyi dra ba nyi ma'i 'od dang ldan pa stong gsum gyi stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams chen po khyab bo //
translated: From the ūrṇā hair of the Perfectly Awakened One, a web of light rays, endowed with the light of the sun, pervaded the great trichiliocosm.

original: kun du khyab bo //
analyzed: kun du khyab bo //
translated: It pervaded everywhere.

original: yang 'od zer gyi dra ba de ba spu re re la 'du'o //
analyzed: yang 'od zer gyi dra ba de ba spu re re la 'du'o //
translated: Moreover, that web of light rays gathered into each pore.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi ba spu re re'am mdzod spu nas 'od zer gyi dra ba nyi ma bdun shar ba dang 'dra ba nam mkha' la 'phro'o //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi ba spu re re'am mdzod spu nas 'od zer gyi dra ba nyi ma bdun shar ba dang 'dra ba nam mkha' la 'phro'o //
translated: Then, from each pore or ūrṇā hair of the Blessed One, a web of light rays, like seven suns rising, radiated into space.

original: de nas 'od zer de yang mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa la sogs pa dga' ldan nam sum cu rtsa gsum mam rgyal chen gyi lha'am /
analyzed: de nas 'od zer de yang mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa la sogs pa dga' ldan nam sum cu rtsa gsum mam rgyal chen gyi lha'am /
translated: Then the light rays pervade the Brahma world and the worlds of Yāma, Tuṣita, Nirmāṇarati, and Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin, and the worlds of the four great kings, the thirty-three gods, and the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: 'od zer gyi dra bas kun du khyab po //
analyzed: 'od zer gyi dra bas kun du khyab po //
translated: The light rays pervade everywhere.

original: 'od zer gyi dra ba de yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mdzod spu la 'du'o //
analyzed: 'od zer gyi dra ba de yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mdzod spu la 'du'o //
translated: The light rays gather into the ūrṇā hair between the eyebrows of the perfect, complete Buddha.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs te bcom ldan 'das la bskor ba lan gsum byas la /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs te bcom ldan 'das la bskor ba lan gsum byas la /
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda rose from his seat, circumambulated the Bhagavān three times,

original: mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: bowed his head,

original: pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas thal mo sbyar nas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa'o //
analyzed: pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs nas thal mo sbyar nas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa'o //
translated: and, kneeling on his right knee with palms joined, asked the Bhagavān:

original: bcom ldan 'das kye lags ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kye lags ;
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: gang gi sems can gyi don lags /
analyzed: gang gi sems can gyi don lags /
translated: for the sake of what sentient beings?

original: mtshan nyid gang lags /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang lags /
translated: What are their characteristics?

original: rgyu gang lags /
analyzed: rgyu gang lags /
translated: What is their cause?

original: rkyen gang lags /
analyzed: rkyen gang lags /
translated: What are their conditions?

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes smras so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes smras so //
translated: Bhagavān, what is it?”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ting nge 'dzin de las langs te tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis ting nge 'dzin de las langs te tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One arose from that samādhi and addressed the venerable Ānanda:

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo byang chub sems dpa' dgra bcom pa nyan thos dang / dge slong ngam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo byang chub sems dpa' dgra bcom pa nyan thos dang / dge slong ngam /
translated: Venerable Ānanda, why are the assembly of bodhisattvas, arhats, śrāvakas,

original: dge slong ma 'am /
analyzed: dge slong ma 'am /
translated: bhikṣus,🔽bhikṣuṇīs,

original: dge bsnyen nam dge bsnyen ma'i 'khor rnams dur khrod bsil ba'i tshal du 'gro ba lags /
analyzed: dge bsnyen nam dge bsnyen ma'i 'khor rnams dur khrod bsil ba'i tshal du 'gro ba lags /
translated: upāsakas, and upāsikās going to the Śītavana charnel ground?

original: gzhon nu 'od zer skyes dgra bcom pa yang dag par byung bas gshegs par bgyi'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu 'od zer skyes dgra bcom pa yang dag par byung bas gshegs par bgyi'o //
translated: Young man, it is because the arhat Kāśyapa has passed away.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das seng ge'i stan las langs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das seng ge'i stan las langs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One rose from his lion throne

original: gtsug lag khang nas phyir gshegs so //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang nas phyir gshegs so //
translated: and departed from the monastery.

original: de bzhin du dgra bcom pa rnams kyang gshegs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dgra bcom pa rnams kyang gshegs so //
translated: In the same way, the arhats also departed.

original: de nas mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pas dang / tshangs chen gyi lha dang lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / rgyal chen gyi lha rnams dang / lha ma yin dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang /
analyzed: de nas mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pas dang / tshangs chen gyi lha dang lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / rgyal chen gyi lha rnams dang / lha ma yin dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang /
translated: Then Brahma, lord of the Sahā world, the gods of the Brahma Heaven, Śakra, lord of the gods, the four great kings, the gods of the realm of the Four Great Kings, the asuras, parasols, victory banners,🔽

original: ba dan dang lha'i rol mos bcom ldan 'das la sdun  du bsu ste /
analyzed: ba dan dang lha'i rol mos bcom ldan 'das la sdun  du bsu ste /
translated: Then Brahma, lord of the Sahā world, the gods of the Brahma Heaven, Śakra, lord of the gods, the Four Great Kings, the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings, the asuras, and the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, with parasols, victory banners, flags, and divine music, welcomed the Blessed One.

original: lha rdzas kyi dri bzang po dang / me tog gi char phab bo //
analyzed: lha rdzas kyi dri bzang po dang / me tog gi char phab bo //
translated: They caused a rain of divine fragrances and flowers to fall.

original: de nas rgyal po chen po gzugs can snyid pos thos @59b nas rgyal po dang rgyal po chen po 'khor dang bcas pa yang gshegs so //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po chen po gzugs can snyid pos thos @59b nas rgyal po dang rgyal po chen po 'khor dang bcas pa yang gshegs so //
translated: Then King Bimbisāra, having heard this, also came with his retinue of kings and great kings.

original: de'i rting la gcer bu'i mtshan ma'am tshod dpon gyi 'khor ram /
analyzed: de'i rting la gcer bu'i mtshan ma'am tshod dpon gyi 'khor ram /
translated: After that, the followers of the naked ascetics, the Jainas,

original: ro de gla la gshegs so //
analyzed: ro de gla la gshegs so //
translated: and the corpse-burners came.

original: de bzhin du rgyal po'i khab kyi skye dgu 'am skye dgu'i bdag po la sogs pa dur khrod bsil ba'i tshal du gshegs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyal po'i khab kyi skye dgu 'am skye dgu'i bdag po la sogs pa dur khrod bsil ba'i tshal du gshegs so //
translated: In the same way, the people of Rājagṛha, the lord of the people, and so forth, went to the Śītavana charnel ground.

original: bsil ba'i tshal du slebs nas /
analyzed: bsil ba'i tshal du slebs nas /
translated: Having arrived at Śītavana,

original: phyogs gcig tu bcom ldan 'das dang nyan thos la sogs pa bzhugs so //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu bcom ldan 'das dang nyan thos la sogs pa bzhugs so //
translated: In one place the Buddha and the śrāvakas were seated.

original: phyogs gcig tu gcer bu dang mu stegs pa bsdad do //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu gcer bu dang mu stegs pa bsdad do //
translated: In another place the naked ascetics and tīrthikas were seated.

original: de nas ro bsregs pa'i sa nas skad byung ngo //
analyzed: de nas ro bsregs pa'i sa nas skad byung ngo //
translated: Then a voice came from the cremation ground.

original: skad byung ba dang padma skyes so //
analyzed: skad byung ba dang padma skyes so //
translated: When the voice came, a lotus appeared.

original: padma'i steng na gzhon nu 'od zer skyes zhes bya ba skyes so //
analyzed: padma'i steng na gzhon nu 'od zer skyes zhes bya ba skyes so //
translated: On top of the lotus, a youth named Jālinīprabha was born.

original: shin tu skye legs pa dgra bcom pa'i cha byang dang ldan pa de me'i nang bu de lta bu skyes so //
analyzed: shin tu skye legs pa dgra bcom pa'i cha byang dang ldan pa de me'i nang bu de lta bu skyes so //
translated: He was well-formed, with the marks of an arhat. Such a child was born in the fire.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshong dpon la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshong dpon la smras pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the merchant,

original: kye tshong dpon khyod kyi bu 'di lags so zhes smras so //
analyzed: kye tshong dpon khyod kyi bu 'di lags so zhes smras so //
translated: Oh merchant, this is your son.

original: tshong dpon gyis gcer bu la kha bltas nas langs dogs byed do //
analyzed: tshong dpon gyis gcer bu la kha bltas nas langs dogs byed do //
translated: The merchant looked at the naked ascetics and stood up, fearing they would rise up against him.

original: de nas gcer bus tshong dpon la smras so //
analyzed: de nas gcer bus tshong dpon la smras so //
translated: Then the naked ascetics said to the merchant,

original: kye tshong dpon me'i nang du gang yang /
analyzed: kye tshong dpon me'i nang du gang yang /
translated: Oh merchant, in the fire

original: shi nas me la bsregs pa la /
analyzed: shi nas me la bsregs pa la /
translated: one who died and was cremated

original: khyod kyi bu ni gang las skyes //
analyzed: khyod kyi bu ni gang las skyes //
translated: from where did your son arise?

original: me yi nang du 'gro na ni //
analyzed: me yi nang du 'gro na ni //
translated: If you enter the fire,

original: khyod ni nges par tshig par 'gyur //
analyzed: khyod ni nges par tshig par 'gyur //
translated: you will certainly be burned.

original: zhes brjod pas 'gro ma nus so //
analyzed: zhes brjod pas 'gro ma nus so //
translated: Thus he spoke, and they were unable to go.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po gzugs can snying po la bka' stsal to //🔽kye rgyal po chen po gzhon nu long la spyon cig ces brjod pa dang / rgyal po chen pos blangs nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal po gzugs can snying po la bka' stsal to // kye rgyal po chen po gzhon nu long la spyon cig ces brjod pa dang / rgyal po chen pos blangs nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to King Bimbisāra,🔽O Great King, take the child and come. The Great King took him

original: ma'i nang nas khyer nas 'ongs so //
analyzed: ma'i nang nas khyer nas 'ongs so //
translated: and carried him out from the mother's womb.

original: me de yang shin tu bsil ba tsha ba'i dngos po med do //
analyzed: me de yang shin tu bsil ba tsha ba'i dngos po med do //
translated: That fire became very cool, and the state of being hot was no more.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis blangs nas /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis blangs nas /
translated: The Perfectly Awakened One took him

original: byin gyis brlabs nas /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs nas /
translated: and blessed him.

original: dgra bcom pa gzhon nu 'od zer skyes zhes bya bar mtshan btags so //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa gzhon nu 'od zer skyes zhes bya bar mtshan btags so //
translated: He was named the Arhat Kumāra-Arciṣmān.

original: de nas gzugs can snying pos blangs te /
analyzed: de nas gzugs can snying pos blangs te /
translated: Then Bimbisāra took him

original: lha dang lha ma yin la sogs pas kyang bltas so //
analyzed: lha dang lha ma yin la sogs pas kyang bltas so //
translated: and the gods, asuras, and so forth also looked at him.

original: ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: How marvelous!

original: mi rnams kyis kyang ngo mtshar che'o zhes ltad mo bltas so //
analyzed: mi rnams kyis kyang ngo mtshar che'o zhes ltad mo bltas so //
translated: The humans also looked on, saying, How marvelous!

original: yang bcom ldan 'das la dad pa skyes nas /
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das la dad pa skyes nas /
translated: Then, having generated faith in the Blessed One,

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin la sogs pas /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin la sogs pas /
translated: Śakra, Lord of the Gods, and so forth,

original: lha rdzas kyi me tog gi char phab bo //
analyzed: lha rdzas kyi me tog gi char phab bo //
translated: caused a rain of divine flowers to fall.

original: lha'i dol mas mchod pa byas so //
analyzed: lha'i dol mas mchod pa byas so //
translated: The gods made offerings.

original: mu stegs gcer bu'i tshan pa de pham mo //
analyzed: mu stegs gcer bu'i tshan pa de pham mo //
translated: The group of naked tīrthikas was defeated.

original: bdud pham mo //🔽'od @60a * //
analyzed: bdud pham mo // 'od @60a * //
translated: The māras were defeated.🔽light

original: zer gyi dra ba kun du 'gyed pa zhes bya ba'i nges tshig go //
analyzed: zer gyi dra ba kun du 'gyed pa zhes bya ba'i nges tshig go //
translated: is the explanation of the name Radiating a Web of Light Rays.

original: mtshan mo mun pa'i nang na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan mo mun pa'i nang na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the darkness of the night means

original: mtshan mo ni dpe yin te /
analyzed: mtshan mo ni dpe yin te /
translated: the night is an example.

original: de bzhin du mtshan mo'i me ni shin tu gsal bas mtshan mo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan mo'i me ni shin tu gsal bas mtshan mo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the same way, the night is called bright because of the light of the night.

original: ro bo'i spo la me'i phung po chen po rab tu 'bar ba dang 'dra zhing zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ro bo'i spo la me'i phung po chen po rab tu 'bar ba dang 'dra zhing zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like a great blazing bonfire on a mountain peak means

original: dper na mi zhig gis ri bo chen po la 'bar ba mthong bzhin du'o //
analyzed: dper na mi zhig gis ri bo chen po la 'bar ba mthong bzhin du'o //
translated: for example, like a person seeing a great blazing fire on a mountain.

original: bcom ldan 'das gser gyi ri bo nas gshegs pa mthong bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gser gyi ri bo nas gshegs pa mthong bo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Seeing the Blessed One coming from Mount Suvarṇagiri means

original: gser zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gser zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Suvarṇa means

original: yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa'o //
translated: having good qualities.

original: ri bo chen po ltar zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'o //
analyzed: ri bo chen po ltar zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'o //
translated: Like a great mountain means the Bhagavat’s body.

original: lha ma me lhan ne zhes bya ba ni 'od zer sna tshogs so //
analyzed: lha ma me lhan ne zhes bya ba ni 'od zer sna tshogs so //
translated: Shining like the sun means various light rays.

original: rgyang ring po nas gshegs pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyang ring po nas gshegs pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They saw him coming from afar means

original: mun nag gi nang nas me 'bar ba mthon ba bzhin du mthong ngo //
analyzed: mun nag gi nang nas me 'bar ba mthon ba bzhin du mthong ngo //
translated: they saw him like a blazing fire in the darkness.

original: gshegs pa ni grong khyer yangs ba can gyi dbus su'o //
analyzed: gshegs pa ni grong khyer yangs ba can gyi dbus su'o //
translated: Coming means to the center of Vaiśālī.

original: mthong ba ni li tstsha b'i rnams kyis so //
analyzed: mthong ba ni li tstsha b'i rnams kyis so //
translated: Seeing means the Licchavis.

original: mthong ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni gus pa'i sems kyis bcom ldan 'das la'o //
analyzed: mthong ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni gus pa'i sems kyis bcom ldan 'das la'o //
translated: As soon as they saw him means with a respectful mind to the Bhagavat.

original: yangs pa can gyi li tstsha b'i rnams bcom ldan 'das la sems dad par gyur nas zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mthong nas sems de 'khril bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yangs pa can gyi li tstsha b'i rnams bcom ldan 'das la sems dad par gyur nas zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mthong nas sems de 'khril bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The Licchavis of Vaiśālī, having faith in the Bhagavat, means when sentient beings with afflictions see the Bhagavat, their minds are filled with faith.

original: sems dang par gyur pa de dag ces bya ba ni grong khyer yangs pa can gyi mi rnams so //🔽byi dor byed pa zhes bya ba ni dad pas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang par gyur pa de dag ces bya ba ni grong khyer yangs pa can gyi mi rnams so // byi dor byed pa zhes bya ba ni dad pas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byed pa'o //
translated: They are the ones who have swept and sprinkled the ground.

original: bcom ldan 'das yangs pa can gyi grong khyer chen por /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yangs pa can gyi grong khyer chen por /
translated: The Blessed One has entered the great city of Vaiśālī.

original: lam gang nas gshegs pa'i lam de 'phyag cing chag chag 'debs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lam gang nas gshegs pa'i lam de 'phyag cing chag chag 'debs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are sweeping and sprinkling the road on which the Blessed One will travel.

original: sangs rgyas gshegs pa'i lam la gzhan rnams kyis kyang tsanda na la sogs pa'i dri zhim po'i chus sa gzhi rnam par dag par byas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gshegs pa'i lam la gzhan rnams kyis kyang tsanda na la sogs pa'i dri zhim po'i chus sa gzhi rnam par dag par byas so //
translated: On the road taken by the Buddha, others have also purified the ground with fragrant water of sandalwood and so on.

original: byi dor legs byas me tog 'thor //
analyzed: byi dor legs byas me tog 'thor //
translated: They have swept and sprinkled, scattered flowers,

original: zhes bya ba ni sa gzhi mthon dman med par byas la me tog sna tshogs kyis sil mar bkram la me tog phreng ba'i du bas brgyan ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sa gzhi mthon dman med par byas la me tog sna tshogs kyis sil mar bkram la me tog phreng ba'i du bas brgyan ba'o //
translated: Meaning that they have made the ground even, scattered various flowers, and adorned it with garlands of incense.

original: dar gyi lnga lngi  dang / dril bu dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan sna tshogs kyis brgyan te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dar gyi lnga lngi  dang / dril bu dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan sna tshogs kyis brgyan te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: with bells, with parasols, with banners, with flags, with various ornaments.

original: grong khyer gyi phyogs bzhir yang bar snang gi phyogs su de rnams 'phyar ba'o //
analyzed: grong khyer gyi phyogs bzhir yang bar snang gi phyogs su de rnams 'phyar ba'o //
translated: In the sky above the four directions of the city, they waved those things.

original: bdugs spos sna tshogs kyis bdugs nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdugs spos sna tshogs kyis bdugs nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having perfumed with various incense,

original: @60b grong khyer gyi phyogs dang mtshams su bdug spos sna tshogs kyi bog phor gzhag ba dang bum pa gang ba bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: @60b grong khyer gyi phyogs dang mtshams su bdug spos sna tshogs kyi bog phor gzhag ba dang bum pa gang ba bzhag pa'o //
translated: in the directions and sub-directions of the city, they placed incense burners and filled vases.

original: ga la ba der song ste ga la ba der dong ste phyin pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ga la ba der song ste ga la ba der dong ste phyin pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having gone there, having gone there, having arrived,

original: gong khyer yangs pa can gyi dbus su'o //
analyzed: gong khyer yangs pa can gyi dbus su'o //
translated: in the center of the city of Vaiśālī.

original: zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having bowed their heads at his two feet,

original: grong khyer yangs ba can gyi mi rnams dang li tstsha b'i rnams kyis phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: grong khyer yangs ba can gyi mi rnams dang li tstsha b'i rnams kyis phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: the people of the city of Vaiśālī and the Licchavis paid homage.🔽Then,

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni phyag 'tshal gyi rting la'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni phyag 'tshal gyi rting la'o //
translated: after paying homage.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag gi mthil 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa'i ri mo can me tog padma'i snying po ltar 'jam pa zhes bya ba ni li tstsha b'i'i mgo la reg ba'o ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag gi mthil 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa'i ri mo can me tog padma'i snying po ltar 'jam pa zhes bya ba ni li tstsha b'i'i mgo la reg ba'o ;
translated: The Blessed One's palm, marked with a thousand-spoked wheel, soft like the heart of a lotus flower, touches the Licchavi's head.

original: ; sngon legs par spyad pa'i mtshan gyis brgyan pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus legs par brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: ; sngon legs par spyad pa'i mtshan gyis brgyan pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus legs par brgyan pa'o //
translated: Adorned with the marks of good conduct in the past means well-adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being and the eighty minor marks.

original: gzhon sha chags shing zhes bya ba ni lo bcu gnyis pa'i sha lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhon sha chags shing zhes bya ba ni lo bcu gnyis pa'i sha lta bu'o //
translated: Youthful means like the flesh of a twelve-year-old.

original: 'jam pa ni lus ngag yid gsum 'jam pos nyi ma'i 'od zer bas lhag pa'i 'od dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni nyi ma bdun gyi 'od zer dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam pa ni lus ngag yid gsum 'jam pos nyi ma'i 'od zer bas lhag pa'i 'od dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni nyi ma bdun gyi 'od zer dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Smooth means with smooth body, speech, and mind, possessing light surpassing the rays of the sun, possessing the rays of seven suns.

original: 'od zer brgya phrag mang po kun du 'phro ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'od zer brgya phrag mang po kun du 'phro ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Emitting many hundreds of light rays means🔽from the ūrṇā hair, the pores, the navel, the uṣṇīṣa on the head, the tongue, the nostrils,

original: mdzod spu 'am ba spu'i bu ga'am lte ba'i gnas sam dbu'i gtsug tor ram ljags sam sna'i bu ga'am /
analyzed: mdzod spu 'am ba spu'i bu ga'am lte ba'i gnas sam dbu'i gtsug tor ram ljags sam sna'i bu ga'am /
translated: or the eyes.

original: snyan nam spyan gyi sgo nas sems can gyi don la 'phrog ba'o //
analyzed: snyan nam spyan gyi sgo nas sems can gyi don la 'phrog ba'o //
translated: The ears are the doors of the eyes, which are sent out for the sake of sentient beings.

original: dri ma med pa'i phyag gis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i phyag gis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The stainless hands

original: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'o //
translated: are free from the stains of the afflictions.

original: li tstsha b'i rnams kyi mgo la byugs te zhes bya ba ni bram ze chen pos gsol ba btab pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi phyag spyi bor bzhag nas byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: li tstsha b'i rnams kyi mgo la byugs te zhes bya ba ni bram ze chen pos gsol ba btab pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi phyag spyi bor bzhag nas byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: The heads of the Licchavi are anointed, which means that the Great Brahman, having made a request, was blessed by the perfect Buddha placing his hand on his head.

original: rjes su bstan pa mdzad do zhes bya ba ni rjes su dran pa drug go //
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa mdzad do zhes bya ba ni rjes su dran pa drug go //
translated: The instruction is the six recollections.🔽Then,

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni litstsha b'i byin gyis brlabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni litstsha b'i byin gyis brlabs zhes bya'o //
translated: means the blessing of the Licchavi.

original: bcom ldan 'das yangs pa can gyi grong khyer chen po'i nang du gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yangs pa can gyi grong khyer chen po'i nang du gshegs pa ni /
translated: The Blessed One entered the great city of Vaiśālī,🔽in the middle of the city, at midnight,

original: grong khyer gyi dbus su nam gyi gung thun la zhes bya ba ni yi dags rgyu ba'i dus su'o //
analyzed: grong khyer gyi dbus su nam gyi gung thun la zhes bya ba ni yi dags rgyu ba'i dus su'o //
translated: which is the time when ghosts roam.

original: sgo skyes kyi gzhi zhabs kyis mnan nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sgo skyes kyi gzhi zhabs kyis mnan nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The door threshold is trodden with the feet.

original: dbang po'i phur pa la zhabs yang dag par bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i phur pa la zhabs yang dag par bzhag pa'o //
translated: He sat down on the tip of the vajra-peak.

original: phyogs bzher gzigs te zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi spyan gyis gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bzher gzigs te zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi spyan gyis gzigs pa'o //
translated: He looked in the four directions with the eye of wisdom.

original: phyag gser gyi mdog can brkyang nas zhes @61a * //
analyzed: phyag gser gyi mdog can brkyang nas zhes @61a * //
translated: He extended his golden-colored arm

original: bya ba ni /
analyzed: bya ba ni /
translated: and patted the earth.

original: sngon du song ba ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis /
analyzed: sngon du song ba ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis /
translated: He had previously attained the thirty-two marks of a great being

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: and the eighty minor marks.

original: na bza' bla gos gsol te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: na bza' bla gos gsol te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He put on his upper robe

original: mdzes pa'i chos gos phrag la gzar nas zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mdzes pa'i chos gos phrag la gzar nas zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: and draped his beautiful Dharma robe over his shoulder.

original: bka' stsal to zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'o ;
analyzed: bka' stsal to zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'o ;
translated: He spoke without error🔽to the nuns and others

original: ; phyi ma'i dus na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ; phyi ma'i dus na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: in the future age

original: sku mya ngan las 'das pa'o //🔽dge slong ma la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sku mya ngan las 'das pa'o // dge slong ma la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: after his parinirvāṇa.

original: bstan pa srung dgos pa'i dus su ste bkur sti byed pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa srung dgos pa'i dus su ste bkur sti byed pa'o //
translated: He said, “At the time when the teachings need to be protected,🔽anyone at all

original: gang su yang rung ba dag ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang su yang rung ba dag ces bya ba ni /
translated: who has faith in me🔽and who is devoted to me

original: byang chub sems dpa' lcang lo can rnams kyis bkur sti byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lcang lo can rnams kyis bkur sti byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas will honor him in the Aḍakavati.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung ring bsrel yungs 'bru tsam la mchod pa byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung ring bsrel yungs 'bru tsam la mchod pa byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Those who make offerings to the relics of the Tathāgata, even as small as a mustard seed,”

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar yod pa rnams kyi /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar yod pa rnams kyi /
translated: means those who exist in the past, future, and present.

original: sku gzugs dang gdung dang ring bsrel lta bu'o //
analyzed: sku gzugs dang gdung dang ring bsrel lta bu'o //
translated: They are like images, relics, and the like.

original: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo stong chen mo rab tu 'joms pa gdon thams cad las thar bar byed pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo stong chen mo rab tu 'joms pa gdon thams cad las thar bar byed pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The Dharma discourse called the Queen of the Thousand-Fold World-System, the Destroyer of Spells, the Liberator from All Evils,”

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin bdud bzhi po pham par byed pa /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin bdud bzhi po pham par byed pa /
translated: means the nature of emptiness, the conqueror of the four māras,

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa yang dag par 'grub pa /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa yang dag par 'grub pa /
translated: the perfect accomplishment of the creation stage and the completion stage,

original: sdug bsngal thams cad 'joms par byed ma /🔽ma rungs pa'i 'byung po rnams rlag par byed ma /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad 'joms par byed ma /🔽ma rungs pa'i 'byung po rnams rlag par byed ma /
translated: the destroyer of all suffering,🔽the destroyer of all evil spirits.

original: chos thams cad kyi 'byung gnas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel gyi skur snang ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi 'byung gnas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ring bsrel gyi skur snang ba'o //
translated: The source of all dharmas appears as the body of the Tathāgata’s relics.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi phyag rgya 'di zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi phyag rgya 'di zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly complete buddhas, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, say that this is the buddha seal.

original: stong chen mo rab tu 'joms ma 'di yang 'das pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srungs la sogs pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhis bsrung zhing /
analyzed: stong chen mo rab tu 'joms ma 'di yang 'das pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srungs la sogs pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhis bsrung zhing /
translated: This Destroyer of the Great Trichiliocosm was also protected by eighty-four quintillion buddhas, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, in the past, beginning with Buddha Kāśyapa.

original: phyag rgya'i rgyas btab pa de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa'i sangs rgyas byams pa la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i rgyas btab pa de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa'i sangs rgyas byams pa la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Just as it was sealed with the seal in the past, it will be the same for Maitreya, the future buddha, and so on.

original: de ltar yang sh'akya thub pa la sogs pas bsrung zhing phyag rgya'i rgyas btab pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang sh'akya thub pa la sogs pas bsrung zhing phyag rgya'i rgyas btab pa'o //
translated: In the same way, it was protected and sealed with the seal by Śākyamuni and so on.🔽Those who uphold, possess, read, and teach it

original: 'dzin cing 'chang ba dang / klog cing ston pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dzin cing 'chang ba dang / klog cing ston pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: To hold and possess means🔽 to read and to teach.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom ba /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom ba /
translated: The generation stage and completion stage meditations.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang kha ton du sngags dang mdo 'don pa dang / kun chub par byed pa de dag la zhes bya ba ni /🔽rgya cher chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / @61b gus par 'di las rgya cher spel nas bla mar byas /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang kha ton du sngags dang mdo 'don pa dang / kun chub par byed pa de dag la zhes bya ba ni / rgya cher chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / @61b gus par 'di las rgya cher spel nas bla mar byas /
translated: The mantra recitations and sūtra recitations done in samādhi and recitation, and the memorization of them.

original: mchod par byas pa'o //
analyzed: mchod par byas pa'o //
translated: The turning of the wheel of the Dharma in detail, and the respect for, the promotion of, and the worship of this [Dharma] in detail.

original: yams kyi nad dang 'jigs pa dang / 'tshe ba dang / nad 'go ba dang / 'khrug pa dang / 'thab pa dang / 'ching ba dang / kha mchu dang / shags dang / tha na phra ma dang sdig pa mi dge ba sdug bsngal ba'i las kyis mi tshugs shing 'tshe bar byed pa thams cad kyis mi thub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni greng  yangs pa can gyi dbus su 'khor gyi nang du bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: yams kyi nad dang 'jigs pa dang / 'tshe ba dang / nad 'go ba dang / 'khrug pa dang / 'thab pa dang / 'ching ba dang / kha mchu dang / shags dang / tha na phra ma dang sdig pa mi dge ba sdug bsngal ba'i las kyis mi tshugs shing 'tshe bar byed pa thams cad kyis mi thub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni greng  yangs pa can gyi dbus su 'khor gyi nang du bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: The protection from all harm, such as epidemics, fears, violence, diseases, quarrels, fights, bonds, lawsuits, and disputes, and even from slander and unwholesome actions that lead to suffering. This was spoken in the middle of the assembly in Vaiśālī.

original: bcom ldan 'das la mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pas 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pas 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Brahma, the Lord of the Sahā world, said to the Blessed One:

original: mnyam pa nyid du khyab pa'i sangs rgyas la /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid du khyab pa'i sangs rgyas la /
translated: To the Buddha, who pervades with equality,

original: 'jig rten gyi mes pos zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi mes pos zhus pa'o //
translated: the grandfather of the world makes a request.

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The venerable Blessed One means

original: sku gsung thugs btsun pa dka' thub mdzad pa /
analyzed: sku gsung thugs btsun pa dka' thub mdzad pa /
translated: the one with a venerable body, speech, and mind, who practices austerities,

original: bdud rnams bcom zhing pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyon mongs pa lnga las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bdud rnams bcom zhing pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyon mongs pa lnga las 'das pa'o //
translated: has conquered the demons, and has gone beyond the six perfections and five afflictions.

original: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo stong chen mo rab tu 'joms ma zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rig sngags kyi rgyal mo stong chen mo rab tu 'joms ma zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The queen of knowledge mantras called Destroyer of the Great Trichiliocosm means🔽the Dharma discourse that liberates from all afflictions, which has the nature of the four seals, like the relics of the Tathāgatas. Without obstacles means

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ring bsrel lta bu phyag rgya bzhi'i ngo bo'i gdon thams cad las thar bar byed pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs zhes bya ba ni bar chod med pa bdud rnams kyis mi tshugs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ring bsrel lta bu phyag rgya bzhi'i ngo bo'i gdon thams cad las thar bar byed pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs zhes bya ba ni bar chod med pa bdud rnams kyis mi tshugs pa ste /
translated: that which cannot be harmed by demons,

original: 'di'i lam nas thar pa thob pa /
analyzed: 'di'i lam nas thar pa thob pa /
translated: from which liberation is attained.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i ye shes stong pa nyid du snang ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i ye shes stong pa nyid du snang ba'o //
translated: It is the appearance of emptiness as non-conceptual wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi phyag rgya de gang lags zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi phyag rgya de gang lags zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is the Buddha's seal of the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones who are as numerous as the sands of the Ganges?

original: stong chen mo rab tu 'joms ma 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar yod pas gsungs pa gsang sngags kyi tshig zhus pa'o //
analyzed: stong chen mo rab tu 'joms ma 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar yod pas gsungs pa gsang sngags kyi tshig zhus pa'o //
translated: This is the request for the mantra words spoken by the past, future, and present teachers of the Great Thousand Destruction.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having thus requested,

original: mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa'o //
analyzed: mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa'o //
translated: the Lord of the Saha World addressed the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Blessed One said to the Lord of the Saha World:

original: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa sprul pa'i skus bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa sprul pa'i skus bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: The Emanation Body endowed with the thirty-two marks and adorned with the eighty minor marks said this.

original: tshangs pa de'i phyir khyod legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang ngas khyod la bshad do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshangs pa de'i phyir khyod legs par nyon la yid la zung shig dang ngas khyod la bshad do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Brahma, for that reason, listen well and keep it in mind, and I will explain it to you.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin sdug bsngal thams cad 'joms @62a * //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin sdug bsngal thams cad 'joms @62a * //
translated: The mantra that has the nature of the perfections and destroys all suffering

original: par byed pa'i gsang sngags sangs rgyas kyis sems can gyi don la bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: par byed pa'i gsang sngags sangs rgyas kyis sems can gyi don la bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: was spoken by the Buddha for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das de ltar 'tshal lo zhes gsol nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das de ltar 'tshal lo zhes gsol nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Blessed One said, Very well, Blessed One,

original: mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pas kyang gus par /
analyzed: mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pas kyang gus par /
translated: and Brahma, the lord of the saha world, respectfully

original: bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba btab pa'o ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba btab pa'o ;
translated: made a request to the Blessed One.

original: ; mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pas bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar nyan pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ; mi mjed kyi bdag po tshangs pas bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar nyan pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When Brahma, the lord of the saha world, listened to the Blessed One as instructed,

original: 'khor rnam bzhi dang tshangs pas dbu mdzad pa mi dang mi ma yin pa'i tshogs rnams 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor rnam bzhi dang tshangs pas dbu mdzad pa mi dang mi ma yin pa'i tshogs rnams 'joms pa'o //
translated: and the fourfold assembly, with Brahma at the head, the assembly of humans and non-humans, were destroyed.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Then the Blessed One said this:
